SourceText: You don’t have to do this alone! Please feel free to share your ParentText journey with other adults in your household and elsewhere. They might want to sign up to receive the messages too!
text: Awufanelanga ukuba ukwenze wedwa oku! Nceda uzive ukhululekile ukwabelana ngohambo lwakho lweParentText nabanye abantu abadala emzini wakho kunye nakwenye indawo. Banokufuna ukusayina ukuze bafumane imiyalezo nabo!

SourceText: If you have already noticed some changes in your life or relationship with your children, that's great!
text: Ukuba ngaba sele uqaphele utshintsho ebomini bakho okanye kubudlelwane nabantwana bakho, kwakuhle oko!

SourceText: If you have not noticed any changes, please keep it up. Sometimes these things take time to change. We know you can do it!
text: Ukuba uqaphele naluphi na utshintsho, nceda ugcine kunjalo. Ngamanye amaxesha  ezi zithatha ixesha ukutshintsha. Siyazi ukuba ungakwenza oko!

SourceText: If you have not noticed any changes, please keep it up. Sometimes these things take time to change. I know you can do it!
text: Ukuba uqaphele naluphi na utshintsho, nceda ugcine kunjalo. Ngamanye amaxesha  ezi zithatha ixesha ukutshintsha. Ndiyazi ukuba ungakwenza oko!

SourceText: It can be exhausting when your children have too much energy or can't focus on one thing. Sometimes, your children need opportunities to be very active and run around to help them be calm afterwards.
text: Unokudinwa xa abantwana bakho benamandla amaninzi okanye bengakwazi ukujolisa kwinto enye. Ngamanye amaxesha, abantwana bakho bafuna amathuba ukuba bashukume kakhulu kwaye babaleke begqiba yonke indawo ukubanceda bazole emva koko.

SourceText: Would you like suggestions for active and calm things to do with your child?
text: Ungathanda ukufumana iingcebiso malunga nezinto ezishukumisa umzimba nezizolisayo onokuzenza nomntwana wakho?

SourceText: Remember that you’re in charge of what they eat, but not how much. Newborns have stomach the size of a grape! They need to eat often (sometimes in the middle of the night). It’s important to build trust around eating, especially as your baby starts on solid food. Let them know you are listening to their wishes in the eating department. They’ll be ravenous again soon!
text: Khumbula ukuba nguwe owongamele into abayityayo, kodwa hayi ukuba kangakanani. Iimveku ezisanda kuzalwa zinezisu ezibukhulu bungangomdiliya! Kufuneka zitye rhoqo (ngamanye amaxesha ezinzulwini zobusuku) Kubalulekile ukwakha ukuthembana malunga nokutya, ingakumbi kuba usana lwakho luqala ukutya ukutya okuqinileyo. Benze baqonde ukuba uyimamele iminqweno yabo yecandelo lokutya. Baza kulamba ngokukhawuleza kwakhona msinyane!

SourceText: Your baby will cry as soon as a caregiver’s attention is diverted and are cranky as well as clingy. Prioritise being there for them and give them physical contact when needed.
text: Usana lwakho luza kukhala msinyane nje ukuba isuke ingqalelo yomgcini kwaye bayatefa besithi nca. Kubeke phambili ukuba kholo bona kwaye ubaphathe xa kufuneka.

SourceText: Would you like to learn more?
text: Ungathanda ukufunda ngokungaphaya?

SourceText: Your baby or toddler may sometimes want something that they cannot have. If they start whining, first check to see if there is something wrong (are they actually hungry or tired)? If they continue, try to redirect their attention to something else. You should also try to ignore their behaviour while attending to them for comfort and support
text: Usana okanye umntwana wakho osabhadazayo unokufuna  into angeke ayifumane ngamanye amaxesha. Ukuba uyaqala ukukhwina, khangela kuqala ukuba  kukho into engalunganga na (ingaba ulambile okanye udiniwe)? Ukuba uyaqhuba, zama ukusa ingqalelo yakhe kwenye into. Kufuneka uzame ukungayihoyi kananjalo indlela aziphethe  ngayo xa umthuthuzela okanye umxhasa

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.
text: Uxolo, andiqondi ukuba uthetha ukuthini.

SourceText: Check to see why @fields.child_nickname is in a bad mood. Are they tired or hungry? Or maybe they are not feeling well? Or maybe they need some more loving attention. Be a reassuring presence for @fields.child_nickname when they are having a difficult day.

SourceText: Check to see why your baby is in a bad mood. Are they tired or hungry? Or maybe they are not feeling well? Or maybe they need some more loving attention. Be a reassuring presence for your baby when they are having a difficult day.
text: Khangela ubone ukuba kutheni usana lwakho lukwimo embi. Ingaba udiniwe okanye ulambile? Okanye mhlawumbi akaphilanga? Okanye ufuna ingqalelo engaphaya yothando. Yiba khona uqinisekisa kusana lwakho xa lunemini enzima.

SourceText: Unfortunately, your baby will go through phases for the next 2 years of sleeping poorly. Try wearing @fields.child_nickname close to you, feeding them and carrying them in a sling. And hang in there, remember it’s a phase. You and @fields.child_nickname will get through it together!
text: Ngelishwa usana lwakho  luza kudlula kwizigaba kwiminyaka emi-2 yokulala kakubi.  Zama ukumsondeza u @fields.child_nickname kufutshane kuwe uze umphathe ngesilingi. Kwaye ubambelele apho ke, khumbula sisigaba. Wena no @fields.child_nickname niza kudlula kunye koku!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Unfortunately, your baby will go through phases for the next 2 years of sleeping poorly. Try wearing your baby close to you, feeding them and carrying them in a sling. And hang in there, remember it’s a phase. You and your baby will get through it together!
text: Ngelishwa usana lwakho  luza kudlula kwizigaba kwiminyaka emi-2 yokulala kakubi.  Zama ukumsondeza u  kufutshane kuwe uze umphathe ngesilingi. Kwaye ubambelele apho ke, khumbula sisigaba. Wena nosana lwakho niza kudlula kunye koku!

SourceText: Pay close attention to @fields.child_nickname in case they try something dangerous! Just because they are able to play on their own now, doesn’t mean you can look away for long. Redirect mischievous behaviours into practice waving, imitation games, singing and moving games and pretending to talk on the phone!
text: Nika inqalelo esondeleyo ku @fields.child_nickname kwimeko yokuba abe nokuzama into eyingozi! Ukukwazi kwakhe ukuzidlalela ngokwakhe ngoku, akuthethi ukuba ungajonga kwenye indawo xesha elide. Yisa ukuziphatha  okunentlondi ekuziqhelaniseni nokuwangawangisa, imidlalo yokulinganisa, ukucula kunye nemidlalo eshukumisayo kunye nokuzenza ngathi uthetha emnxebeni!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Pay close attention to your baby in case they try something dangerous! Just because they are able to play on their own now, doesn’t mean you can look away for long. Redirect mischievous behaviours into practice waving, imitation games, singing and moving games and pretending to talk on the phone!
text: Nika ingqalelo esondeleyo kusana lwakho kwimeko yokuba lube nokuzama into eyingozi! Ukukwazi kwakhe ukuzidlalela ngokwakhe ngoku, akuthethi ukuba ungajonga kwenye indawo xesha elide. Yisa ukuziphatha  okunentlondi ekuziqhelaniseni nokuwangawangisa, imidlalo yokulinganisa, ukucula kunye nemidlalo eshukumisayo kunye nokuzenza ngathi uthetha emnxebeni!

SourceText: Try to stay calm and support @fields.child_nickname as they move through the tantrum. Your priority is to ensure that they don’t hurt themselves. Don’t add to @fields.child_nickname’s anger by shouting and showing angry emotions. This won’t help.
text: Zama ukuhlala uzolile kwaye uxhasa  @fields.child_nickname njengoko esiba nomsindo. Okuphambili kuwe kukuqinisekisa ukuba akazonzakalisi. Ungongezi kumsindo ka @fields.child_nickname ngokukhwaza kunye nokubonakalisa iimvakalelo zokuba nomsindo. Ngeke kuncede oku!

SourceText: Try to stay calm and support your toddler as they move through the tantrum. Your priority is to ensure that they don’t hurt themselves. Don’t add to your child’s anger by shouting and showing angry emotions. This won’t help.
text: Zama ukuhlala uzolile kwaye uxhasa njengoko esiba nomsindo. Okuphambili kuwe kukuqinisekisa ukuba akazonzakalisi. Ungongezi kumsindo  womntwana wakho ngokukhwaza kunye nokubonakalisa iimvakalelo zokuba nomsindo. Ngeke kuncede oku!

SourceText: Babies are much more likely to want to do things if you make the activity fun and playful. Patience is also a must. Take a deep breath if you notice yourself getting frustrated by @fields.child_nickname.
text: Iintsana zinokufuna ukwenza izinto ukuba ngaba wenza ibe ngowolonwabo kunye nowokudlala umsetyenzana. Umonde unyanzelekile kananjalo. Phefumla nzulu xa uqaphela ukuba uyakhathazwa ngu @fields.child_nickname.

SourceText: Babies are much more likely to want to do things if you make the activity fun and playful. Patience is also a must. Take a deep breath if you notice yourself getting frustrated by your baby.

SourceText: All children behave badly sometimes. Here are a list of typical behaviours that can be challenging for parents:

SourceText: It is hard to find time to have fun with your children. How many days in the past week did you do something fun together? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Kunzima ukuba nexesha lokonwaba nabantwana bakho. Ziintsuku ezingaphi kwiveki ephelileyo eniye nenza ngazo izinto ezonwabisayo kunye? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: If you don't want to answer, please type 99.
text: Ukuba ngaba awufuni ukuphendula, nceda uchwetheze ama-99.

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Please reply with a number between 0 and 7.
text: Uxolo, andiqondi ukuba uthetha ukuthini. Nceda uphendule ngenani eliphakathi kwe-0 ne-7.

SourceText: Amazing that you keep doing fun things with your child. You are the best parent they could wish for!
text: Kuyamangalisa ukuba uyaqhuba usenza izinto ezonwabisayo nomntwana wakho. Ungumzali ogqwesileyo angamnqwenela!

SourceText: Great that you are setting aside time with your child – it is THE foundation for a happy home!
text: Kuhle ke kuba ubekela ixesha umntwana wakho - sisiseko sekhaya elinolonwabo!

SourceText: Finding time to do something fun with your child can be hard, I understand! The great thing is that spending time together will make other things go easier – you will see!
text: Ukufumana ixesha lokwenza into eyonwabisayo nomntwana wakho kunokuba nzima, ndiyaqonda! Into entle ke kukuba ukuchitha ixesha kunye kuza kwenza ezinye izinto zibe lula - uza kubona!

SourceText: Give yourself credit for trying. A 5 minutes of fun activity with your child a day can make a BIG difference.
text: Zincome ngokuzama. Imizuzu emi-5 yolonwabo nomntwana wakho inokwenza umahluko OMKHULU.

SourceText: Life can get so busy sometimes, I know! If you start spending time together doing one small activity, it will get easier over time!
text: Ubomi bunokuxakekisa ngamanye amaxesha, ndiyazi! Ukuba niqala ukuchitha ixesha kunye nisenza umsetyenzana omncinci, kuza kuba lula ngokuhamba kwexesha!

SourceText: In our busy lives, it's hard to focus on the positive. How many days in the past week have you praised your child? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Kubomi bethu obuxakekileyo, kunzima ukunikela ingqalelo kwizinto ezikhuthazayo. Kwiveki ephelileyo, uye wamncoma iintsuku ezingaphi umntwana wakho (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: We all sometimes feel like our children are causing more negativity than positivity. Try to see through negative attitudes and praise any positive behaviour you notice. With time, you will see the change!
text: Sonke  ngamanye amaxesha sinemvakalelo yokuba abantwana bethu babanga okubi kunokuhle. Zama ukubona ngaphaya kwezimvo ezibi kwaye uncome nakuphi na ukuziphatha okuhle okuqaphelayo. Ngokuhamba kwexesha, uza kubona utshintsho!

SourceText: This is a very stressful time for families. How many days in the past week did you feel very stressed as a parent/caregiver? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Eli lixesha elibangela uxinzeleko kwiintsapho. Kwiveki ephelileyo, ngaba njengomzali/umnakekeli uye waziva uxinezelekile? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: Would you like a brief activity to help you with stress?
text: Ungathanda ukwenza umsetyenzana omfutshane wokukunceda ngoxinzelelo?

SourceText: Would like a brief relaxing activity now?
text: Ungathanda umsetyenzana omfutshane wokukwenza ukhululeke ngoku?

SourceText: Sometimes our children make us really upset. How many days in the past week did you shout, scream, or yell at your children? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Ngamanye amaxesha, abantwana bethu bakhe basicaphukise. Kwiveki ephelileyo, zingaphi iintsuku oye wangxolisa, wakhwaza, okanye wabakrasela ngazo abantwana bakho? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: It can be difficult to control our anger, especially when they make us really angry. Take a deep breath, and be proud of yourself when you manage to do it!
text: Kunzima ukulawula umsindo wethu, ingakumbi xa besenza sibe nomsindo ngenene. Phefumla nzulu, kwaye uzidle ngawe xa ukwazi ukwenza konke!

SourceText: Sorry that you are having a difficult time with your child. It happens to all of us. Remember, we can choose to behave differently next time.
text: Ndibuhlungu ngokuba  ube nexesha elinzima nomntwana wakho. Kuyenzeka kuthi sonke. Khumbula, sinokukhetha ukuziphatha ngokwahlukileyo kwixesha elizayo.

SourceText: Being a parent is not easy. Try to be patient with yourself and your family, and take some space if you need it. By talking about our challenges calmly, we can solve them together!
text: Ukuba ngumzali akululanga. Zama ukuba nomonde ngawe nosapho lwakho, kwaye uthathe isithuba xa usifuna. Ngokuthetha ngemingeni yethu, sinokuyisombulula kunye!

SourceText: Great work! When we respond calmly, our teens are more likely to do the same.
text: Umsebenzi omhle! Xa siphendula ngokuzolileyo, uliutsha lwethu kunokwenzeka ukuba nalo lwenze oko kufanayo.

SourceText: Our children can really drive us crazy sometimes. By responding calmly, they will learn to do the same when something upsets them at home or outside. Your patience will pay off, you will see!
text: Abantwana bethu basihlupha kakhulu ngamanye amaxesha. Ngokuphendula ngokuzolileyo, baza kufunda  ukwenza okufanayo xa kukho into ebakhathazayo ekhaya okanye ngaphandle. Umonde wakho uza kukunceda, uza kubona!

SourceText: It is so stressful when children misbehave. How many days in the past week did you physically discipline your children by hitting, spanking, or slapping with your hand or an object like a stick or a belt? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Xa abantwana begeza, oko kubangela uxinezeleko. Kwiveki ephelileyo, ngaba abantwana bakho uye wabaqeqesha ngokubabetha, ukubabetha ezimpundu okanye ukubabetha ngesandla sakho okanye ngenye into efana noswazi okanye ibhanti? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: We all struggle to stay calm sometimes. Take a deep breath and remember that mistakes are human. Talking to your child will help more in the end – you are an awesome parent!
text: Sonke siyasokola ukuhlala sizolile ngamanye amaxesha. Phefumla nzulu kwaye ukhumbule ukuba iimpazamo zezomntu. Ukuthetha nomntwana wakho kuza kunceda ngokungaphaya ekugqibeleni - ungumzali omangalisayo!

SourceText: It can be so difficult to keep calm when things get out of hand. Try again next time – each day is a new opportunity!
text: Kunokuba nzima  ukuhlala uzolile xa izinto zingahambi kakuhle. Zama kwakhona kwixesha elizayo - usuku ngalunye lithuba!

SourceText: It sounds like you are having a difficult time with your child. This can be really hard so be patient with yourself. Try to take a pause (even one deep breath!) next time and respond differently. You can do it!
text: Kuvakala ngathi unexesha elinzima nomntwana wakho. Kunokuba nzima kakhulu oku ngoko ke yiba nomonde kuwe. Zama ukuphumla (nokuba kukuphefumla nzulu kanye_ kwixesha elizayo kwaye uphendule ngokwahlukileyo. Ungakwenza oku!

SourceText: Money is one of the biggest stresses for families now. How many days in the past week have you felt very worried or anxious about money? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)
text: Imali yenye yezona zinto zinkulu ezibangela uxinzelelo kwiintsapho ngoku. Kwiveki ephelileyo, zingaphi iintsuku oye wakhathazeka ngazo okanye waxhalaba ngemali? (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7)

SourceText: How many days in the past month (30 days) did you run out of money to pay for food? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?
text: Kwinyanga edlulileyo (iintsuku ezingama-30), zingaphi iintsuku oye waphelelwa ngazo yimali yokuthenga ukutya? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Please reply with a number between 0 and 30.
text: Uxolo, andiqondi ukuba uthetha ukuthini. Nceda uphendule ngenani eliphakathi kwe-0 ne-30.

SourceText: It can sometimes be difficult to have a positive relationship with our children. How confident do you feel about your ability as a parent/caregiver to have a positive relationship with your children? (0=not confident to 7=extremely confident)
text: Ngamanye amaxesha kunokuba nzima ukuba nobudlelwane obuhle nabantwana bethu. Uziva uzithemba kangakanani ngokukwazi kwakho njengomzali/umgcini ukuba nobudlelwane obuhle nabantwana bakho? (0=awuzithembanga ukuya kwisi-7= uzithembe ngokugqithisileyo)

SourceText: Having a positive relationship with our children can be difficult, especially during stressful times. You might want to try spending a little more One-on-One Time with your child. It will show them that they are valued and loved.
text: Ukuba nobudlelwane obuhle nabantwana bakho kunokuba nzima, ingakumbi ngamaxesha anoxinzelelo. Unokufuna ukuzama ukuchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso elincinci nomntwana wakho. Kuza kubonisa ukuba baxatyisiwe kwaye bayathandwa.

SourceText: It is so wonderful to hear that you are able to maintain a positive relationship with your children. They really benefit from having you as a source of love and support in their lives.
text: Kuyamangalisa ukuva ukuba uyakwazi ukugcina ubudlelwane obuhle nabantwana bakho. Bazuza ngokwenene ngokuba nawe njengomthombo wolwazi kunye nenkxaso ebomini babo.

SourceText: Bonus question: We all want to keep our children safe. In the past month, have you talked with your child about keeping safe from sexual violence online or offline? This could be when they are going out with friends, or talking about the websites they use.
text: Umbuzo webhonasi: Sonke sifuna abantwana bethu bahlale bekhuselekile. Kwinyanga ephelileyo uke wathetha nomntwana wakho malunga nokukhuseleka kubundlobongela besini kwi-intanethi kunye nangaphandle kweintanethi? Oku kunokwenzeka xa bekunye neetshomi zabo okanye bethetha ngeewebhusayithi abazisebenzisayo.

SourceText: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Please reply with either yes or no.
text: Uxolo, andiqondi ukuba uthetha ukuthini. Nceda uphendule mhlawumbi ngoewe okanye uhayi.

SourceText: How many days have you had a talk like this? ? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?
text: Nibe nentetho enje iintsuku ezingaphi? (0, 1, 2, 3, ... 30)?

SourceText: Being a parent is not easy. It can be difficult to know how to keep our children safe. We often feel powerless as parents in this, but we are here to support you!
text: Ukuba ngumzali akululanga. Kunokubanzima ukwazi indlela yokugcina abantwana bethu  bekhuselekile. Njengabazali, siye singabi nawo amandla kulo mbandela, kodwa sikhona ukuze sikuxhase!

SourceText: Being a parent is not easy. Well done for focusing on keeping your child safe.
text: Ukuba ngumzali akululanga. Usebenzile ngokujolisa  ekugcineni umntwana wakho  ekhuselekile.

SourceText: That is okay! Here is a list of some of the risks and dangers that you may encounter online:
text: Kulungile! Nalu uluhlu lwemingcipheko kunye neengozi  onokuhlangabezana nazo kwi-intanethi:

SourceText: • Adults targeting people for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.
text: • Abantu abadala abajolise ebantwini ngeenjongo zezesondo kumakhasi onxibelelwano, ekudlaleni, kunye nakumaqonga emiyalezo.

SourceText: • Harmful content – like violence, hating women, hating foreigners, encouraging suicide and self-harm, misinformation, pornography
text: • Isiqulatho esiyingozi – njengobundlobongela, ukuzonda abasetyhini, ukuzonda abemi bamazwe angaphandle, ukukhuthaza ukuzibulala nokuzenzakalisa, ukunika ulwazi olungelulo, imifanekiso yabantu abahamba ngaze

SourceText: • Sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos.
text: • Ukwabelana ngolwazi lobuqu kunye neefoto  neevidiyo zezesondo.

SourceText: • Cyberbullying from other people and strangers.
text: • Ukugculelwa kwi-intanethi okuvela kwabanye abantu kunye nabantu ongabaziyo.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Here is a review on quick technical fixes:

SourceText: First person gets to choose or sing a song.
text: Umntu wokuqala uza kukhetha okanye acule iculo.

SourceText: Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder they can guess the singer).
text: Wonke omnye umntu kufanele aqashisele igama leculo (ukuze nilenze nzima angaqashisela nomntu oliculayo).

SourceText: Hi! How are you feeling?
text: Molo! Uziva njani namhlanje?

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. It is completely normal to be going through a difficult time now. Remember that you are not alone.
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba alumnandanga usuku lwakho. Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukuba nexesha elinzima ngoku. Khumbula ukuba awukho wedwa.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you get through the day!
text: Nantsi ividiyo eza kukwenza ukuba udlule kolu suku!

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you get through the day!
text: Nanku umyalezo omanyelwayo oza kukwenza ukuba udlule kolu suku!

SourceText: Here is a short activity that can help when you are feeling like needing some more support to get through the day.
text: Nanku umsetyenzana omfutshane onokukunceda xa uziva ngathi ufuna inkxaso engaphaya ukudlula kusuku.

SourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Qonda ukuba kwenzeka ntoni kuwe ngeli thuba. Ucinga ntoni? Ngaba iingcinga zakho zintle okanye zimbi. Uziva njani? Uziva kamnandi okanye kakubi? Uvakala njani umzimba wakho? Uziva uwubambile umzimba okanye ukhululekile?

SourceText: Sit comfortably and close your eyes. Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest. Say the following words silently to yourself:
text: Hlala kwindawo entofontofo uze uvale amehlo akho. Nxibelelana nentlziyo yakho ngendlela enobubele. Usenokufuna ukubeka isandla sakho phezu kwentliziyo okanye kwesifuba sakho. Zixelele la magama alandelayo ngokuthuleyo.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Notice if you feel any different.
text: Thatha ithutyana ukuze ucinge nzulu ngamava akho. Qaphela ukuba  uziva ngayo nayiphi indlela eyahlukileyo.

SourceText: May I be peaceful.
text: Kwanga ndinganoxolo.

SourceText: May I be safe.
text: Kwanga ndingakhuseleka.

SourceText: May I be healthy.
text: Kwanga ndingasempilweni.

SourceText: May I be happy.
text: Kwanga ndingonwaba.

SourceText: May there be love in my family.
text: Kwanga kungakho uthando kusapho  lwam.

SourceText: May I feel loved.
text: Kwanga ndingaziva ndithandwa.

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Have you tried involving your partner when making decisions recently?

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried involving your partner when making decisions recently?
text: Molo! Ingaba uzamile ukubandakanya iqabane lakho xa usenza izigqibo kutsha nje?

SourceText: How was your experience?
text: Ebenjani amava akho?

SourceText: That is fantastic!
text: Kwakuhle ke oko!

SourceText: Would you like to review the content on this?
text: Ungathanda ukusiqwalasela kwakhona esi siqulatho?

SourceText: It can be difficult to find the time to ask our partners for their opinions when we are making decisions. Can you think of a time during the day when both you and your partner might be less busy, such as early in the morning or later in the evening?
text: Kunokuba nzima ukufumana ixesha  lokubuza amaqabane ethu ngezimvo zawo xa sisenza izigqibo. Ungacinga bngexesha  ngexa lasemini xa nobabini wena neqabane lakho ninokuba anixakekanga kakhulu, njengakwangoko kusasa okanye mva ngokuhlwa?

SourceText: Sorry to hear that your partner reacted negatively. Be proud of yourself for trying and be gentle with yourself. Remember you can always get extra support by typing "Help".
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba iqabane lakho liphendule kakubi. Zidle ngawo ngokuzama kunye nokuba nobunono kuwe. Khumbula ukuba ungasoloko uyifumana  inkxaso engaphaya  ngokuchwetheza “Help”.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to know how to involve your partner when making a decision. Sometimes all you need to do is to ask them what they think. This shows them you care and want them to be involved!
text: Kunokuba nzima ngamanye amaxesha ukubandakanya iqabane lakho xa usenza isigqibo. Okufunayo nje ngamanye amaxesha kukubuza ukuba licinga ntoni. Oku kubonisa ukuba uyakhathala kwaye ufuna ukuba libandakanyeke!

SourceText: It can be hard to remember to involve our partners in decision making. If you forget, it’s important to try again! Asking them for their opinion shows them that you care and want them to be involved.
text: Kunokuba nzima ukukhumbula ukubandakanya amaqabane ethu ekwenziweni kwezigqibo. Ukuba ulibele, kubalulekile ukuba uzame kwakhona! Ukubuza izimvo zabo kubabonisa ukuba uyakhathala kwaye ufuna ukuba babandakanyeke.

SourceText: It can take time to get used to making decisions together. Give yourself time to adjust. Remember that by communicating with your partner and involving them in decision-making, they will start to feel more comfortable doing so too.
text: Kunokuthatha ixesha ukuqhela ukwenza izigqibo kunye. Zinike ixesha lokuziqhelanisa. Khumbula ukuba ngokunxibelelana neqabane lakho kunye nokulibandakanya ekwenziweni kwezigqibo, liza kuqala  ukuziva likhululeke ngokungaphaya nalo ngokwenza njalo.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear this. What did you find difficult when trying to involve your partner in making a decision?
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva oku. Yintoni oyifumanise inmzima xa ubuzama ukubandakanya iqabane lakho ekwenziweni kwezigqibo?

SourceText: Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. When you are ready, open your eyes again. Everything is okay.
text: Hlala phantsi, vala amehlo akho uze umamele umphefumlo wakho njengoko uwungenisa ngaphakathi kwaye uwukhuphela ngaphandle. Qaphela indlela oziva ngayo. Xa sele ukulungele, phinda uvule amehlo akho. Yonke into ilungile.

SourceText: We hope that was helpful! Remember you can always type "Help" at anytime if you need an activity to help you relax or reduce stress. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Siyathemba ukuba kube luncedo oko! Khumbula ukusoloko  uchwetheza  “Uncedo” ngalo naliphi na ixesha ukuba ngaba ufuna umsetyenzana wokukunceda uphumle okanye wehlise uxinzelelo.. Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva @fields.user_name!

text: Ungathanda ukufunda  maluinga neli cebo?

SourceText: Here's an audio message to guide you through a fun physical activity!
text: Nanku umyalezo omanyelwayo wokukukhokela kumsetyenzana wolonwabo osebenzisa umzimba!

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up like you are reaching to the sky. Pretend to push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Yima uze wolule iingalo zakho ziye phezulu ngokungathi ufikelela ezibhakabhakeni. Yenza ngathi utyhala nawaphi na amafu uze uvumele ilanga libengezele kuwe. Yolulela kumacala omabini. Zolule ngaphambili nangasemva.

SourceText: Here's a fun video of a physical activity that can help you release stress and keep healthy!
text: Nabtsi ividiyo yolonwabo yomsetyenzana obandakanya umzimba enokukunceda ukhuphe uxinzelelo kwaye uzigcine usempilweni!

SourceText: Let your hand hang by your side. As you breathe in, squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears, scrunch your eyes and face, and hold your breath. Release your breath and then relax your shoulders and body.
text: Yenza isandla sakho sijinge  kwicala lakho. Cinezela amagxa ngokuqinileyo enyuka esiya  ngasezindlebeni njengoko uphefumla, nciphisa amehlo akho nobuso, uze ubambe umoya wakho. Khupha umoya wakho uze uyekelele amagxa akho kunye nomzimba.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let your arms swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Yekelela iingalo zakho uze wenze iingalo zakho zijiwule emacaleni, e ujike nomzimba wakho wangasentla. Iingalo zakho mazibethe umqolo wakho kancinci njengeko ujika usiya kwelinye icala.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beka unyawo olunye phambi kolunye uze wenze izangqa  ezincinci ngamaqatha, khumbula ukujikela  kuwo omabini amacala. Unyawo ngalunye malwenze izangqa ezine kwicala ngalinye.

SourceText: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Ngoku shukumisa umzimba wakho wonke ngokukhawuleza kangoko unako. Wushukumise uye phezulu! Wushukumise uye ezantsi! Wushukumise uye macala onke!

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.
text: Vala amehlo akho uze uphakamise iingalo zakho ucotha ziye entla kwentloko yakho njengoko utsala umoya. Thoba iingalo zakho ngokucotha zize zibe secaleni njengoko ukhupha umoya.

SourceText: Would you like some  other relaxation activities?
text: Ingaba ungayithanda eminye imisetyenzana yokuphumlisa?

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience.
text: Thatha ithutyana ukuze ucinge nzulu ngamava akho.

SourceText: Well done for trying! How was your experience?
text: Usebenzile ngokuzama! Ebenjani amava akho?

SourceText: Sometimes it can be hard to find time during the day. Can you think of a time when you’re less busy? For example, maybe it is easier to help out with housework later in the evening when some of the children have gone to sleep. Try to see what works for you!
text: Ngamanye amaxesha kuba nzima ukufumana ixesha emini. Ungacinga ngexesha ongaxakekanga kakhulu ngalo? Umzekelo, mhlawumbi kunokuba lula ukunceda ngomsebenzi wasendilini  ngorhatya olukhulu xa abathile babantwana a beyokulala. Zama ukubona ukuba yintoni ekusebenzelayo!

SourceText: Ask them! By telling your partner you want to help out but don’t know how, you are showing them you care and are interested in being involved. This can also help family members understand each other better.
text: Babuze! Ngokuxelela iqabane lakho ukuba ufuna ukunceda kodwa awazi ukuba njani, ubabonisa ukuba uyakhathala kwaye unomdla ekubandakanyekeni. Oku kunokunceda kananjalo amalungu osapho ukuba aqondane ngcono.

SourceText: It can be difficult to remember to ask others what they need help with. Once you start offering to help however, others may realise you want to be involved and may ask for help when they need it!
text: Kunokuba nzima ukukhumbula ukubuza abanye ukuba bafuna ukunceda ngantoni. Wakuqala ukunika uncedo nakuba kunjalo, abanye banokuqonda ukuba ufuna ukubandakanyeka kwaye banokucela uncedo xa belufuna!

SourceText: It can be hard to ask for help. Sometimes we expect our partners to know we need help even if we don’t ask them. Once you start telling however, they will likely start offering to help more often in the future.
text: Kunokuba nzima ukucela uncedo. Ngamanye amaxesha silindele ukuba amaqabane ethu azi  ukuba sifuna uncedo nokuba asiwaceli. Wakuqala ukuxela nakuba kunjalo, baza kuqala ukunika uncedo rhoqo kwixa elizayo.

SourceText: Be kind to yourself - trying something new is often hard at first! Give yourself time to adjust. Also remind yourself that helping your partner with these tasks benefits the whole family!
text: Yiba nobubele kuwe - ukuzama into entsha kusoloko kunzima kuqala!  Zinike ixesha lokuziqhelanisa. Zikhumbuze kananjalo ukiuba ukunceda iqabane lakho ngale misebenzi kuza kunceda usapho lonke!

SourceText: Hello @fields.user_name! This is a stressful time, especially for fathers. When we are stressed or angry, we do not make the best decisions. Taking the time to care for ourselves will help us care for our children.
text: Molo @fields.user_name! Eli lixesha elifaka uxinzelelo, ingakumbi kootata. Xa siphantsi koxinzelelo okanye sinomsindo, asenzi ezona zigqibo zigqwesileyo. Ukuthatha ixesha lokuzikhathalela wena buqu kuya kusinceda sikhathalele abantwana bethu.

SourceText: Today's tip is about how to keep calm and manage stress in our busy lives.
text: Icebo lanamhlanje limalunga okuba uzigcina njani uzolile kwaye ulawule uxinzelelo kubomi bethu obuxakekileyo.

SourceText: It looks like you are facing an emergency. Can you please tell us what kind of assistance you require?
text: Kubonakala ngathi ujongene nengxakeko. Unganceda usixelele ukuba hlobo luni loncedo olufunayo?

SourceText: Type "SOS" at any time if you would like the details of any other emergency service or hotline. Remember everything you say will be completely private!
text: Chwetheza "SOS" ngalo naliphi na ixesha ukuba ngaba ungathada ukufumana naziphi na iinkcukacha zayo nayiphi na inkonzo okanye umxeba wengxakeko. Khumbula yonke into oyitshoyo iza kuba bucala ngokupheleleyo!

SourceText: Let's take a pause together! Take a deep breath and ask yourself, "What am I thinking?"
text: Make siphumle kunye! Phefumla nzulu uze uzibuze, “Ndicinga ngantoni?”

SourceText: Notice if your thoughts are positive or negative. Notice if your emotions are pleasant or unpleasant. Whatever you are feeling, it is okay. Notice how your body feels. Notice anything that hurts or is tense.
text: Phawula enoba iingcinga zakho ziyakhuthaza okanye ziyadakumbisa. Qaphela ukuba ingaba iimvakalelo zakho zintle okanye azintlanga. Nokuba yintoni na oyivayo, kulungile. Qaphela indlela ovakala ngayo umzimba wakho. Qaphela nantoni na ebuhlungu okanye eqinileyo.

SourceText: Focus on your breath as it goes in and out. Do this for about 10 breaths.
text: Jolisa kumphefumlo wakho njengoko ungena uze uphume. Kwenze oku uphefumla kali-10.

SourceText: Now, expand your awareness to your whole body. Listen to the sounds in the room.
text: Ngoku, yandisa ukwazi kwakho emzimbeni wakho wonke. Mamela izandi egumbini.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on whether you feel any different.
text: Thatha iumzuzu ucinge nzulu ngokba uziva ngako nakuphi okwahlukileyo.

SourceText: Here's a video about how to keep calm and manage stress in our busy lives.
text: Nantsi ividiyo malunga nokuba uzigcina njani uzolile kwaye ulawule uxinzelelo kubomi bethu obuxakekileyo.

SourceText: Taking a Pause is a simple relaxation activity that you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or worried. It can also be helpful when you find your child is irritating you or has done something wrong.
text: UkuPhumla ngumsetyenzana olula wokuziphumza onokuwenza nanini uziva unoxinzelelo okanye ukhathazekile. Kunokuba luncedo kananjalo xa umntwana wakho ekucaphukisa  okanye enze into engalunganga.

SourceText: Here is a comic to remind you of taking a pause!
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi yokukukhumbuza ukuba uphumle!

SourceText: “How am I going to get through this?”
text: “Ndiza kudlula njani koku?”

SourceText: “Whatever it is, I am okay.”
text: Nokuba yintoni na , ndilungile.”

SourceText: “Breathe in. Breathe out."
text: “Phefumlela ngaphakathi. Phefumlela ngaphandle.”

SourceText: “I can do this. We will get through it together.”
text: “Ndingakwenza oku. Siza kudlula kunye koku.”

SourceText: Chat later!
text: Sakuncokola mva!

SourceText: Well done for Taking a Pause @fields.user_name. You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try taking a pause whenever you are feeling stressed. It gives you a chance to be calmer. Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also Take a Pause with your Child!
text: Usebenzile ngokuPhumla @fields.user_name. Wongeze esinye  isakhono kwiSeti  yakho yeziXhobo zokuba  nguMzali: Kwiintsuku ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama ukuphumla nanini na usiva uxinzelelo Kukunika ithuba lokuba uzole nangakumbi. Nokuba kukuphefumla nzulu kambalwa okanye ukunxibelelana nomhlaba ongaphantsi ungenza umahluko. Unako nokuPhumla nomNtwana wakho!

SourceText: Well done for Taking a Pause. You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try taking a pause whenever you are feeling stressed. SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Were you able to spend 5 minutes or more of One-on-One Time with your children today?
text: Molo @fields.user_name! Ingaba ukwazile ukuchitha imizuzu emi-5 okanye ngaphezulu yeXesha loBuso ngoBuso nabantwana bakho namhlanje?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Were you able to spend 5 minutes or more of One-on-One Time with your children today?
text: Molo! Ingaba ukwazile ukuchitha imizuzu emi-5 okanye ngaphezulu yeXesha loBuso ngoBuso nabantwana bakho namhlanje?

SourceText: Wonderful! Spending One-on-One Time with your children may make them more willing to help out more often. You are doing great!
text: Kwakuhle! Ukuchitha ixesha loBuso ngoBuso nabantwana bakho kunokwenza ukuba bavume ukunceda rhoqo.  Uqhuba kakuhle!

SourceText: We understand that spending One-on-One Time can sometimes be difficult. Here are some of the main reasons parents struggle. Which one is the closest to you?
text: Siyaqonda ukuba ukuchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso kunokuba nzima ngamanye amaxesha.  Nazi ezinye zezizathu ezingundoqo  zokuba basokole abazali. Sesiphi esisondeleyo kuwe?

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of a time each day that you can make 5 minutes or a bit more? You can even make household chores into a game to do together. Even 5 minutes can make a big difference!
text: Ewe, kunganzima ukufumana ixesha emini, kufuneka usebenze, wenze imisebenzi yekhaya, kunye nezinye izinto. Ungacinga ngexesha suku ngalunye ongenza ngalo imizuzu emi-5 okanye ngaphezulu kunoko?  Ungade wenze nemisebenzi yasendlini ibe ngumdlalo eniwenza kunye. Nayo na imizuzu emi-5 ngemini inokwenza umahluko omkhulu!

SourceText: Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget. Sometimes you might want to give them some other fun options to do instead (Type: "Help" if you want a suggestion).
text: Amaxesha amaninzi abantwana bafuna ukuchitha ixesha bebukele i-TV okanye bedlala ngezinto ze-elektronikhi. Ngamanye amaxesha unokufuna ukubanika olunye ukhetho olonwabisayo abanokulwenza endaweni yayo (Chwetheza: "Uncedo” ukuba  ufuna icebo).

SourceText: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with you. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.
text: Unokuva ubuhlungu ukuba abantwana bakho abafuni  ukuchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nawe. Zicingele wena: Bavuleleke nini kuwe? Mhlawumbi kusasa okanye msinyane nje phambi kokuba bayokulala.

SourceText: Competitive games can be challenging for children (and adults!) if they have difficulty losing. You may want to suggest other activities that you can play together instead of against each other (Type "Help" if you want a suggestion").
text: Imidlalo enokhuphiswano inokucela umngeni ebantwaneni  (nakubantu abadala) ukuba banobunzima bokungaphumeleli. Unokufuna ukucebisa eminye imisetyenzana eninokuyidlala kunye endaweni yokudlala ngokuchaseneyo (Chwetheza "Uncedo" ukuba ufuna icebo").

SourceText: Sometimes our children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. Explain why they can't, and try suggesting alternative activities that would be more appropriate. Type "Help" if you want a suggestion.
text: Abantwana bethu ngamanye amaxesha baya kucebisa imisetyenzana enobundlobongela okanye engakhuselekanga. Cacisa ukuba kutheni bengeke, kwaye uzame ukucebisa imisetyenzana eyeminye enokufaneleka ngokungaphaya. Chwetheza “Uncedo”  ukuba ufuna icebo.

SourceText: It can be difficult to spend One-on-One Time with each one child when you have more than one child. If possible, you can ask another adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend One-on-One Time with one child.
text: Kunganzima ukuchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana ngamnye xa unabantwana abangaphezulu komnye.  Ukuba kuyenzeka, ungacela omnye umntu omdala okanye umntwana omdala ukuba ajonge abanye abantwana ngexa uchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana omnye.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that you have been having some difficulties spending One-on-One Time with your children. Please type "Help" for other advice that might be of use to you. Thank you for trying your best!
text: Sibuhlungu ukuva ukuba  ube neengxaki ngokuchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nabantwana bakho. Nceda chwetheza "Uncedo" ngelinye icebo elinokuba luncedo kuwe. Enkosi  ngokuzama konke okusemandleni akho!

SourceText: You can also think of times when it would be easier to spend One-on-One Time each child, like later in the evening with an older child after the others have gone to sleep.
text: Ungacinga nangamanye amaxesha lawo kunokuba lula ngawo ukuchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana  ngamnye, njengorhatya olukhulu nomntwana omdala emva kokuba abanye behambe bayokulala.

SourceText: You can also spend One-on-One Time with all of your children at once!
text: Ungachitha kananjalo iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nabo bonke abantwana bakho ngexesha elinye!

SourceText: Type "Help" for activities that you can do as a whole family
text: Chwetheza “Uncedo” ngemisetyenzana eninokuyenza njengosapho lonke

SourceText: Only give the transition warning once. When One-on-One Time is over, thank @fields.child_nickname for spending time with you. Then enthusiastically redirect @fields.child_nickname to the next activity like washing hands before dinner.

SourceText: Only give the transition warning once. When One-on-One Time is over, thank your child for spending time with you. Then enthusiastically redirect your child to the next activity like washing hands before dinner.
text: Nika isilumkiso sotshintsho kanye kuphela. Xa liphelile iXesha loBuso ngoBuso, bulela umntwana wakho ngokuchitha ixesha nawe. Uze ke use ngemincili umntwana wakho kumsetyenzana olandelayo ofana nowokuhlamba izandla phambi kwesidlo sangokuhlwa.

SourceText: Today's tip is about spending One-on-One Time with Our Children.
text: Icebo lanamhlanje limalunga nokuchitha iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nabaNtwana Bethu.

SourceText: Children learn through play! Here is a comic about spending one-on-one time with your baby!
text: Abantwana bafunda ngokudlala! Nantsi ikhomikhi malunga nokuchitha ixesha lobuso ngobuso nosana lwakho!

SourceText: Parent: "Such a strong baby you are."
text: Umzali: "Usana olomelele njengawe."

SourceText: Parent: "We are making a delicious meal together."
text: Umzali: "Senza isidlo esimnandi kunye."

SourceText: Parent: “Here I am?”
text: Umzali: “Ndim lo?”

SourceText: Baby: "Ha ha ha!"
text: Usana: "Ha ha ha!"

SourceText: Parent: "Wow! You have stacked 3 blocks on top of each other. Well done!"
text: Umzali: "Wow! Upakishe iibhloko ezi-3 enye phezu kwenye. Usebenzile!”

SourceText: I know that you have already received this tip (well done!).Would you like to review it again?
text: Ndiiyazi ukuba sele ulifumene eli cebo (usebenzile!). Ingaba ungathanda ukuliqwalasela kwakhona?

SourceText: Invest in One-on-One Time! The more time you spend with your children, the more likely they will listen to you and behave well at other times. It really works!
text: Gcina iXesha loBuso ngoBuso! Okukhona uchitha ixesha nabantwana bakho, kokukhona baza kukumamela kwaye baziphathe kakuhle ngamanye amaxesha. Kusebenza nyhani!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to receive more tips about how to manage your child's behaviour.
text: Kulungile! Ungasoloko uchwetheza "Uncedo” ukuba ngaba ufuna ukufumana iingcebiso ezingaphaya malunga nokuba ukulawula njani ukuziphatha komntwana wakho.

SourceText: The first 1000 days of life are a window of opportunity for your baby. It is when their brain develops faster than any other time in their life. When you spend time with your baby, you build a healthy attachment between you both that will make them feel secure and loved.
text: Iintsuku ezili-1000 zokuqala zibonakalisa ithuba kusana lwakho. Kuxa ubuchopho bukhula ngokukhawuleza kunalo naliphi na elinye ixesha ebomini balo.  Xa uchitha ixesha nosana lwakho, wakha ukunamathelana okunempilo phakathi kwenu nobabini  okuya kulwenza luzive lukhuselekile kwaye luthandwa.

SourceText: Here are 7 easy tips to make One-on-One Time with your baby a success:
text: Nazi iingcebiso ezisi-7 ezilula zokwenza iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nosana lwakho libe yimpumelelo:

SourceText: 1. Do it every day
text: 1. Kwenze yonke imihla

SourceText: 2. Be close to your baby
text: 2. Sondela kusana lwakho

SourceText: 3. Let your baby take the lead
text: 3. Lwenze ukuba lukhokele usana lwakho

SourceText: 4. Observe and listen to your child
text: 4. Mqwalasele kwaye ummamele umntwana wakho

SourceText: 5. Play with your baby
text: 5. DFlala nosana lwakho

SourceText: 6. Talk to your baby
text: 6. Thetha nosana lwakho

SourceText: 7. You can have quality time with your baby anytime!
text: 7. Ningaba nexesha elimnandi nosana lwakho ngalo naliphi na ixesha!

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "7". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nenye yezi ngcebiso, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "7". Ungachwetheza kananjalo “N" ukuya phambili.

SourceText: 2. Be close to your child.
text: 2. Sondela kusana lwakho

SourceText: Skin-to-skin contact is especially important for new-borns and infants. For older toddlers, make sure you are at the same level as they are.
text: Ukudibana isikhumba ngesikhumba kubaluleke ngakumbi kwiintsana ezisanda kuzalwa nakwiimveku. Kubantwana abadadlana ababhadazayo, qiniseka ukuba  ulapho  ngenqanaba elifanayo nelo bakulo.

SourceText: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Remember that the world is brand new to your child!
text: Abantwana bafuna ukwenza izinto ngelabo ixesha. Zama ukubanika ixesha lokuphonononga kwaye ube nomonde. Khumbula ukuba ihlabathi litsha kraca emntwaneni wakho!

SourceText: Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening. Speak with enthusiasm when describing what your child is doing. Here is a comic on how to communicate with your baby.
text: Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza izenzo, imibala, iimilo, amanani, ubukhulu, imvakalo yokuphata, amaqondo obushushu, iimvakalo zokungcamla, izandi, kunye nantoni na eyenye eyenzekayo. Thetha ngemincili xa uchaza  into ayenzayo umntwana wakho. Nantsi ikhomikhi malunga nokuba unganxibelelana njani nosana lwakho.

SourceText: Parent: "Buh, buh, buh, big baby!"
text: Umzali: "Buh, buh, buh, usna oludala kangaka!"

SourceText: Baby: "Buh, buh, buh…"
text: Usana: "Buh, buh, buh…"

SourceText: Parent: "And then there were two green parrots in the mango tree!"
text: Umzali: “Kwaze ke kwaba khona izikhwenene eziluhlaza okwengca kumthi wemengo!"

SourceText: Parent: "And now I am cleaning your toes, and your feet, and your knees…"
text: Umzali: “Kwaye ke ngoku ndicoca iinzwane zakho, kunye neenyawo zakho, kunye namadolo akho…"

SourceText: It is normal for men of the family to struggle to think of what to do with their babies, especially when it seems they just eat, sleep, cry, poop, and repeat. It can be especially challenging when your baby is very young and not able to talk to you.

SourceText: Try to spend time playing with @fields.child_nickname every day for at least 20 minutes where you are giving them your full attention. Choose a time when you are unlikely to be interrupted. Switch off the television and put away phones.

SourceText: Here is a comic on spending one-on-one time with your child.
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi ngokuchitha ixesha lobuso ngobuso nomntwana wakho.

SourceText: Child: “I’m bored! There is nothing to do.”
text: Umntwana: “Ndidinekile! Ayikho into endingayenza.”

SourceText: Parent: “Let’s do something together! How about we make some drawings and put them on the gate with messages for people to see?”
text: Umzali: “Masenze into kunye! Kutheni singenzi imizobo nje size siyibeke esangweni inemiyalezo yokuba abantu bayibone?”

SourceText: Children: “Okay!”
text: Abantwana "Kulungile!

SourceText: Parent: “You make the pictures and I’ll write the messages”
text: Umzali: Weana uza kwenza imifanekiso mna ke ndiza kubhala imiyalezo”

SourceText: Child: “Sure!”
text: Umntwana: "Kulungile.

SourceText: Parent: "Remember to wash hands! We love our neighbours!”
text: Umzali: "Ukhumbule ukuhlamba izandla! Siyabathanda abamelwane bethu!”

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! Have you tried sharing family responsibilities at home recently?
text: Molo @fields.user_name! Ingaba uke wazama ukwabelana ngamaxanduva osapho ekhaya kutsha nje?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried sharing family responsibilities at home recently?
text: Molo! Ingaba uke wazama ukwabelana ngamaxanduva osapho ekhaya kutsha nje?

SourceText: This can be hard to remember! Establishing a routine around caregiving or housework tasks can sometimes be helpful. This also lets you talk to your partner or other adults about how to share the workload.
text: Oku kunokuba nzima ukukukhumbula! Ukumisela imisebenzi yesiqhelo ngokugcina okanye imisetyenzana yasendlini kunokuba luncedo ngamaye amaxesha. Oku kwenza kanamjalo ukuba uthethe neqabane lakho okanye abanye abantu abadala malunga nokuba nabelana njani na ngomsebenzi.

SourceText: It is hard to remember to ask for help. Be kind to yourself if you forget to ask and try again another time. Asking for help and sharing family responsibilities benefits the whole family!
text: Kunzima ukukhumbula ukucela uncedo. Yiba nobubele kuwe xa ulibala ukucela kwaye uzame kwakhona ngelinye ixesha. Ukucela uncedo kunye nokwabelana ngamaxanduva osapho kunceda usapho xa lulonke!

SourceText: It can be difficult to know how to ask for help. Try starting off with suggesting a task you would like help with. Being specific gives your partner a clearer idea of what they can support you with.
text: Kunokuba nzima ukwazi ukuba ulucela njani uncedo. Zama ukuqala ngokucebisa umsebenzi ongathanda uncedo ngawo. Ukungqala ngqo kunika iqabane lakho uluvo olucacileyo malunga nokuba lingakuxhasa ngantoni na.

SourceText: Trying something new can be hard! To make it easier, ask your partner to do it together with you the first few times. Soon you’ll feel more confident doing it on your own!
text: Kunokuba nzima ukuzama into entsha Ukukwenza lula, cela iqabane lakho ukuba niyenze kunye amaxesha ambalwa okuqala. Msinyane nje uza kuziva uzithemba ukuyenza ngokwakho!

SourceText: Talk to them! Talking with your partner about how you can share family responsibilities helps both of you understand each other better. It also shows that you care!
text: Thetha nabo! Ukuthetha neqabane lakho malunga  nokuba ningabelana njani na ngamaxanduva osapho kuninceda nobabini ukuba niqondane ngcono. Kubonisa kananjalo ukuba uyakhathala!

SourceText: It can be difficult to find time during the day sometimes! Can you think of a time when your partner might be less busy, such as early in the morning or later in the evening? Creating a routine around housework can also be helpful.
text: Ngamanye amaxesha kuba nzima ukufumana ixesha emini! Ungacinga ngexesha elo iqabane lakho linokuba  alixakekanga kakhulu, njengakwangoko kusasa okanye mva ngokuhlwa? Ukuseka izinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo kumsebenzi wasendlini kunokuba luncedo.

SourceText: Sharing responsibilities in the home benefits everyone! While trying something new can feel hard at first, soon you will start to feel more comfortable. If it helps, ask your partner to join you in the beginning!
text: Ukwabelana ngamaxanduva ekhaya kunceda wonke umntu! Ngexa ukuzama into entsha kunokuvakala kunzima ekuqaleni, msinyane nje  uza kuqala ukuziva ukhululekile. Ukuba kuyanceda, cela iqabane lakho lizimanye nawe kwasekuqaleni!

SourceText: Excellent job @fields.user_name! Sharing the workload benefits the whole family. How was your experience?
text: Umsebenzi ogqwesileyo @fields.user_name! Ukwabelana ngomsebenzi kunceda usapho lonke. Ebenjani amava akho?

SourceText: How did you find out about ParentText?
text: Ufumanise njani ngeParentText?

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky. Push away any clouds and let the Sunshine of Positive Attention shine down on you. Stretch to both sides. Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Yima uze wolule iingalo zakho ziye phezulu esibhakabhakeni. Yenza ngathi utyhala nawaphi na amafu uze uvumele ilanga libengezele kuwe. Yolulela kumacala omabini. Zolule ngaphambili nangasemva.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from your ankles. Remember to turn your foot to both sides - to the left and then to the right. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beka unyawo olunye phambi kolunye uze wenze izangqa  ezincinci ngamaqatha.  Khumbula ukujikela iinyawo zakho  kuwo omabini amacala - ekhohlo uze ke uye ekunene. Unyawo ngalunye malwenze izangqa ezine kwicala ngalinye.

SourceText: Let your hand hang by your side. As you breathe in, squeeze your shoulders up to your ears, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath. Release your shoulders as you breathe out and relax your body.
text: Yenza isandla sakho sijinge  kwicala lakho. Nyusa amagxa kancinci aye ngasezindlebeni njengoko uphefumla, nciphisa amehlo akho uze ubambe umoya wakho. Yeka amagxa akho njengoko uphefumla kwaye uyekelela umzimba wakho

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out. Repeat 4 times.
text: Vala amehlo akho uze uphakamise iingalo zakho ucotha ziye entla kwentloko yakho njengoko utsala umoya. Thoba iingalo zakho ngokucotha zize zibe secaleni njengoko ukhupha umoya. Phinda amaxesha ama-4.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take 4 deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
text: Yekelela iingalo zakho uze uzenze zijiwulele ngaphambili nasemva. Phefumla nzulu ka-4 ngexa usenza oku. Oku kuwuwalungele amazantsi omqolo wakho.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let your arms swing sideways as you turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Yekelela iingalo zakho uze uzenze zijiwule emacaleni njengoko ujika umzimba wakho ongasentla. Iingalo zakho mazibethe umqolo wakho kancinci njengeko ujika usiya kwelinye icala.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text: Thatha ithutyana ukuze ucinge nzulu ngamava akho. Khumbula ukuba ungawenza lo msetyenzana ngalo naliphina ixesha uziva ukuba ufuna ukukhupha uxinzelelo kwaye unike amandla ingqondo kunye nomzimba wakho.

SourceText: Hi! Have you tried resolving conflict in a calm way even when you have felt frustrated recently?
text: Molo! Uke wazama ukusombulula imbambano ngendlela ezolileyo naxa uzive ukhathazekile kutsha nje?

SourceText: Sorry to hear this. What was difficult for you about resolving conflicts between you and your partner?
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva oku. Yintoni ebinzima kuwe malunga nokusombulula iimbambano phakathi kwakho neqabane lakho?

SourceText: It can be really hard to stay calm when we’re having a disagreement with others. Try to think of something that you can do that might help like taking a couple deep breaths.
text: Kunokuba nzima nyhani ukuhlala uzolile xa unokungavumelani nabanye. Zama ukucinga ngento onokuyenza enokunceda njengokwenza iqela lokuphefumla nzulu.

SourceText: It can be easy to forget, but don’t give up! Next time when you start feeling angry, try taking a deep breath before responding. You can also try walking away for a bit if you start feeling frustrated.
text: Kunokuba lula ukulibala, kodwa unganikezeli! Kwixesha elilandelayo xa uziva unomsindo, zama ukuphefumla nzulu phambi kokuphendula. Ungazama nokuhamba umzuzwana kananjalo xa uqala ukuziva ukhathazeka.

SourceText: By taking a pause before responding, it can help us stay calm and respond better. When you feel yourself getting angry, try taking a pause. You can do this!
text: Ngokuphumla phambi kokuphendula, kunokukunceda uhlale uzolile kwaye uphendule ngcono. Xa uziva ngathi uba nomsindo, zama ukuphumla. Ungakwenza oku!

SourceText: Sometimes others respond to us negatively when we’re having a disagreement. In these situations, it is sometimes best to walk away for a bit until those involved have calmed down.
text: Ngamanye amaxesha abanye baphendula kakubi kuthi xa sinokungavumelani. Kwezi meko, kungcono ukuvele uhambe umzuzwana ngamanye amaxesha de bazole abo babandakanyekayo.

SourceText: Having a loving relationship with our partner can have a big impact on how we feel. It also helps make our children feel loved and safe.

SourceText: Here are 5 simple tips on how you can develop a loving and peaceful relationship with your partner:

text: 3. Yabelanani ngamaxanduva osapho

SourceText: 5. Listen and talk to each other
text: 5. Mamelanani kwaye omnye athethe nomnye
