SourceText: Did you manage to establish ONE rule or daily routine together with your child or teen ?
text: Ingaba ukwazile ukubeka umthetho OMNYE okanye into eyenziwa ngesiqhelo yonke imihla kunye nomntwana wakho?

SourceText: Great to hear it this! Remember, the more we involve our children in setting rules, the more our children will be likely to follow them!
text: Ndiyavuya ukuva oku! Khumbula, okukhona sibabandakanya abantwana bethu ekumiseleni imithetho, kokukhona kunokwenzeka ukuba bayilandele!

SourceText: Did you have any challenges when trying to establish a rule or routine together?
text: Ngaba uye wanayo nayiphi imingeni xa ubuzama ukubeka umthetho okanye into eyenziwa ngesiqhelo kunye?

SourceText: It is always important when establishing rules and routines  as a family to consider the age of each child, so you can come up with age-appropriate routines. This is most important for bedtime, time to come home/play, household chores.
text: Kusoloko kubalulekile xa ubeka imithetho kunye nezinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo nilusapho ukuthathela ingqalelo ubudala bomntwana ngamnye,  ukuze uze nezinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo ezifanele ubudala.  Oku kubaluleke kakhulu kwixesha lokulala, ixesha lokubuyela ekhaya/ukudlala, imisebenzi yasendlini.

SourceText: We should always remember that children learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, they more they will follow the rules too. You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow it, considering their responsibilities (for example school or work activities).
text: Simele sisoloko sikhumbula ukuba abantwana bafunda kakuhle kuthi. Okukhona silandela imithetho, kokukhona nabo beza kuyilandela imithetho. Unokuwutshintsha umthetho ukuze uqinisekise ukuba unokuba yinene kumntu wonke, ucinga ngamaxanduva abo (umzekelo imisetyenzana yesikolo okanye yasemsebenzini).

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our children or teens, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Xa sibeka imithetho sisebenzisana kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo, loo nto inceda ukuba abantu abakwintsapho baqondane. Imithetho iza kuba yinene kuye wonke umntu kwaye abantwana baza kuvuma kwaye bakwazi ukulandela umthetho.

SourceText: When we establish rules together with our children, that helps the family to understand each other better. The rules will be more realistic and our children will be more willing and able to follow the rule.
text: Xa sibeka imithetho kunye nabantwana bethu, loo nto inceda ukuba usapho  luqondane ngcono.  Imithetho iza kuba yinene kuye wonke umntu kwaye abantwana baza kuvuma kwaye bakwazi ukulandela umthetho.

SourceText: Sorry you did not manage to do this yet. Sit down with @fields.child_nickname and try again today - involving your children will make them want to follow the rule more often!
text: Uxolo khange ukwazi ukukwenza okwangoku oku. Hlala phantsi no @fields.child_nickname uze uzame kwakhona namhlanje - ukubandakanya abantwana bakho kuza kubenza  bafune ukuyilandela rhoqo imithetho!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Sorry you did not manage to do this yet. Sit down with your child or teen  and try again today - involving your children will make them want to follow the rule more often!
text: Uxolo khange ukwazi ukukwenza okwangoku oku. Hlala phantsi nomntwana wakho okanye umntwana ofikisayo uze uzame kwakhona namhlanje - ukubandakanya abantwana bakho kuza kubenza  bafune ukuyilandela rhoqo imithetho!

SourceText: What was difficult for you about establishing a rule or routine with @fields.child_nickname?
text: Yintoni ebinzima ngokubeka umthetho okanye izinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo no @fields.child_nickname?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: What was difficult for you about establishing a rule or routine with your child or teen ?
text: Yintoni ebinzima ngokubeka umthetho okanye izinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo nomntwana wakho okanye umntwana ofikisayo?

SourceText: Amazing! Consistent rules and routines help make @fields.child_nickname feel secure. They also keep them safe!
text: Kuyamangalisa! Imithetho engatshintshiyo nezinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo zinceda ukwenza @fields.child_nickname azive ekhuselekile. Ibagcina bekhuselekile kananjalo!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Amazing! Consistent rules and routines help make your child or teen  feel secure. They also keep them safe!
text: Kuyamangalisa! Imithetho engatshintshiyo nezinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo zinceda ukwenza umntwana wakho okanye umntwana ofikisayo  azive ekhuselekile. Ibagcina bekhuselekile kananjalo!

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a father It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Isandi sosana olukhalayo sinokukhathaza kakhulu, ingakumbi kutata kuqhelekile ukufuna ukulwenza ukuba luthule  tu. Unokucinga ukuba awungomzali olungileyo kananjalo okanye usana lwakho lukhala nje kuba lufuna ukukuhlupha. Kodwa ziyakhala zonke iintsana. Yenye yeendlela ezingundoqo  olukuxelela ngayo usana ukuba kukho into engalunganga.

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a mother. It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Isandi sokukhala kosana sinokuhlupha kakhulu,  ingakumbi kumama. Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukufuna ukuba luthule. Unokucinga ukuba awungomzali olungileyo kananjalo okanye usana lwakho lukhala nje kuba lufuna ukukuhlupha. Kodwa ziyakhala zonke iintsana. Yenye yeendlela ezingundoqo  olukuxelela ngayo usana ukuba kukho into engalunganga.

SourceText: The sound of a baby crying can be very distressing, especially for a parent. It is completely natural to want to make it stop. You might also think that you are not a good parent or that your baby is crying to spite you. But all babies cry. It is one of the main ways a baby can tell you that something is wrong.
text: Isandi sokukhala kosana sinokuhlupha kakhulu,  ingakumbi kumama. Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukufuna ukuba luthule. Unokucinga ukuba awungomzali olungileyo kananjalo okanye usana lwakho lukhala nje kuba lufuna ukukuhlupha. Kodwa ziyakhala zonke iintsana. Yenye yeendlela ezingundoqo  olukuxelela ngayo usana ukuba kukho into engalunganga.

SourceText: I know that you have already received this tip (well done!). Would you like to review it again?
text: Ndiyazi ukuba sele ulifumene eli cebo (usebenzile). Ungathanda ukuliqwalasela kwakhona?

SourceText: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
text: IiNyani  ezi-2, uBuxoki obu-1

SourceText: Think of three statements about yourself. Two must be true and one must be a lie.
text: Cinga ngezengxelo ezintathu nalunga nawe. Ezimbini kumele zibe yinyani kwaye enye ibe bubuxoki.

SourceText: It might help to think of wishes, dreams, likes or dislikes. For example, I hate bananas, I love ice cream and I really wish I could sing.
text: Kunganceda ukucinga ngeminqweno, amaphupha, okuthandayo okanye ongakuthandiyo. Umzekelo, ndiyazicaphukela iibhanana, ndiyayithanda iayisikhrim kwaye ndinqwenela ukuba bendinokucula nyhani.

SourceText: Say them to your partner or friends. Ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: Zitsho kwiqabane lakho okanye kubahlobo. Bacele baqashisele ukuba yeyiphi ebubuxoki.

SourceText: Did they guess correctly? Was it a surprise?
text: Ngaba baqashisele ngokuchanekileyo? Ngaba ibingummangaliso?

SourceText: Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text: Ngoku babuze okufanayo. Ikhona into entsha eniyifundileyo ngomnye nomnye?

SourceText: Crazy Chicken
text: INkukhu ePhambeneyo

SourceText: Shake your hand in the air 8 times while counting to 8
text: Vuthulula isandla sakho moyeni kasi-8 ngexa ubala ukuya kutsho kwisi-8.

SourceText: Do it as fast and loud as you can
text: Yenzani ngokukhawuleza nangengxolo kangangoko unako.

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand and both feet
text: Phinda ngesinye isandla sakho kunye nazo zombini iinyawo.

SourceText: Do it 7 times, then 6 times until you get to 1.
text: Yenza kasi-7, kuze kube ka-6 ude ufike kwisi-1.

SourceText: Call out “Crazy chicken” as loud as you can!
text: Khwaza  “Inkukhu ephambeneyo” ukwaza kangangoko unako!

SourceText: Have you released all your stress? If not, do it again even faster and louder!
text: Ingaba ulukhuphe lonke uxinzelelo lwakho? Ukuba akunjalo, yeza kwakhona ngokukhawuleza nangokukhwazayo!

SourceText: Family Work Out
text: kuziLolonga koSapho

SourceText: Choose a sport or exercise to do together
text: Khethani umdlalo okanye umthambo eninza kuwenza kunye

SourceText: Decide on a schedule. Are you going to do it every day? For how long?
text: Gqibani ngeshedyuli. Ngaba niza kuwenza yonke imihla? Kangangexesha elingakanani?

SourceText: Try it out for a week.
text: Wukangangeveki.

SourceText: At the end of the week, ask yourself and your family these questions. How’s it going? How did you feel at the start of the week? How do you feel at the end of the week? What can we do differently next week?
text: Ekupheleni kweveki, zibuze wena kunye nosapho lwakho le mibuzo: Kuhamba njani? Beniziva njani ekuqaleni kweveki? Niziva njani ekupheleni kweveki? Yintoni esinokuyenza ngokwahlukileyo kwiveki ezayo?

SourceText: COVID-19 has interrupted our children's education with school closures and remote learning. It is normal to feel overwhelmed about to do this alone, especially when we also have stress about work and money.
text: I-COVID-19 iphazamise imfundo yabantwana bethu ngokuvalwa kwezikolo kunye nokufunda bengekho sikolweni. Kuqhelekile ukuziva woyisakele ngokukwenza wedwa oku, ingakumbu ka sinoxinzelelo ngomsebenzi kunye nemali ngokunjalo.

SourceText: Would you like to learn more about how to support your children with remote learning and returning to school?
text: Ungathanda ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuba ungabaxhasa njani abantwana bakho ngokufunda bengekho sikolweni kunye nokubuyela esikolweni?

SourceText: Stop & Listen
text: Yima kwaye uMamele

SourceText: • Stop for a moment and close your eyes.
text: • Yima umzuzwana uze uvale amehlo akho..

SourceText: • How many sounds can you hear? Listen to sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers. (Pause for 10 seconds)
text: • Zingaphi izandi ozivayo? Mamela izandi ezingaphakathi nangaphandle kwegumbi. Zibale usebenzisa iminwe yakho. (Nqumama kangangemizuzwana  eli-10)

SourceText: • How many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear?
text: Mingaphi iminwe oyiphakamisileyo? Uve izandi ezingaphi?

SourceText: • Let’s try again. Can you hear any new sounds this time? Can you hear any sounds inside your own body? (Pause for 10 seconds)
text: Masizame kwakhona. Ngaba uva naziphina izandi ezintsha ngeli xesha? Ngaba uva naziphina izandi ozivayo ngaphakathi komzimba wakho? (Nqumama kangangemizuzwana  eli-10)

SourceText: • Open your eyes. What new sounds did you hear?
text: Vula amehlo akho. Zeziphi izandi ezintsha ozivileyo?

SourceText: A Short Pause
text: Unqumamo Olufutshane

SourceText: Sit down and close your eyes.
text: Hlala phantsi uze uvale amehlo akho.

SourceText: Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.
text: Mamela umphefumlo wakho njengokuba uwubizela uze uwukhuphe.

SourceText: Notice how you feel.
text: Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo.

SourceText: Take a few more deep breaths.
text: Bizela ngakumbi umphefumlo izihlandlo ezimbalwa.

SourceText: When you are ready open your eyes again. Do you feel any different?
text: Xa sele ukulungele, phinda uvule amehlo akho. Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo?

SourceText: Remind yourself that “Everything is ok”.
text: Zikhumbuze ukuba “Yonke into ilungile”.

SourceText: Give Yourself A Hug
text: Khawuzange

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama hey.
text: Bella mama, bella mama yho.

SourceText: Hey there! How are you feeling today? Do you feel great?!
text: Molo apho! Uziva njani namhlanje? Ingaba wonwabile?!

SourceText: Maybe not. Maybe you shouted again at your children today? Maybe you got angry and said something you don't feel proud of? It’s ok. It’s super stressful right now.
text: Mhlawumbi akunjalo. Ingaba mhlawumbi uphinde wangxolisa abantwana bakho namhlanje? Ingaba mhlawumbi uye wanomsindo waza wathetha into ongenalunda ngayo? Kulungile. Ukhathazeke kakhulu gqitha ngoku.

SourceText: Take a deep breath and think of one thing you did today that you do feel proud of. It doesn't have to be big. And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug. And now think of one thing you did today that you don't feel proud of. What can you do differently tomorrow? And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Khawuphefumle ngamandla uze ucinge into enye oyenzileyo namhlanje oziva ungenalunda ngayo. Akunyanzelekanga ibe yinto enkulu. Uze uthathe iingalo zakho uze uzange. Khawuphefumle ngamandla uze ucinge into enye oyenzileyo namhlanje oziva ungenalunda ngayo. Yintoni ongayenza ngokwahukileyo ngomso? Uze uthathe iingalo zakho uze uzange.

SourceText: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama hey”.
text: Bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama, bella mama yho”.

SourceText: Hello @fields.user_name! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Molo  @fields.user_name! Ubusazi na ukuba u-3 linani elingummangaliso? Bizela umoya uze ubale kathathu uze uphefumle ubale kathathu. Uvakalelwa njani ngoku? Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated. @results.count is a number (counter for list)

SourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Molo! Ubusazi na ukuba u-3 linani elingummangaliso? Bizela umoya uze ubale kathathu uze uphefumle ubale kathathu. Uvakalelwa njani ngoku? Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo?

SourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now? Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now? What are three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Zeziphi izidlo ezithathu ozithanda kakhulu? Ingaba ungachaza izinto ezintathu ozibonayo ngoku? Ingaba kukho izandi ezithathu ozivayo ngoku? Zeziphi izinto ezintathu onombulelo ngazo ngoku?

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three? How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Three is a magical number!
text: Bizela umoya uze ubale kathathu uze uphefumle uze ubale kathathu. Uvakalelwa njani ngoku? Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo? Isithathu linani elingummangaliso!

SourceText: Release Some Energy
text: Khulula Amandla Athile

SourceText: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Pause Power!
text: Baba da bi da ba da baaa! Amandla Onqumamo!

SourceText: What’s Pause Power I hear you say? It’s the ability to transform from a grumpy, angry person into a calm, clear one.
text: Ngawaphi Amandla Onqumamo othetha ngawo? Bubuchule bokuguquka uyeke ukuba ngumntu ocaphukileyo, onomsindo ube ngozolileyo onoxolo.

SourceText: When I’m feeling frustrated I plant my feet firmly on the ground and I breathe in and out three times as slowly as I can. Sometimes I imagine I’m smelling a flower and blowing out a candle.
text: Xa ndiziva ndixakanisekile ndimilisela iinyawo zam emhlabeni ndize kathathu ndibizele umoya ndize ndiwukhuphe kancinane kangangko ndinako. Maxa wambi ndiba nombono wam ndinukisa iintyatyambo kwaye ndivuthela ikhandlela.

SourceText: Da ta! Pause Power! My transformation from grumpy to calm is complete!
text: Da ta! Amandla Onqumamo! Ukuguquka kwam ndiyeke ukucaphuka ndibe noxolo ngokupheleleyo!

SourceText: Taking care of yourself
text: Ukuzinyamekela

SourceText: Recognise what is happening for you in this moment. What are you thinking? Are your thoughts positive or negative. How do you feel? Do you feel pleasant or unpleasant? How does your body feel? Do you feel tense or relaxed?
text: Qonda ukuba kwenzeka ntoni kuwe ngeli thuba. Ucinga ntoni? Ngaba iingcinga zakho ziyakhuthaza okanye ziyadakumbisa. Uvakalelwa njani? Uvakalelwa kamnandi okanye kakubi? Uvakalelwa njani umzimba wakho? Ngaba uziva uwubambile umzimba okanye upholile?

SourceText: Connect to your heart in a kind and gentle way. You may want to place one hand on your heart or chest.
text: Nxibelelana nentlziyo yakho ngendlela enobubele. Usenokufuna ukubeka isandla sakho phezu kwentliziyo okanye kwesifuba sakho.

SourceText: You can then say the following words silently to yourself:
text: Ungazixelela la mazwi alandelayo ngokuthuleyo:

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience. Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need extra support.
text: Thatha ithutyana ukuze ucinge ngamava akho. Khumbula ukuba ungawenza lo msebenzi ngalo naliphina ixesha uziva udinga inkxaso engakumbi.

SourceText: Cooking together
text: Ukupheka kunye

SourceText: Children love to do what you do!
text: Abantwana bayathanda ukwenza into oyenzayo!

SourceText: Let your baby play with pots and spoons while you are making dinner.
text: Vumela umntwana wakho adlale ngeembiza namacephe ngoxa usenza isidlo.

SourceText: Dance Party
text: Itheko Lomdaniso

SourceText: Put on your favourite music or sing your favourite song and dance around the room with your toddler. If you have a baby hold them while you dance.
text: Faka umculo wakho owuthandayo okanye ucule  ingoma oyithandayo uze udanise egumbini nosana lwakho okubhadazayo. Ukuba unomtwana mfunqule ngoxa udanisa.

SourceText: Dance in different ways or with different parts of your body.
text: Danisa ngeendlela ezahlukeneyo okanye ngamalungu awahlukeneyo omzimba wakho.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Let’s dance with our knees and hips.”
text: Ngokomzekelo, “Danisan okwankawu”, “Danisa njengenkukhu” okanye “Masidanisngamadolo nesinqe sethu”

SourceText: Think up different instructions. Be seriously playful!
text: Cinga ngeminyalelo eyahlukileyo. Yiba semoyeni wokudlala ngokwenene!

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: Xa umculo uyeka ukudlala, wonke umntu uma ngxi ngendlela ehlekisayo.

SourceText: Notice what rhythms or movements they like!
text: Phawula izingqi okanye iintshukumo abazithandayo!

SourceText: Down in a ditch!
text: Phantsi emhadini!

SourceText: Sit on a chair and put your toddler on your lap facing you. Hold them firmly under the arms.
text: Hlala esitulweni uze usingathe usana lwakho lujonge ngakuwe. Lubambe uluqinise phantsi kweengalo.

SourceText: Gently bounce your legs and say in a soft voice “Baby horse, baby horse, baby horse, baby horse”
text: Kancinane gabadula ngemilenze yakho uze uthi ngelizwi elipholileyo “Umntwana wehashe, umntwana wehashe, umntwana wehashe, umntwana wehashe”

SourceText: Bounce your legs a bit more and say a bit louder “Little horse, little horse, little horse, little horse”
text: Gabadula ngemilenze yakho uze uthi ubukhwaza “Ihashe elincinane, ihashe elincinane, ihashe elincinane, ihashe elincinane”

SourceText: Bounce your legs more and say louder “Big horse, big horse, big horse, big horse”
text: abadula ngemilenze yakho ngakumbi uze uthi ukhwaza “Ihashe elikhulu, ihashe elikhulu, ihashe elikhulu, ihashe elikhulu”

SourceText: When you call out “Down in a ditch!” open your knees and let your child drop down between them. Make sure you hold them so they don’t fall far!
text: Xa ukhwaza usithi “Phantsi emhadini!” vula amadolo akho uze uyeke umntwana atshone phakathi kwawo. Qiniseka ukuba uyambamba ukuze angawi phantsi!

SourceText: Funny Faces
text: Ubuso Obuhlekisayo

SourceText: Look at your baby in the eyes and make different funny faces.
text: Jonga umntwana wakho emehlweni uze wenze ubuso obuhlekisayo ngeendlela ezahlukahlukahlukeneyo.

SourceText: Make a big face. Make a small face. Make a happy face. Make a surprised face.
text: Yenza ubuso obukhulu. Yenza ubuso obuncinane. Yenza ubuso obonwabileyo.  Yenza ubuso obumangalisiweyo.

SourceText: Which ones make your baby smile or laugh? Do them again, even bigger this time!
text: Zeziphi ezenza usana lwakho luncume okanye luhleke? Ziphinde kwakhona, uzenze kakhulu ngoku!

SourceText: Play with different feelings and add sounds.
text: Dlala ngeemvakalelo ezahlukahlukeneyo

SourceText: Copy their facial expressions too. Exaggerate them to make them funny.
text: Nawe linganisa izinto azenza ngobuso bakhe. Zibaxe ukuze zihlekise.

SourceText: Always end on a positive expression!
text: Maxa onke gqibelisa ngobuso obubonisa uvuyo!

SourceText: Mirror Game
text: Imidlalo Yesipili

SourceText: • Get to your baby's level so they can see you and hear you.
text: Yehla usondele kusana lwakho ukuze lukubone luze lukuve.

SourceText: • Copy their facial expressions and sounds.
text: Nawe linganisa izinto oluenza ngobuso balo nezandi

SourceText: • It is simple and helps create a strong bond between you and your baby!
text: Ilula kwaye inceda kubekho iqhina elomeleleyo phakathi kwakho nosana lwakho!

SourceText: Musical Toes
text: Iinzwane Zomculo

SourceText: Put your baby on their back.
text: Ngqengqisa usana alwakho ngomqolo.

SourceText: Wiggle their toe and say, “This little toe goes [funny sound].”
text: Shukumisa iinzwane zalo uze uthi, “Olu zwane luncinane luthi [yenza isandi esihlekisayo].”

SourceText: Make a funny sound for each toe.
text: Yenza isandi esihlekisayo ngozwane ngalunye

SourceText: Play with different sounds. For example, animal sounds, popping sounds, squeaky sounds, fart sounds.
text: Dlala izandi ezahlukeneyo. Ngokomzekelo, izandi zezilwanyana, izandi zokugqabhuka kwento, izandi ezitswinayo, izandi zokusuza.

SourceText: Repeat this for all ten toes.
text: Kuphindaphinde oku kuzo zolishumi iinzwane.

SourceText: Try to make the last toe the biggest and funniest sound!
text: Zama ukwenza uzwane lokugqibela lube nesandi esisona sakha sasikhulu kwaye sahlekisa!

SourceText: Peek-a-Boo!
text: Peek-a-Boo!

SourceText: • Cover your face with your hands.
text: • Gquma ubuso bakho ngezandla zakho.

SourceText: • Quickly show your face and say "Peek-a-Boo!" or "Hello!" Babies love it!
text: • Veza ubuso bakho ngokukhawuleza uze uthi “Peek-a-Boo!” okanye “Molo!” Iintsana ziyayithanda!

SourceText: See It Be It
text: Yibone uze Ube Yiyo

SourceText: Look around you and name something that you can see. For example, a tree or a cup.
text: Jonga kwizinto ezikujikelezileyo uze ubize ngegama into oyibonayo. Ngokomzekelo, umthi okanye ikomityi.

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it”.
text: Yithi emntwaneni wakho “Ndibona umthi, masibe nguwo”.

SourceText: Countdown from 5 and make the shape of a tree with your bodies. Be as big and silly as possible.
text: Bala usehla ukusuka kwisi-5 nize nenze into emile okomthi ngomzimba wenu. Yiba mkhulu uze uhlekeke kangangoko unako.

SourceText: Now let your child have a turn. What can they see?
text: Ngoku mayibe yigem yomntwana wakho.  Yintoni abakwaziyo ukuyibona?

SourceText: If you can, go outside and be in nature. If you can’t, play it inside.
text: Ukuba ninako yiyani phandle nize nibe kwindalo. Ukuba anikwazi, dlalani ngaphakathi.

SourceText: When you’ve done it a few times, add moves and sounds!
text: Xa nisele nikwenze izihlandlo eziliqela, yongezani iintshukumo nezandi!

SourceText: Shakers
text: Izihlukuhli

SourceText: Find an empty, clean plastic bottle or pot with a lid that closes tight.
text: Khangela ibhotile yeplastiki engenanto necocekileyo okanye imbiza enesiciko esivaleke nggci.

SourceText: Fill it with sand, stones, uncooked rice, beans or any small objects that make an interesting sound.
text: Yigcwalise ngesanti, amatye irayisi, iimbotyi ezikrwada, okanye nayiphina into eyenza isandi esinika umdla.

SourceText: Move your body as you shake it in front of your baby.
text: Shukumisa umzimba wakho njengokuba uyihlukuhla phambi kosana lwakho.

SourceText: If it is safe, give it to your baby to shake!
text: Ukuba kukhuselekile, yinike usana lwakho luyihlukuhle!

SourceText: Get creative! Can you find something colourful or try it with water?
text: Zama amacebo! Ingaba ungakhangela into enemibalabala okanye uyizame ngamanzi?

SourceText: What sounds does your baby like?
text: Zeziphi izandi usana lwakho oluzithandayo?

SourceText: The Sun is Coming!
text: Ilanga Liza Kuphuma!

SourceText: Lie your baby on their back after washing them or changing their diaper.
text: Ngqengqisa usana lwakho ngomqolo emva kokuluhlamba okanye ukulutshintsha inapkeni.

SourceText: Tell them the sun is coming! Wiggle your fingers like sun rays above their head and make your face a big smiling sun.
text: Yithi kulo kuza kuphuma ilanga! Shukumisa iminwe yakho ifane nemitha yelanga entla kwentloko yalo uze wenze ubuso bakho bubonakale njengelanga elikhulu elincumileyo.

SourceText: Tell them the wind is coming! Blow softly over their body.
text: Yithi kulo kuza  umoya! Luvuthele kancinane emzimbeni walo.

SourceText: Tell them the rain is coming! Use your fingers to gently pat over their whole body like light raindrops.
text: Yithi kulo kuza imvula! Sebenzisa iminwe yakho ufefe phezu komzimba walo njengamathontsi emvula.

SourceText: Tell them the clouds are coming! Wrap the towel or cloth around them like a blanket and cuddle them.
text: Mxelele ukuba kuza amafu! Mombhathise ngetawuli okanye ilaphu njengengubo uze umbeke esifubeni.

SourceText: Play with different weathers. Which one does your baby like best?
text: Dlala iimozulu ezahlukeneyo. Yeyiphi umntwana wakho ayithanda kakhulu?

SourceText: Add sound effects or make it into a little song. Use the tune of another song you know!
text: Yongeza imvakalo-sandi okanye uyenze ibe yingonyana. Sebenzisa imvakalo yenye ingoma oyaziyo!

SourceText: At the End of the Day
text: Ekupheleni KoSuku

SourceText: At the end of each day, take a minute to think about the day.
text: Ekupheleni kosuku ngalunye, thatha umzuzu ucinge ngolu suku.

SourceText: Talk to your child about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Thetha nomntwana wakho ngento enye eyakhayo okanye emnandi ayenzileyo.

SourceText: Praise yourself for one thing you did well today.
text: ZIncome ngokwenza into enye kakuhle namhlanje.

SourceText: Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text: Cinga ngento enye onombulelo ngayo.

SourceText: You are a star!
text: Ungu ngqa phambili!

SourceText: Lullaby
text: Lullaby

SourceText: When your baby or toddler cries, sing a soft song to calm you both down.
text: Xa usana lwakho okanye usana olubhadazayo lukhala, cula ingoma etsholo phantsi ukuze nobabini nizole.

SourceText: Sing a soothing song you know or make up your own with a simple melody and some soothing words.
text: Cula ingoma ethuthuzelayo oyaziyo okanye uziqambele eyakho  ngesandi sakho esilula namazwi athile athuthuzelayo.

SourceText: Repeat it over and over in a rhythmical way. For example, “My little one, oh little one”.
text: Yiphindaphinde kaninzi ngendlela .enesingqi Ngokomzekelo, “Thula mntwana, thula sana lwam”.

SourceText: Sing the same song regularly so your child gets used to it!
text: Yicule qho le ngoma ukwenzela ukuba umntwana wakho ayiqhele!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8
text: Vuthululani izandla zenu zasekhohlo emoyeni izihlandlo ezi-8 ngoxa nibala ukuya kutsho ku-8.

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Repeat with each foot.
text: Phindani nangesinye isandla. Phinda ngenyawo ngalinye.

SourceText: Do it 7 times, then 6 times and continue until you get to 1.
text: Yenzani kasi-7, emva koko ka-6 nize niqhubeke nide nifike ku-1.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Wonke umntu ukhwaza athi “Inkukhu ephambeneyo” emva koko nidanise ngathi yinkukhu ephambeneyo!

SourceText: Dance choreography
text: Amanyathelo okudanisa

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your children’s favorite songs.
text: Yakha amanyathelo okudanisa kwiingoma umntwana wakho azithandayo.

SourceText: First person does a dance move and everyone else copies.
text: Umntu wokuqala uyadanisa baze abanye balinganise yena.

SourceText: Everyone takes turns being the leader.
text: Wonke umntu unetyeli lokukhokela.

SourceText: Perform it for the household!
text: Yenzani phambi kwakhe wonke umntu osekhayeni lenu!

SourceText: Play or sing your favourite music and dance around the room.
text: Dlala okanye ucule ingoma ozithandayo uze udanise ujikeleze lonke igumbi.

SourceText: For example, “Dance like a monkey”, “Dance like a chicken” or “Dance with just our knees and hips”.
text: Ngokomzekelo, “Danisani okwenkawu”, “Danisani njengenkukhu” okanye “Masidanise nje ngamadolo nesinqe sethu”.

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone does a funny freeze.
text: Xa umculo uyeka ukudlala, wonke umntu uma ngxi ngendlela ehlekisayo.

SourceText: Give your child a chance to be the one to stop the music!
text: Nika umntwana wakho ithuba lokuyekisa umculo!

SourceText: Freeze dance
text: Misa umdaniso

SourceText: Play music or someone sings a song, and everyone dances.
text: Dala umculo okanye omnye acule ingoma, baze abanye badanise.

SourceText: When the music stops, everyone must freeze.
text: Xa umculo uyeka ukudlala, wonke umntu uma ngxi.

SourceText: Last person still dancing becomes the judge for the next round.
text: Umntu wokugqibela ukudanisa uba yijaji kwirawundi elandelayo

SourceText: A variation to Freeze Dance is Animal Dance: It’s the same as Freeze Dance but when the music stops, one member of the family calls out the name of an animal, and everyone has to become that animal.
text: Iindlela ngeendlela zokuMisa uMdaniso nguMdaniso weziLwanyana: Iyafana nokuMisa uMdaniso kodwa xa umculo uyeka, elinye ilungu lentsapho libiza igama leso silwanyana, kwaye wonke ubani uye waba seso silwanyana.

SourceText: Mirror
text: Isipili

SourceText: This game can be played in pairs or even as a group.
text: Lo mdlalo ungadlalwa ngabantu ababini okanye njengeqela.

SourceText: Stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: Yimani nijongane okanye kwisangqa.

SourceText: One person leads first while everyone else must copy, trying to move exactly at the same time as the leader.
text: Umntu omnye uyakhokela baze abanye bamlinganise, bezama ukushukuma ngexesha elifanayo nenkokheli.

SourceText: Make sure the leader moves slowly enough for everyone to follow! Explore moving different body parts and in different levels.
text: Qinisekisa ukuba inkokheli ayikhawulezi ukuze abanye bakwazi ukuyilinganisa! Jongani amalungu omzimba ashukumayo ngamanqanaba ahlukahlukeneyo.

SourceText: After a while, switch who is leading. Give everyone a chance to lead.
text: Emva kwethutyana, tshintshani inkokheli. Wonke umntu makabe nethuba lokukhokela.

SourceText: Try it with no leaders!
text: Zamani zingekho iinkokheli!

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support your child's learning.
text: Nantsi ividiyo eza kukunceda uxhase imfundo yomntwana wakho.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support your child's learning.
text: Nanku umyalezo onamazwi oza kukunceda uxhase imfundo yomntwana wakho.

SourceText: Here are 5 steps that you can do to help your children continue learning during this time:
text: Nanga amanyathelo ama-5 ongawenza ukuze uncede umntwana wakho aqhubeke efunda ebudeni beli xesha:

SourceText: 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: 1. Dala umzila ojikeleze ukufunda nomsebenzi wesikolo

SourceText: 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: 2. Yenza ukufunda kube yinto emnandi kwaye kube nomdlalo

SourceText: 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher
text: 3. Khumbula ukuba ungumzali HAYI ibambela letishala

SourceText: 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: 4. Hlala unoqhagamshelwano nesikolo nootishala bomntwana wakho

SourceText: 5. Support your child when they return to school
text: 5. Mxhase umntwana wakho xa ebuyela esikolweni

SourceText: Type "1" to "5" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Chwetheza “1” ukuya ku ”5” ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nengcebiso nganye. Chwetheza “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support your child's learning:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nendlela yokuxhasa ukufunda komntwana wakho.

SourceText: Step 5. Support your child when they go back to school
text: Inyathelo 5. Xhasa umntwana wakho xa ebuyela esikolweni

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Mxelele @fields.child_nickname ukuba kulungile ukuziva usoyika okanye ukhathazekilengokubuyela  esikolweni. Vumela umntwana wakho akuchazele indlela aziva ngayo. Yinto eqhelekileyo ukuba umntwana wakho aziphathe ngendlela eyahlukileyo kwaqhele ukuziphatha ngayo. Xubusha indlela ukuya esikolweni okungahluka ngayo nendlela angazikhusela ngayo kwi-COVID-19. Mbuze ukuba belunjani usuku lwakhe uze umxhase ukuba ufumana naziphina iingxaki.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your child that it is okay to feel scared or worried about going back to school. Allow your child to share how they are feeling. It is also normal if your child behaves differently to their usual behaviour. Discuss how going to school might be different and how they can protect themselves from COVID-19. Ask them how their day went and support them if they experienced any difficulties.
text: Mxelele  ukuba kulungile ukuziva usoyika okanye ukhathazekile ngokubuyela  esikolweni. Vumela umntwana wakho akuchazele indlela aziva ngayo. Yinto eqhelekileyo ukuba umntwana wakho aziphathe ngendlela eyahlukileyo kwaqhele ukuziphatha ngayo. Xubusha indlela ukuya esikolweni okungahluka ngayo nendlela angazikhusela ngayo kwi-COVID-19. Mbuze ukuba belunjani usuku lwakhe uze umxhase ukuba ufumana naziphina iingxaki.

SourceText: Step 2. Make learning fun and playful
text: Inyathelo 2. Yenza ukufunda kube yinto emnandi kwaye kube nomdlalo

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep @fields.child_nickname interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Abantwana bafunda bhetele xa ukufunda kuyinto emnandi! Zama ukufumanisa iindlela zokwenza ukufunda kube ngumdlalo @fields.child_nickname kunike umdla kwaye kumbandakanye. Chwetheza “Uncedo” ukuba udinga naziphina iingcamango zokwenza kube mnandi!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Children learn best when learning is fun! Try to find ways to make learning playful to keep your child interested and engaged. Type "Help" if you ever need any fun ideas!
text: Abantwana bafunda bhetele xa ukufunda kuyinto emnandi! Zama ukufumanisa iindlela zokwenza ukufunda kube ngumdlalo kugcine umntwana wakho enomdla kwaye ebandakanyekile. Chwetheza “Uncedo” ukuba udinga naziphina iingcamango zokwenza kube mnandi!

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a father NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Inyathelo 3. Khumbula ukuba ungutata HAYI ibambela letishala!

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at @fields.child_nickname's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Indima yakho kukuxhasa umntwana wakho ngokumdalela indawo yokufunda. Akunyanzelekanga wazi zonke iimpendulo. Bancede bafunisise izinto abanomdla kuzo baze babuze imibuzo. Yiya kwisantya @fields.child_nickname's uze ube nomonde kwisiqu sakho
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a mother NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Inyathelo 3. Khumbula ukuba ungumama HAYI ibambela letishala!

SourceText: Step 3. Remember that you are a parent NOT a substitute teacher!
text: Inyathelo 3. Khumbula ukuba ungumzali HAYI ibambela letishala!

SourceText: Your role is to support your child by creating a space to learn. You do not need to know all the answers. Help them explore their interests and ask questions. Go at your child's pace and be patient with yourself.
text: Indima yakho kukuxhasa umntwana wakho ngokumdalela indawo yokufunda. Akunyanzelekanga wazi zonke iimpendulo. Bancede bafunisise izinto abanomdla kuzo baze babuze imibuzo. Hamba ngesantya somntwana wakho uze ube nomonde kwisiqu sakho.

SourceText: Step 1. Create a routine around learning and schoolwork
text: Inyathelo 1. Dala umzila ojikeleze ukufunda nomsebenzi wesikolo

SourceText: Make a daily plan with @fields.child_nickname for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Yenza ucwangciso lwemihla ngemihla nge @fields.child_nickname lokuba bangalichitha nini ixesha besenza umsebenzi wezemfundo. Oku kungaquka umsebenzi wesikolo ohlelwe kakuhle neminye imisebenzi e-online, ukufunda, ukubhala, okanye ezenkcubeko. Vumela ububhetyebhetye nexesha lokudlala nokuphumla.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Make a daily plan with your child for when they can spend time doing educational activities. This can include structured schoolwork and other activities online, reading, writing, or arts. Allow flexibility and time for play and relaxation too.
text: Yenza ucwangciso lwemihla ngemihla nomntwana wakho lokuba bangalichitha nini ixesha besenza umsebenzi wezemfundo. Oku kungaquka umsebenzi wesikolo ohlelwe kakuhle neminye imisebenzi e-online, ukufunda, ukubhala, okanye ezenkcubeko. Vumela ububhetyebhetye nexesha lokudlala nokuphumla.

SourceText: Step 4. Stay connected with your child's school and teachers
text: Inyathelo 4. Hlala unoqhagamshelwano nesikolo nootishala bomntwana wakho

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with @fields.child_nickname’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Fumanisa indlela yokuhlala unoqhagamshelwano neetishala nesikolo sika @fields.child_nickname ukuze uhlale uzazi izinto, ubuze imibuzo uze ufumane ukhokelo olungakumbi. Ukuba uyasokola okanye wazi umntu osokolayo ngomsebenzi wesikolo okanye imeko yasekhaya; nceda uxubushe oko notishala oziva usondele kuye. Amaqela abazali okanye amaqela asekuhlaleni nawo angaba yinkxaso entle omnye komnye ngokufundisela ekhaya.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Find out how to stay in touch with your children’s teacher or school to stay informed, ask questions and get more guidance. If you are struggling or know someone who is struggling with school work or the home situation, please discuss this with a teacher that you feel close to. Parent groups or community groups can also be a good way to support each other with your home schooling.
text: Fumanisa indlela yokuhlala unoqhagamshelwano neetishala nesikolo sabantwana bakho ukuze uhlale uzazi izinto, ubuze imibuzo uze ufumane ukhokelo olungakumbi. Ukuba uyasokola okanye wazi umntu osokolayo ngomsebenzi wesikolo okanye imeko yasekhaya; nceda uxubushe oko notishala oziva usondele kuye. Amaqela abazali okanye amaqela asekuhlaleni nawo angaba yinkxaso entle omnye komnye ngokufundisela ekhaya.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: Usebenzile ngokongeza esinye isakhono kwikiti yakho yeziXhobo zokuba  nguMzali! Kwiintsuku ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama ukudala iplani yokufunda kunye nomntwana wakho equka ubumnandi kunye nemisetyenzana efundisayo. Ukunceda umntwana wakho aqhubeke efunda ebudeni bexesha lobunzima kubaluleke kakhulu. Imigudu yakho eyeyona ibhetele iza kwenza umahluko!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try creating a learning plan with your child that includes both fun and focused educational activities. Helping your child continue learning during this difficult time is so important. Your best efforts will make a difference!
text: Usebenzile ngokongeza  omnye umaleko  kwiNdlu yakho yeNkxaso! Kwiintsuku ezimbalwa ezizayo, zama ukudala iplani yokufunda kunye nomntwana wakho equka ubumnandi kunye nemisetyenzana efundisayo. Ukunceda umntwana wakho aqhubeke efunda ebudeni bexesha lobunzima kubaluleke kakhulu. Imigudu yakho eyeyona ibhetele iza kwenza umahluko!

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Siyaqonda ukuba kunokuba nzima nyani oku.  Nceda uchwetheze “Uncedo" ukuba ufuna nayiphi na inkxaso okanye isikhokelo esingaphaya. Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: We understand that these times can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance. Chat to you later!
text: Siyaqonda ukuba kunokuba nzima nyani oku.  Nceda uchwetheze “Uncedo" ukuba ufuna nayiphi na inkxaso okanye isikhokelo esingaphaya. Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva!

SourceText: Rain on the Mountain
text: Imvula Entabeni

SourceText: Call out, “There’s rain on the mountain”.
text: Biza, “Kukho imvula entabeni”.

SourceText: Everyone else replies “Run, run, run” while running around the space.
text: Nawphina omnye uphendula athi “Baleka, baleka, baleka” ngoxa ubaleka esithubeni.

SourceText: Call out different instructions. For example, touch something red or hop like a frog.
text: Cinga ngeminyalelo eyahlukileyo. Ngokomzekelo, chukumisa into ebomvu okanye uxhume njengesele.

SourceText: Keep playing and change the instructions each time.
text: Qhubeka udlala uze utshintshe imiyalelo sihlandlo ngasinye.

SourceText: You can use this as a fun way to learn colours or even tidy up!
text: Ungasebenzisa le ndlela imnandi ukufunda ngemibala okanye ukucoca!

SourceText: Run Around and Do This
text: Baleka Ujikeleza uze Wenze Oku

SourceText: Everyone runs around the room or garden.  Make sure the space is large enough and safe.
text: Wonke ubani uyabaleka kweli gumbi okanye igadi.  Qiniseka ukuba indawo inkulu  ngokwaneleyo kwaye ikhuselekile.

SourceText: At any time, someone can stop somewhere and say, “When you get over here, you do this!”
text: Naninina, omnye angema kwindawo ethile aze athi, “Xa ufika apha, nantsi into oyenzayo!”

SourceText: What you do can be anything: push-ups, singing a song, crying, jumping…
text: Into oyenzayo isenokuba kukwenza ii-push-ups, ukucula ingoma, ukukhala, ukutsibatsiba...

SourceText: The more you play, the more there are things to do in more and more places.
text: Okukhona udlala, kokukhona kukho izinto oza kuzenza kwiindawo ezingakumbi nangagakumbi

SourceText: Each person can decide where to go and when.
text: Mntu ngamnye angagqiba ukuba aye phi kwaye nini.

SourceText: It’s fun to interact with other people who are doing the same thing as you!
text: Kumnandi ukuphilisana nabanye abantu abenza into efanayo nani!

SourceText: Say to your child “I see a tree, let’s be it!”
text: Yithi emntwaneni wakho “Ndibona umthi, masibe nguwo!”.

SourceText: Ship to Shore
text: Inqanawa eya elunxwemeni

SourceText: A fun active game where children learn different parts of a boat. Everyone must go to the place or activity that you call out.
text: Umdlalo phithizelayo apho abantwana bafunda iinxaleney ezahlukeneyo zephenyane Wonke ubani umele aye kwindawo okanye umsetyenzana ocela wenziwe.

SourceText: “Bow” means run to the front of the boat (room).
text: U-”Bow” uthetha ukubaleka phambi kwephenyane (igumbi).

SourceText: “Stern” means run to the back of the boat.
text: U-”Stem” uthetha ukubalekela ngemva kwephenyane.

SourceText: “Starboard” means run to the right side and “Port” means run to the left side.
text: U-”Starboard” uthetha ukubaleka uye ekunene kwaye u-”Port uthetha ukubalekela ngasekhohlo.

SourceText: “Climb the rigging”: pretend to climb.
text: U-Climb the rigging”:Yenza ngathi uyakhwela unyuka.

SourceText: “Clean the deck”: pretend to clean the floor.
text: “U-”Coca i-deck”: yenza ngathi ucoca umgangatho.

SourceText: “Lifeboat, [number] people!”: hold hands in a circle with that many people and do knee bends.
text: I-”Lifebooat, [inani] labantu!”: bambanani ngezandla nenze isangqa nabantu abaninzi nize niguqe nbgamadolo.

SourceText: Everyone not in a lifeboat must swim!
text: Wonke ubani kwi-lifeboat umele aqubhe!

SourceText: Stage Directions
text: Imiyalelo Yaseqongeni

SourceText: This is the same as Ship to Shore but with Stage Directions. This can be done in an elevated and safe area. The director gives the instructions.
text: Oku kuyafana neNqanawa eya eluNxwemeni kodwa eneMiyalelo Yaseqongeni. Oku kunokwenziwa kwindawo ebuphakama nekhuselekileyo. Umyaleli unikela imiyalelo.

SourceText: “Stage Right” means you go to the right.
text: I-”Stage right” ithetha ukuba uya ekunene.

SourceText: “Stage Left” means you go to the left.
text: I-”-Stage left” ithetha ukuba uya ekhohlo..

SourceText: “Downstage” means you go down.
text: I-”Downstage” ithetha ukuba uya ezantsi.

SourceText: “Upstage” means you go up.
text: I-”Upstage” ithetha ukuba uya phezulu.

SourceText: “Centre Stage” means you go to the centre of the stage.”
text: “Inqanaba Leziko” lithetha ukuba uya kwiziko lenqanaba.”

SourceText: You can have fun actions like “Dramatic Death, Take a Bow, Open the Curtain, Clean the Floor,” etc.
text: Ninganemisetyenzana emnandi efana “noKufa okuneDrama, Thatha i-Bow, Vula Ikhethini, Coca uMgangatho,” njl.

SourceText: Instead of “Lifeboat” you make “Cast of Actors.” Those not in the cast become the director!
text: Endaeni “yePhenyane Lobomi” yenza “uLuhlu lwabaDlali.” Abo bangekho kubadlali baba ngabalawuli!

SourceText: Superpowers
text: Amandla Angaphaya Kwaqhelekileyo

SourceText: Think of a superpower. For example, going anywhere instantly, travelling in time, reading minds.
text: Cinga ngokuba namandla angaphaya kwaqhelekileyo. Ngokomzekelo, ukuya naphi na ngoko nangoko, ukubuyela emva kwixesha lakudala.

SourceText: Ask your child “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?
text: Buza umntwana wakho ukuba, “Xa ubunamandla angaphezu kwaqhelekileyo oku [...], ubungawasebenzisa njani?

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act it out.
text: Mkhuthaze ukuba azithiye igama leqhawe elinamandla angaphaya kwaqhelekileyo enze loo nto beliza kuyenza.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you!
text: Ngoku babakukhethele into enamandla angaphaya kwaqhelekileyo!

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Qiniseka ukuba nawe uyayenza!

SourceText: Transform the object
text: Tshintsha izinto

SourceText: Everyday household items like brooms, mops, or scarfs can become fun props for games
text: Izinto zasendlini zemihlangemihla njengemitshayelo, iimophu, okanye izikhafu zingaba zizinto ezonwabisayo zemidlalo

SourceText: Place an object in the center of the room and whenever someone has an idea, they jump in and show the rest what the object can be
text: Beka loo nto embindini wegumbi kwaye naninina omnye enembono ethile, uyaxhuma aze abonise abanye ukuba loo nto ingayintoni na

SourceText: For example, a broom might be ridden as a horse or a microphone or a guitar!
text: Ngokomzekelo,umthsayelo usenokukhwelwa ube lihashe okanye ube yi-microphone okanye ikatara!

SourceText: What Are You Doing?
text: Wenza Ntoni?

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play
text: Lo mdlalo umnandi xa udlalwa ngabantu abangaphezu kwaba-2

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair or making dinner
text: Umntu omnye wenza ngathi wenza into ethile – ngokomzekelo, ukama iinwele okanye upheka isidlo sangokuhlwa.

SourceText: Another person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Omnye umntu ubuza athi, “Wenza ntoni?”

SourceText: The first person needs to say something that has nothing to do with combing hair, for example, “Tying my shoes.”
text: Umntu wesibini kufuneka athethe into engadibaniyo nokukama iinwele, ngokomzekelo athi, “Ndibopha imitya yezihlangu zam”

SourceText: The second person then starts pretending to tie their shoes until a new person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Umntu wesibini uqalisa ukwenza ngathi ubopha imitya yezihlangu zakhe de omnye umntu ambuze, “Wenza ntoni?”

SourceText: The answer must always be something different than what you are actually doing!
text: Impendulo kufuneka isoloko ingeyiyo le nto uyenzayo!

SourceText: Worms Go Home
text: Iintshulube Mazigoduke

SourceText: Lie on your tummies and pretend your index fingers are a wiggly worm.
text: Lala gnesisu uze wenze ngathi iminwe yakho yokukhomba ziintshulube ezijijeneyo.

SourceText: With your other hand make a worm house by making a circle with your fingers and thumb and place it on the floor.
text: Ngesinye isandla sakho yenza indlu yeentshulube usenza isangaqa ngeminwe yakho nobhontsi wakho uze usibeke phantsi.

SourceText: Call out an instruction for your finger to touch, like “Worms on noses” or “Worms on ears”
text: Khupha umyalelo wokuba umnwe wakho uchukumise, njenge “Ntshulube empumlweni” okanye ”iiNtshulube ezindlebeni”

SourceText: When you call out “Worms go home”, your wiggly worm has to find a worm house as quickly as possible.
text: Xa ukhwaza usithi “Iintshulube mazigoduke”, intshulube yakho esongekileyo kufuneka ikhangele ikhaya ngokukhawuleza kangangoko kunokwenzeka..

SourceText: The last worm to find a home calls out the instructions next.
text: Intshulube yokugqibela ukufika ekhaya ikhupha imiyayelo elandelayo.

SourceText: Keep playing until you feel rejuvenated from lying down.
text: Qhubeka nidlala de nizive nihlaziyekile ekulaleni phantsi.

SourceText: Blind Dragon
text: Inamba Emfamekileyo

SourceText: This game is great if you have at least 4 people
text: Lo mdlalo uba mnandi ukuba unabantu aba-4 ubuncinane

SourceText: Tell the story about a ferocious dragon who lived near a village. He would sneak into the village at night and steal people’s treasures – anything they loved.  Anybody who tried to take their treasure back would be eaten alive.  This continued for many years until the dragon became old, fat, and blind from sitting on his treasure and gazing at the glare of the gold coins. Then the townspeople could try and sneak into his lair and steal back their relatives’ treasure.
text: Balisa ibali ngenamba eneengcwangu ehlala kufutshane nelali ethile. Ibidla ngokuchwechwa ingene elalini ngobusuku ize ibe izinto zabantu zexabiso - nantoni na abayithandayo..  Nabanina ozama ukuhlutha into yakhe yexabiso ebeye atyiwe ephila.  Oku kwaqhubeka kangangeminyaka emininzi de le namba yaba ndala, yatyeba, yaza yaba yimfama ngenxa yokuhlala kubutyebi bayo nokuhlala ijonge ezo ngqekembe zegolide. Ngoko abantu badolophu babezama ukuchwechwa baze bazame ukungena kuloo mngxuma baze bebe izinto zexabiso zezizalwana zabo.

SourceText: One person plays the dragon. Dragon sits blindfolded or with eyes closed surrounded by a pile of treasure.
text: Umntu omnye udlala indima yenamba. Inamba ihlala ivalwe amehlo okanye icimele ingqongwe yindumba yobutyebi.

SourceText: Everyone has one piece of treasure that they must steal back.
text: Wonke ubani unento yexabiso amele ayibe azithhele yona.

SourceText: If the dragon hears you and points at you, you must go back to the starting place.
text: Ukuba inamba iyakuva kwaye iyakukhomba, umele ubuyele kwindawo obuqale kuyo.

SourceText: Only one person can try to get the treasure at a time.
text: Imele ibe ngumntu omnye kuphela ozama ukuthatha ubutyebi ngexesha.

SourceText: Dancing with Angels
text: Ukudanisa neeNgelosi

SourceText: This activity helps children learn how to lead. It also builds trust between you and your child.
text: Lo mdlalo unceda abantwana bafunde ukukhokela. Kwakhona yakha ukuthembana phakathi kwakho nomntwana wakho.

SourceText: Play a piece of music that is gentle and relaxed to encourage smooth and calming movement.
text: Dlala umculo opholileyo nozolileyo ukuze ukhuthaze indlela yokushukuma etyibilikayo nenenzolo.

SourceText: One person goes first and closes their eyes while the other person is the guardian angel or protector.
text: Umntu omnye uyaqala aze avale amehlo akhe ngoxa omnye umntu eza kuba yingelosi egadileyo okanye umkhuseli.

SourceText: The guardian angel must protect the person with their eyes closed from harm while gently dancing together.
text: Le ngelosi igadileyo imele ikhusele loo mntu ngoxa evale amehlo ukuze angonzakali ngoxa bedaninisa ngokuzolileyo kunye.

SourceText: When the music ends, the dancer can open their eyes before switching roles.
text: Xa umculo uphela, umdanisi angavula amehlo ngaphambi kokutshintsha indima ayidlalayo.

SourceText: Drawing
text: Ukuzoba

SourceText: Children love to draw! It helps build creativity.
text: Abantwana bayakuthanda ukuzoba! Kubanceda bazakhele indlela yokuyila izinto .

SourceText: Get some pens or crayons and a piece of paper or cardboard.
text: Fumana iipeni neekhrayoni nephepha okanye ikhadibhodi.

SourceText: Let your children freely draw whatever they want.
text: Vumela abantwana bazobe nantoni na abayifunayo.

SourceText: While your child is drawing, use words to describe what they are doing: “I see you are drawing a person” or “I see you are making lines with the red crayon.”
text: Ngoxa umntwana wakho ezoba, sebenzisa amazwi achaza le nto bayizobayo: “Ndiyabona ukuba uzoba umntu” okanye “ Ndiyabona ukuba wenza imigca ngekhrayoni ebomvu.”

SourceText: You can also have fun drawing next to them.
text: Kwakhona ungazonwabisa nawe uzobe apha ecaleni kwabo.

SourceText: Put their drawings up on the wall, refrigerator, or outside to decorate the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: Xhoma imizobo yabo edongeni, efrijini, okanye ngaphandle ukuze uhombise indlu - loo nto iza kwenza abantwana bakho bazive  bexatyiswa!

SourceText: Listening to Sounds
text: Ukuphulaphula Izandi

SourceText: Sit down and close your eyes
text: Hlala phantsi uze uvale amehlo akho.

SourceText: How many sounds can you hear? Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers
text: Zingaphi izandi ozivayo? Mamela izandi ezingaphakathi nangaphandle kwegumbi. Zibale usebenzisa iminwe yakho

SourceText: After ten seconds, how many fingers do you have up? What sounds did you hear?
text: Emva kwemizuzwana elishumi, mingaphi iminwe oyibambileyo? Uve izandi ezingaphi?

SourceText: Try again for another ten seconds.
text: Zama kwakhona kangangemizuzwana elishumi.

SourceText: Can you hear any new sounds? Can you hear any sounds inside your own body?
text: Ngaba uve naziphina izandi ezintsha? Ngaba uva naziphina izandi ngaphakathi komzimba wakho?

SourceText: Notice how you feel and ask your child how they are feeling.
text: Phawula indlela  oziva ngayo uze ubuze umntwawna wakho ukuba uziva njani.

SourceText: Memory game – “When COVID-19 ends…”
text: Umdlalo wokukhumbula - “Xa i-COVID-19 iphela...”

SourceText: First person says, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to… (e.g., go to the park)”
text: Umntu wokuqala uthi, Xa i-COVID-19 iphela, ndiza...(umz., kuya epakini)”

SourceText: Second person adds to the first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”
text: Umntu wesibini wongeza iplani yomntu wokuqala, “Xa i-COVID-19 iphela, ndiza kuya epakini kwaye... (umz., ndiza kutyelela umhlobo wam osenyongweni)”

SourceText: Each person adds to the previous list of plans, trying to think of all of the fun things to do when COVID-19 ends.
text: Umntu ngamnye wongezelela kwinto ethethwe ngumntu wokugqibela, nizama ukucinga ngazo zonke izinto ezimnandi ezinokwenziwa xa kuphela i-COVID-19.

SourceText: Self-portrait
text: Ukuzizoba

SourceText: Here’s how your children can draw a picture of themselves!
text: Nantsi indlela abantwana bakho abangazizoba ngayo!

SourceText: Find a big piece of paper or cardboard. It needs to be the same length or slightly longer than the height of your child
text: Khangela iphepha elikhulu okanye ikhadibhodi. Kufuneka libe nobude okanye libe lidana kunokuphakama komntwana wakho

SourceText: Ask your child to lie down on the paper. Carefully draw the outline of your child.
text: Cela umntwana wakho alale phantsi ephepheni. Zoba ngenyameko ubume bomntwana wakho.

SourceText: Now let your child fill in the outline: face, hair, clothes, shoes, or anything they want!
text: Ngoku vumela umntwana wakho azalise ubume bakhe: ubuso, iinwele, impahla, izihlangu, okanye nantoni ayifunayo!

SourceText: Ask your child to draw things that they like and do not like outside of the outline
text: Cela umntwana wakho azobe izinto azithandayo nangazithandiyo ngaphandle kobume bakhe

SourceText: Have a conversation with your child about these things. You may learn something about your child!
text: Ncokola nomntwana wakho ngezi zinto. Unokufunda into ngomntwana wakho!

SourceText: You can put their outline up in their room or anywhere in the house – it will make your children feel appreciated!
text: Ungaxhoma ubume bakhe egumbini lakhe okanye naphina apha endlwini - oko kuya kwenza umntwana wakho azive exatyiswa!

SourceText: Story time
text: Ixesha lebali

SourceText: Start the story with “Once upon a time there was a…”
text: Qalisa ibali ngokuthi, “Kudala kwaye kukho...”

SourceText: Let your child make up the next sentence
text: Vumela umntwana wakho azakhele esi sivakalisi silandelayo

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence
text: Emva koko ugqibezela isivakalisi

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story
text: Tshintshanani nide nibe nebali elitsha elimnandi

SourceText: Make sure to end the story on a positive note.
text: Qinisekisa ukuba ibali liphela kamnandi.

SourceText: Ask your child what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Buza umntwana wakho ukuba yeyiphi indawo ayithandileyo kwibali!

SourceText: The Interrupter
text: Umphazamisi

SourceText: Choose a storyteller to start making up a story.
text: Khetha umntu obalisa ibali ukuze aqalise ukulibalisa.

SourceText: Story listeners can interrupt with a word at any time.
text: Abantu abalimameleyo bangasebenzisa naliphi igama ukuze bangenelele nanini na.

SourceText: The storyteller needs to fit that word in their story.
text: Umntu obalisayo kufuneka asebenzise elo gama kwibali alibalisayo.

SourceText: Try with a different storyteller!
text: Zama umbalisi owahlukileyo!

SourceText: Three options
text: Ukhetho olukathathu

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat or flying a plane
text: Cinga ngeemeko ezintathu ezahlukahlukeneyo. Ngokomzekelo, ukuqhuba imoto, ukukhwela isikhitshana okanye ukubhabha ngenqwelo ntaka

SourceText: Say them to your child and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: Chazela umntwana wakho ngezi zinto uze umbuze, “Yeyiphi onokuyikhetha?”

SourceText: Ask them why?
text: Mbuze ukuba kutheni ekhetha leyo?

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your child to do it for you
text: Ngoku cinga ngeemeko ezintathu ezingakumbi okanye ucele umntwana wakho akwenzele

SourceText: When I Was Younger
text: Xa Ndandisemncinci

SourceText: Children love to hear stories about your own life!
text: Abantwana bayathanda ukuva amabali ngobomi bakho!

SourceText: Think of a time when you were younger when something BIG happened to you
text: Cinga ngexesha laxa wawuselula xa kwenzeke into ENKULU kuwe

SourceText: It can be an adventure, happy memory, or challenge that you experienced
text: Isenokuba luhambo lokubona iindawo, inkumbulo evuyisayo, okanye umngeni owajongana nawo

SourceText: Share it with your child and notice how they listen!
text: Balisela umntwana wakho uze uphawule indlela aphulaphula ngayo!

SourceText: Co-chef
text: Umpheki Ongumncedisi

SourceText: Ask your teen what kind of meal they would like to eat.
text: Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba angathanda ukutya isidlo esinjani.

SourceText: Prepare it together! The first time, you may need to guide them.
text: Senzeni nobabini! Isihlandlo sokuqala, usenokudinga ukubakhokela.

SourceText: Once your teen knows how to prepare the meal, let them take the lead and follow their instructions.
text: Xa okwishumi elivisayo waho ekwazi ukupheka isidlo, makab nguye okhokelayo aze ulandele imiyalelo yakhe.

SourceText: Let each child and teen in the house have a turn at being the head chef.
text: Vumela umntwana ngamnye okanye okwishumi elivisayo athathe ithuba lokuba ngumpheki oyintloko.

SourceText: You can even help them make a budget for ingredients!
text: Unokumnceda nokuba enze ibhajethi yezinto eziza kuthengwa xa kuphekwa!

SourceText: Shake your left hands in the air 8 times while counting to 8.
text: Vuthululani izandla zenu zasekhohlo emoyeni izihlandlo ezi-8 ngoxa nibala ukuya kutsho ku-8.

SourceText: Do it as fast and loud as you can.
text: Yenzani ngokukhawuleza kwaye ningxola kangangoko ninako.

SourceText: Repeat with your other hand. Then do it for each foot.
text: Phindani nangesinye isandla. Ngoku kwenzeni ngonyawo ngalunye.

SourceText: Everyone calls out “Crazy chicken” when you’re finished and does their best crazy chicken dance!
text: Wonke umntu ukhwaza athi “Inkukhu ephambeneyo” emva koko nidanise ngathi yinkukhu ephambeneyo!

SourceText: Create a dance choreography to your teen's favorite songs.
text: Yakha amanyathelo okudanisa kwiingoma umntwana wakho azithandayo.

SourceText: Get active!
text: Xakeka!

SourceText: Come up with three types of exercise together. For example, walking, jogging, soccer or dancing
text: Cingani ngeendlela ezintathu zokujima kunye. Ngokomzekelo, ukuhamba, ukunkcunkca, ukudlala ibhola okanye ukujayiva

SourceText: Pick one together and try it out.
text: Khethani kunye ibe nye nize niyizame.

SourceText: If you both like it, decide how often you are going to do it. Once or twice a week? Every morning?
text: Ukuba nobabini niyayithanda, gqibani ngokuba niza kuyenza kangaphi. Kanye okanye kabini ngeveki? Qho ngentseni?

SourceText: Together think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns in being the coach? Motivate each other with a small free reward?
text: Ninobabini, cingani ngendlela yokuyenza ibe mnandi nangakumbi. Ningankcunkca niyokutsho kwindawo ethile? Mhlawumbi nitshintshisane ngokuba ngumqeqeshi? Nikhuthazane ngomvuzo omncinci wasimahla?

SourceText: When we are able to have peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Today's tip is about how we can support positive family relationships at home.
text: Xa sikwazi ukuba nolwalamano oluseluxolweni nolunothando, abantwana bethu baziva bekhuselekile ngakumbi yaye bethandwa. Icebo lanamhlanje liphathelele indlela esingaluxhasa ngayo ulwalamano oluhle ekhaya.

SourceText: Everyone else must guess the name of the tune (to make it harder, they can guess the singer).
text: Wonke omnye umntu umele aqashisele igama lengoma (ukuze niyeze ibe nzima, angaqashisela nomntu oyiculayo).

SourceText: The first one to guess it right becomes the next leader who will choose or sing the next song.
text: Umntu wokuqala oqashisele walichana uba yinkokeli elandelayo eza kukhetha okaye icule iculo elilandelayo

SourceText: Pass the Snap
text: Dlulisa Ibhola

SourceText: This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: Lo mdlalo umnandi ngakumbi xa kukho abantu aba-3 ubuncinane.

SourceText: Start in a circle and pass one snap around the circle (or clap if you cannot snap).
text: Qalisani kwisangqa uze ugqithise ibhola kanye esangqeni (okanye uqhwabe xa ungakwazi ukujula).

SourceText: You snap once to throw the snap.
text: Ungenza isnpakube kanye ukuphosa i-snap.

SourceText: You can bounce the snap, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: Unokuyigqampisa “ibhola”, uyijule emoyeni uze uyibambe kambalwa ngaphambi kokuba uyidlulisele komnye umntu.

SourceText: The direction (up, down, straight, curved, rolling the ground) and force (hard, soft, medium) that you throw the snap should affect how the person catches it.
text: Indlela oyiphosa ngayo (phezulu, ezantsi, ngqo, ngasecaleni, iqengqeleka phantsi) kunye namandla (ngamandla kakhulu, ngokuthambileyo) imele ichaphazele indlela ayibamba ngayo umntu.

SourceText: Look at the person you are throwing the snap to.
text: Mjonge umntu omphoselayo.

SourceText: The person who will catch it has to snap once to catch it.
text: Umntu oyibambayo kufuneka enze isnap kube kanye ukuze ayibambe.

SourceText: When everyone gets good at this, you can start moving around the room, still passing around the snap.
text: Xa umntu wonke sele eqhelene noku, unokuqalisa ukujikeleza kwigumbi usajula ibhola.

SourceText: Can you throw under the leg?  Behind the back?  Through your head?  Intercept a pass? Have fun with the snap!
text: Ungakwazi ukuyijula ngaphantsi komlenze?  Ngemva komqolo?  Entla kwentloko yakho?  Ukuyibamba ngaphambi kokuba ifike komnye umntu? Nikonwabele ukudlala ngebhola!

SourceText: This game is best when more than 2 people play.
text: Lo mdlalo umnandi xa udlalwa ngabantu abangaphezu kwaba-2

SourceText: One person pretends to be doing something – for example, combing hair.
text: Umntu omnye wenza ngathi wenza into ethile – ngokomzekelo, ukama iinwele okanye upheka isidlo sangokuhlwa.

SourceText: A second person asks, “What are you doing?”
text: Omnye umntu ubuza athi, “Wenza ntoni?”

SourceText: The second person’s answer must always be something different from what they are actually doing!
text: Impendulo yomntu wesibini kufuneka isoloko yahlukile kule nto uyenza ngokwenene!

SourceText: The next person should act out the second person’s answer and when someone asks what they are doing, their answer must be different from what they are actually doing!
text: Umntu olandelayo ufanele enze into ekwimpendulo yomntu wesibini kwaye xa umntu ebuza ukuba wenzani, impendulo imele ibe yeyahlukileyo kule nto uyezayo!

SourceText: What’s new?
text: YIntoni entsha?

SourceText: Think of a new skill you could learn together with your teen. For example, keeping a ball in the air or your foot, juggling, learning a new language, or playing an instrument?
text: CInga ngesakhono esitsha onokusifunda kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo. Ngokomzekelo, ukugcina ibhola isemoyeni okanye enyaweni, ukuyiphosa, ukufunda ulwimi olutsha, okanye ukudlal isixhobo?

SourceText: Take turns in trying the new skill out.
text: Tshintshanani nize nizame ukwenza isakhono esitsha.

SourceText: Make sure to praise each other, and try to learn and play together!
text: Qinisekani ukuba niyancomana, nize nizame ukufunda nokudlala kunye!

SourceText: It might help to think of wishes, dreams, experiences at school, likes or dislikes. For example, I hate bananas, my favourite subject is science, and I really wish I could sing.
text: Kunganceda ukucinga ngezinto ozinqwenelayo, amaphupha akho, amava asesikolweni, izinto ozithandayo okanye ongazithandiyo. Ngokomzekelo, ndiyazicaphukela iibhanana, isifundo endisithandayo yisayensi kwaye ndikunqwenela kakhulu ukukwazi ukucula.

SourceText: Say them to your teenager. Ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: Zitsho kumntwana wakho okwishumi elivisayo. Bacele baqashisele ukuba yeyiphi ebubuxoki.

SourceText: Now ask them to do the same. Did you learn something new about each other?
text: Ngoku mcele enze into efanayo. Ikhona into entsha eniyifundileyo komnye nomnye?

SourceText: Talk to your teen about one positive or fun thing they did.
text: Uncokole nomntwana wakho ngento enye emnandi ayenzileyo.

SourceText: Dream Travel
text: UHambo Oluliphupha

SourceText: You can’t travel but you can dream! Ask your teen these questions.
text: Unako ukuhamba kodwa akunako ukuphupha! Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo le mibuzo.

SourceText: Where do you want to travel? How long will you be away? What will you pack? What will you do? What will you see?
text: Ufuna ukuhamba uye phi? Uza kuhamba ixesha elide kangakanani? Uza kupakisha ntoni? Uza kwenza ntoni? Uza kubona ntoni?

SourceText: Look at a map together if you have one.
text: Jongani imephu kunye ukuba ninayo.

SourceText: Choose a country that they’ve never heard of and look it up together online.
text: Khethani ilizwe abangazange beva ngalo nize nilikhangele kwi-intanethi.

SourceText: How was your day?
text: Belunjani usuku lwakho?

SourceText: Ask each other, “What made you happy today?”
text: Buzanani, “Yintoni ekwenze wonwaba namhlanje?”

SourceText: Ask each other, “What was difficult today?”
text: Buzanani, “Yintoni ibinzima namhlanje?”

SourceText: Ask each other, “How can we help you?”
text: Buzanani, “Singakunceda njani?”

SourceText: Try to do this together every day, when you are eating together or before bed
text: Zamani ukwenza le nto nonke yonke imihla, ninokuyenza xa nisitya kunye okanye ngaphambi kokulala

SourceText: Just a friendly chat
text: Incoko yobuhlobo

SourceText: Have a conversation with your teen about something they like.
text: Ncokola kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nento ayithandayo.

SourceText: It can be about anything they choose to talk about: sports, friends, music, celebrities…
text: Isenokuba yiyo nantoni na abakhetha ukuncokola ngayo: imidlalo, iitshomi, umculo, oosaziwayo.

SourceText: Try to listen to your teen and give them space to talk.
text: Zama ukummamela umntwana wakho uze umvumele athethe.

SourceText: What new thing did you learn about your teen from your chat?
text: Yintoni entsha oyifundileyo ngokwishumi elivisayo wakho kule ncoko

SourceText: Make up a story!
text: Yenza ibali!

SourceText: Let your teen make up the next sentence.
text: Vumela umntwana wakho ofikisayo enze isivakalisi esilandelayo.

SourceText: Then you make up a sentence.
text: Emva koko ugqibezela isivakalisi.

SourceText: Take turns until you have a wonderful new story.
text: Tshintshanani nide nibe nebali elitsha elimnandi.

SourceText: Ask your teen what was their favourite part of the story!
text: Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba yeyiphi indawo ayithandileyo kwibali!

SourceText: Ask your teen “If you had the superpower to […] how would you use it?”
text: Buza umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba, “xa ubunamandla angaphezu kwemvelo oku[...], ubungawasebenzisa njani?”

SourceText: Encourage them to give themselves a superhero name and act like a superhero.
text: Mkhuthaze ukuba azithiye igama leqhawe elinamandla angaphaya kwaqhelekileyo enze loo nto beliza kuyenza.

SourceText: Now let them choose a super power for you.
text: Ngoku mabakukhethele into enamandla angaphaya kwaqhelekileyo.

SourceText: Make sure you act it out too!
text: Qiniseka ukuba nawe uyayenza!

SourceText: Think of three different situations. For example, driving a car, sailing a boat, or flying a plane.
text: Cinga ngeemeko ezintathu ezahlukahlukeneyo. Ngokomzekelo, ukuqhuba imoto, ukukhwela isikhitshana okanye ukubhabha ngenqwelo ntaka.

SourceText: Say them to your teen and ask, “Which would you prefer?”
text: Chazela umntwana wakho okwishumi elivisayo ngezi zinto uze umbuze, “Yeyiphi onokuyikhetha?”

SourceText: Now think of three more situations or ask your teen to do it for you.
text: Ngoku cinga ngeemeko ezintathu ezingakumbi okanye ucele umntwana wakho ofikisayo akwenzele.

SourceText: Second person adds to first person’s plan, “When COVID-19 ends, I am going to the park and… (e.g., visit my best friend)”

SourceText: Remember that you’re in charge of what they eat, but not how much. Newborns have stomach the size of a grape! They need to eat often (sometimes in the middle of the night.
text: Khumbula ukuba nguwe owongamele into abayityayo, kodwa hayi ukuba kangakanani. Iimveku ezisanda kuzalwa zinezisu ezibukhulu bungangomdiliya! Kufuneka zitye rhoqo (ngamanye amaxesha ezinzulwini zobusuku.

SourceText: It’s important to build trust around eating, especially as your baby starts on solid food. Let them know you are listening to their wishes in the eating department. They’ll be ravenous again soon!
text: Kubalulekile ukwakha ukuthembana malunga nokutya, ingakumbi kuba usana lwakho luqala ukutya ukutya okuqinileyo. Benze baqonde ukuba uyimamele iminqweno yabo yecandelo lokutya. Baza kulamba ngokukhawuleza kwakhona msinyane!

SourceText: When your children ask you about COVID-19, be willing to talk. They will already have heard something. Silence and secrets do not protect our children. Honesty and openness do. Think about how much they will understand. You know them best.
text: Xa abantwana bakho bekubuza nge-COVID-19, kulungele ukuthetha. Bamele ukuba ikho into abayivileyo. Ukuthula neemfihlo azibakhuseli abantwana bethu. Ukunyaniseka nokuthetha ngokukhululekileyo kuyabakhusela. Cinga ngendlela abaza kuqonda ngayo.  Ubazi bhetele kakhulu.

SourceText: Here are 4 simple steps that you can do when talking about COVID-19 with your children:
text: Nanga amanyathelo ama-4 ongawenza xa uthetha nge-COVID-19 nabantwana bakho:

SourceText: 1. Be open, honest, and supportive
text: 1. Khululeka, nyaniseka kwaye ubaxhase

SourceText: 2. It is okay not to know the answers
text: 2. Kuhle ukuba ungazazi iimpendulo

SourceText: 3. Be a hero not a bully
text: 3. Yiba ligorha hayi umvuyeleli

SourceText: 4. End on a good note
text: 4. Gqibezela ngenowuthi emnandi

SourceText: Step 3. Be a hero not a bully
text: Inyathelo 3. Yiba ligorha hayi umvuyeleli

SourceText: Explain that COVID-19 has nothing to do with the way someone looks, where they are from, or what language they speak.
text: Cacisa ukuba i-COVID-19 ayinanto yakwenza nendlela umntu abonakala ngayo, nokuba basuka phi, okanye ulwimi abaluthethayo.

SourceText: Here is a comic on how to talk to your child about COVID-19.
text: Nantsi into ehlekisayo kwindlela yokuthetha nomntwana wakho nge-COVID-19.

SourceText: Child: “Am I going to get coronavirus?”
text: Umntwana: “Ingaba ndiza kufumana intsholongwane yekhorona?”

SourceText: Parent: “It is very possible that we will all get coronavirus. But younger people do not normally get very sick.”
text: Umzali: “Kunokwenzeka kakhulu ukuba Sonke siza kufumana intsholongwane yekhorona. Kodwa abantu abaselula abadli ngokugula kakhulu.”

SourceText: Child: “I am scared…”
text: Umntwana: “Ndiyoyika...”

SourceText: Parent: “It is okay to be afraid. We are all a bit scared about this. But we have each other and can do our best to keep ourselves and other people safe and healthy.”
text: Umzali: “Kulungile ukoyika. Sonke sinendawo eyoyikayo ngale nto. Kodwa siyaxhasana kwaye singenza konke okusemandleni ukuzigcina sikhuselekile kwaye sisempilweni.”

SourceText: Child: “How can we keep safe?”
text: Umntwana: “Singahlala njani sikhuselekile?”

SourceText: Parent: “We can wash our hands regularly for 20 seconds. We can also keep a good physical distance away from people. We also need to try to avoid touching our faces as much as possible.”
text: Umzali: “Sinokuhlamba izandla zethu rhoqo kangangeesekhondi ezingama-20. Kwakhona sinokugcina umgama obonakalayo kude nabanye abantu. Kwakhona kufuneka sizame ukuphepha ukuphatha ubuso bethu kangangoko kunokwenzeka.”

SourceText: Child, “Okay…”
text: Umntwana, “Kulungile...”

SourceText: Child: “What happens to your body when you get coronavirus?”
text: Umntwana: “Kwenzeka ntoni emzimbeni wakho xa ufumana intsholongwane yekhorona?”

SourceText: Parent: “To tell you the truth, I don’t know exactly. How about we look on the UNICEF website together?”
text: Umzali: “Xa ndikuxelela inyaniso, andazi ngokuthe ngqo. Kunganjani ukuba sijonge iwebhusayithi ye-UNICEF kunye?”

SourceText: WHO: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public
text: WHO: https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/advice-for-public

SourceText: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19
text: UNICEF: https://www.unicef.org/coronavirus/covid-19
