SourceText: Sometimes we feel frustrated with our children because we expect them to behave in ways that they are not yet developmentally ready for.
text: Ngamanye amaxesha siziva sixakanisekile ngenxa yabantwana bethu kuba silindele ukuba baziphathe ngeendlela abangekazilungeli ngokokukhula kwabo.

SourceText: Learning about child development means we can have realistic expectations and also to spot any problems with their growth and development.
text: Ukufunda ngokukhula komntwana kuthetha ukuba zsingalindela izinto akwaziyo ukuzenza kwaye kwakhona ukubona naziphina iingxaki ekukhuleni kwabo nasekuphuhleni kwabo.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. Here's a video to help you understand what to expect from your children.
text: Bonke abantwana bakhula ngamazinga awahlukeneyo. Nantsi ividiyo yokukunceda uqonde  into omele uyilindele kubantwana bakho.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. Here's an audio message to help you understand what to expect from your children.
text: Bonke abantwana bakhula ngamazinga awahlukeneyo. Nanku umyalezo  wamazwi wokukunceda uqonde  into omele uyilindele kubantwana bakho.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about child development.
text: Kulungile! Unako ukusoloko uchwetheza “Uncedo” ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngakumbi ngendlela yokukhulisa umntwana.

SourceText: All children develop at different rates. But there are some things that we expect children to be able to do at an age. These are called ‘development’ milestones.
text: Bonke abantwana bakhula ngamazinga awahlukeneyo. Kodwa kukho izinto ezithile esilindele ukuba abantwana bakwazi ukuzenza kubudala obuthile. Ezi zibizwa ngokuba ngamanqanaba’okukhula’.

SourceText: Many things affect our children's development. For example, development is helped by eating healthy food, having immunisations, and parents or caregivers who talk to them a lot.
text: Izinto ezininzi zichaphazela ukukhula kwabantwana bethu. Ngokomzekelo, ukukhula kuncedwa kukutya ukutya okusempilweni, ukugonywa, kunye nabazali okanye abanyamekeli abathetha nabo kakhulu.

SourceText: Which child development milestones do you want to learn about?
text: Liliphi inqanaba lokukhula lomntwana wakho ofuna ukufunda ngalo?

SourceText: Sorry I don't understand what you mean.
text: Uxolo andiqondi ukuba uthetha ukuthini.

SourceText: Young children have similar needs as toddlers.  Here's an audio message to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Abantwana abancinane baneentswelo ezifanayo njengabantwana ababhadazayo..  Nanku umyalezo wamazwi wokukunceda uqonde iintswelo zokukhula komntwana wakho bhetele.

SourceText: Babies from 0 to 1 year need lots of play and attention. Here's a video to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: IIntsana ezisusela ku 0 ukuya ku 1 zidinga ukudlala kakhulu nengqalelo. Nantsi ividiyo yokukunceda uqonde iintswelo zokukhula komntwana wakho bhetele.

SourceText: Babies from 0 to 1 year need lots of play and attention. Here's an audio message to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: IIntsana ezisusela ku 0 ukuya ku 1 zidinga ukudlala kakhulu nengqalelo. Nanku umyalezo wamazwi wokukunceda uqonde iintswelo zokukhula komntwana wakho bhetele.

SourceText: Young children have similar needs as toddlers.  Here's a video to help you understand your child's developmental needs better.
text: Abantwana abancinane baneentswelo ezifanayo njengabantwana ababhadazayo..  Nantsi ividiyo yokukunceda uqonde iintswelo zokukhula komntwana wakho bhetele.

SourceText: Young children (4-6 years):
text: Umntwana omncinci (iminyaka emi-4 ukuya kweli-6).

SourceText: • Same as toddlers, but also...
text: • Ngokufanayo nabantwana ababhadazayo,kodwa kwakhona...

SourceText: • Learn through actions and play.
text: • Funda ngezenzo uze udlale.

SourceText: • Develop friendships with other children
text: • Khulisa ubuhlobo nabanye abantwana

SourceText: • Find it difficult to separate make-believe from reality. Still express feelings in dramatic ways!
text: • Ukufumanisa kunzima ukwahlula izinto omele uzikholelwe kwezokwenene. Sekunjalo vakalisa iimvakalelo ngeendlela ezinedrama!

SourceText: Young teenagers (10-12 years)
text: Abakwishumi elivisayo abaselula (10-12 iminyaka)

SourceText: • More interested in learning in school.
text: • Umdla ongakumbi ekufundeni.

SourceText: • Start to want independence and trust.
text: • Qalisa ukufuna ukuzimela nokuthembana.

SourceText: • Want to spend time with other children and young teenagers.
text: • Ufuna ukuchitha ixesha nabanye abantwana nabakwishumi elivisayo abaselula.

SourceText: • May be interested in religion or spirituality
text: • usenokuba unomdla kunqulo okanye kubumoya

SourceText: • May answer back to adults to show that they “know”.
text: • Usenokuphedula kubantu abadala ukubonisa ukuba “bayazi”.

SourceText: • Can be very self-conscious and sensitive
text: • Unokuba nokuzisizela okugqithisileyo nochuku

SourceText: • Can learn to better manage anger and tolerate frustration.
text: • Unokufunda bhetee ukulawula umsindo kunye nokunyamezela ukuxakaniseka.

SourceText: Infant (0–1 year) needs:
text: Usana (0-1 iminyaka) lundinga:

SourceText: • Us to provide food, sleep, cleaning, comfort and safety.
text: • Thina silubonelele ngokutya, ngokulala, ngokucoca, ukuthuthuzelwa nokhuseleko.

SourceText: • A strong bond with parent/ caregiver.
text: • Ulwalamano olomeleleyo nomzali/umnyamekeli.

SourceText: • Lots of play and attention - the most active time of brain development is during the first 1000 days of life!
text: • Ukudlala kakhulu nengqalelo - elona xesha lokusebenza kwengqondo kakhulu kusebudeni beentsuku ezili-1000 zobomi!

SourceText: Middle teenagers (13-14 years)
text: Abakwishumi elivisayo abaphakathi (13-14 iminyaka)

SourceText: • Begin to challenge adult rules
text: • Baqalisa ukucela umngeni imithetho yabantu abadala

SourceText: • Are often insecure and confused.
text: • Basoloko beziva bengakhuselekanga kwaye bedideklie.

SourceText: • Feelings get hurt easily and have mood swings
text: • Baziva besonzakala lula kunye nokuba neemvakalelo ezitshintsha qho

SourceText: • Try to be the boss and are unhappy if they lose.
text: • Zama ukuba ngumphathi kwaye awuvuyi xa bengaphumeleli.

SourceText: Infants (0-1):
text: Iintsana (0-1):

SourceText: • 0–6 months: Smile, babble and cry to attract your attention. We should provide care, cuddling and protection.
text: • Iinyanga e-0-6: Ziyancuma, zibhibhidle iintsini zize zikhale kuba zifuna ingqalelo yakho Simele sizibonelele ngokuzikhathalela, sizimbambazele size sizikhusele.

SourceText: • 6–11 months: Cling to you, especially when feeling insecure or frightened.
text: • Iinyanga e-6-11: Ukubambelela kuwe, ingakumbi xa uziva unganqabisekanga okanye usoyika.

SourceText: • 12–23 months: Start to walk, talk and explore things around them!
text: • Iinyanga e-12-23: Qalisa ukuhamba, thetha uze uhlolisise izinto ezikungqongileyo!

SourceText: • Their friends are important and affect their choices
text: • Abahlobo bakhe babalulekile kwaye bachaphazela ukhetho lwabo

SourceText: • Need some freedom but also reliable rules that don't change
text: • Badinga inkululeko ethile kodwa kwakhona imithetho enokuthenjwa engatshintshiyo

SourceText: • Need affection, reassurance, self-esteem, encouragement to believe in their abilities
text: • Badinga ububele, ukuqinisekiswa, ukhuthazo ukukholelwa kubuchule babo

SourceText: Toddlers (2-3 years):
text: Ababhadazayo (2-3 iminyaka):

SourceText: • Become a curious little explorer - watch out for climbing!
text: • Baba ngabahloli bendawo abancinane - gada ukunyuka!

SourceText: • Learn through play and trying things out
text: • Bafunda ngokudlala kunye nokuzama izinto

SourceText: • Want to learn how to do new things (like getting dressed) and make their own decisions.
text: • Bafuna ukufunda indlela yokwenza izinto (njengokunxiba) kunye benze izigqibo zabo.

SourceText: • Want your praise and your approval
text: • Bafuna ukunconywa nguwe kunye nokwamkelwa nguwe

SourceText: • May talk a lot; ask many questions. We should be honest when we reply! Our child may ask again if they don't understand or want to know more
text: • Basenokuthetha kakhulu; babuze imibuzo emininzi. Simele sinyaniseke xa siphendula! Abantwana bethu bangabuza kwakhona ukuba abayiqondi into okanye bafuna ukwazi okungakumbi

SourceText: • Does not like to lose, share or take turns, but losing and taking turns can be taught.
text: • Akakuthandi ukungaphumeleli, ukwabelana okanye ukubolekisana, kodwa ukungaphumeleli nokubolekisana kungafundiswa.

SourceText: Older teenagers (15–19 years)
text: Abakwishumi elivisayo abadadlana (15-19 iminyaka)

SourceText: • The teen years are the second most active time of brain development!
text: • Iminyaka yeshumi elivisayo lelona xesha lesibini ingqondo esebenza kakhulu ngalo!

SourceText: • Your child is almost an adult, they are able to communicate with you about
text: • Umntwana wakho sele eza kuba ngumntu omdala, uyakwazi ukuthetha nawe ngokuphathelele

SourceText: almost anything.
text: phantse yonke into.

SourceText: • They can think about new ideas, develop their own ideals and set their own course.
text: • Banokucinga ngeembono ezintsha, baphuhlise iimbono zabo baze bazenzele umzila wabo.

SourceText: • Start speaking in sentences and  learning new words.
text: • Baqalisa ukuthetha izivakalisi baze bafunde amagama amatsha.

SourceText: • Does not like to lose or take turns, but sharing can be taught.
text: •Abathandi ukungaphumelel okanye ukubolekisana, kodwa ukwabelana bangakufundiswa.

SourceText: • May express feelings in dramatic ways (like screaming on the floor!). Can start to learn how to manage their feelings.
text: • Basenokuvakalisa iimvakalelo ngeendlela ezinedrama (njengokukhwaza phantsi emgangathweni!). Usengaqalisa ukufunda ukulawula iimvakalelo zakhe.

SourceText: Older children (7-9 years)
text: Umntwana omncinci (iminyaka emi-7 ukuya kweli-9).

SourceText: • Same early childhood, but also…
text: • Ubuntwana obufanayo, kodwa buquka...

SourceText: • Interested in learning at school.
text: • Ukuba nomdla wokufunda esikolweni.

SourceText: • Starts to want independence and trust.
text: • Qalisa ukufuna ukuzimela nokuthembana.

SourceText: • Wants to spend time with other children.
text: • Ufuna ukuchitha ixesha nabanye abantwana.

SourceText: • They are forming their own identity and have a growing sense of their
text: • Bazakhela ububona babo kwaye banemvakelelo ekhulayo yezabo

SourceText: sexuality
text: ubuni

SourceText: • They may prefer being with peers more than with you
text: • Basenokukhetha ukuba kunye nabahlobo ngaphezu kokuba kunye nawe

SourceText: • They may show risk-taking behaviours, frequent mood swings, and rebellious
text: • Banokubonisa isimilo sokuthatha umngcipheko, ukutshintsha rhoqo kweemvakalelo, kunye nokuvukela

SourceText: attitudes. They can also have exciting new ideas!
text: izimo zengqondo Banokuba nazo neengcamango ezintsha ezinika umdla!

SourceText: • May start to ask questions about religion
text: • Banokuqalisa ukubuza imibuzo ngonqulo

SourceText: • Can be very self-conscious and sensitive. May be very active. By now they should be getting better at managing anger and frustration.
text: • Unokuba nokuzisizela okugqithisileyo nochuku. Usenokuphithizela kakhulu. Kungoku nje bamele babengcono kwindlela abawulawula ngayo umsindo nokukhathazeka.

SourceText: • Be patient and accepting of the person they are becoming - even if it is not what you had imagined
text: • Yiba nomonde uze wamkele umntu ababa nguye - kwanaxa ibingeyonto ubunombono wayo

SourceText: • Encourage them to begin to take responsibility for the future
text: •Bakhuthaze ukuba baqalise ukuthatha uxanduva ngekamva

SourceText: • Keep supporting them and loving them so that they feel comfortable, secure, and safe
text: • Qhubeka ubaxhasa uze ubathande ukuze bazive bekululekile , bekhuselekile baze bazive bengekho ngozini

SourceText: All children, including those living with disabilities, need love, respect and time especially at difficult times.
text: Bonke abantwana, kuquka nabo baphila nokukhubazeka, bafuna uthando, intlonipho kunye nexesha ingakumbi kumaxesha anzima.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support children living with disabilities.
text: Nantsi ividiyo yokukunceda uxhase abantwana abaphila nokukhubazeka.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support children living with disabilities.
text: Nanku umyalezo wamazwi wokukunceda uxhase abantwana abaphila nokukhubazeka.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" if you want to learn more about how to support children living with disabilities.
text: Kulungile! Ungasoloko uchwetheza “Uncedo” ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngakumbi ngendlela yokuxhasa abantwana bakho abaphila nokukhubazeka.

SourceText: Here are 6 simple tips that you can do to support children living with disabilities:
text: Nazi iingcebiso ongazenza ukuxhasa abantwana bakho abaphila nokukhubazeka:

SourceText: 1. Keep your child safe and well
text: 1. Gcina abantwana bakho bekhuselekile kwaye besempilweni

SourceText: 2. Try to understand what they are feeling
text: 2. Zama ukuqonda indlela abaziva ngayo

SourceText: 3. Communicate and talk with them
text: 3. Nxibelelana uze uthethe nabo

SourceText: 4. Praise them!
text: 4. Bancome!

SourceText: 5. Make things that you do the same every day to help them feel secure
text: 5. Yenza izinto ozenzayo ngendlela efanayo ukuze ubancede bazive bekhuselekile

SourceText: 6. Ask for help if you can
text: 6. Cela uncedo ukuba unako

SourceText: Type "1" to "6" to learn more about each tip. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Chwetheza “1” ukuya ku ”6” ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nengcebiso nganye. Chwetheza “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: Step 4. Praise them!
text: Inyathelo 4. Bancome!

SourceText: • Praise them for behaving well, and for trying.
text: • Bancome ngokuziphatha kakuhle, nangokuzama.

SourceText: • Focus on what they can do, not what they can't.
text: • Jolisa koko bakwaziyo ukukwenza, kungekhona koko bangakwaziyo.

SourceText: • Only help children when they need it. It is also good to build independence!
text: • Kuphela bancede abawana xa bekudinga oko. Kukwayinto entle ukwakha ukuzimela!

SourceText: Step 6. Ask for help if you can
text: Inyathelo 6. Cela uncedo ukuba unako

SourceText: • Share the load with other adult family members.
text: • Yabelanangomthwalo nabanye abantu abadala kusapho.

SourceText: •  You are not alone! Keep connected with people who understand your situation.
text: • Awukho wedwa! Hlala uqhagamshelana nabantu abayiqondayo imeko yakho.

SourceText: Here is a comic on how you can reinforce your child's strength.
text: Nali ibali ngendlela ongabethelela ngayo amandla omntwana wakho.

SourceText: • Share your challenges AND your successes.
text: • Yabelana ngemingeni yakho KUNYE nezinto ophumelela kuzo.

SourceText: • It is normal to feel stressed, frustrated, and afraid at this time.
text: • Kuqhelekile ukuziva uxinezelekile, uxakanisekile, kwaye usoyka ngeli xesha.i

SourceText: • Be kind to yourself and take a break when you need to!
text: • Zinyamekele uze uthathe ikhefu xa kudingeka oko!

text: Umntwana: "la la la la…."

SourceText: Teen: "la la la la…"
text: Ofikisayo: "la la la la…"

SourceText: Disabled Child: "la la la la…"
text: Umntwana Okhubazekileyo: "la la la la…."

SourceText: Parent: "It was so lovely to hear you singing while I was preparing dinner. Food is ready! Please tidy the room and put away the toys."
text: Umzali: “Bekumnandi ukukuva ucula xa bendilungiselela isidlo. Ukutya sekulungile! Nceda ucoe egumbini uze ususe iizinto zokudlala.”

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support children living with disabilities:
text: Ungasoloko uchwetheza “Uncedo” ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngakumbi ngendlela yokuxhasa abantwana bakho abaphila nokukhubazeka.

text: Umntwana ofikisayo: :Nantsi ibhokisi yezinto zokudlala. Singakwazi ukufaka ezi zinto zokudlala ngaphakathi.”

text: Umntwana Okhubazekileyo: “Nceda ukhumbule imoto yam endiyithandayo!

text: Umntwana: “Ndinayo kanye apha!”

text: Umzali: “Ndiyavuya kuba uye waqokelela izinto zakho zokudlala! Lixesha lokutya!”

SourceText: Disabled child: "Can you help me come to dinner?"
text: Umntwana Okhubazekileyo: “Ingaba ungandinceda ndize kwisidlo?”

SourceText: Parent: "Thank you for asking. Let's go together. You are so strong!"
text: Umzali: “Enkosi ngokubuza. Masambeni kunye. Womelele kakhulu!”

SourceText: Step 1. Keep your child safe and well
text: Inyathelo 1. Gcina abantwana bakho bekhuselekile kwaye besempilweni

SourceText: • Keep your country's COVID-19 rules, and also help @fields.child_nickname_disabled to be active - do whatever exercise you can with them inside or outside your home
text: • Gcina imithetho ye-COVID-19, kwaye kwakhoana nceda u @fields.child_nickname_disabled enze imisebenzi - yenza nayiphina imithambo onako ukuyenza kunye nabo ngaphakathi okanye ngaphandle kwekhaya

SourceText: • Keep emergency contact numbers somewhere easy to see
text: • Gcina iinombolo zoqhagamshelwano kwindawo ekulula kuzibona kuyo

SourceText: • Keep your country's COVID-19 rules, and also help your child to be active - do whatever exercise you can with them inside or outside your home
text: • Gcina imithetho ye-COVID-19, kwaye kwakhona nceda umntwana wakho enze imisebenzi - yenza nayiphina imithambo onako ukuyenza kunye nabo ngaphakathi okanye ngaphandle kwekhaya

SourceText: Step 5. Make daily plans to help them feel secure
text: Inyathelo 5. Yenza  amacebo mihla le ukubanceda bazive bekhuselekile

SourceText: • Having things that are the same each day helps children feel secure and safe.
text: • Ukuba nezinto ezifanyo suku ngalunye kunceda abantwana bazive benqabisekile kwaye bekhuselekile.

SourceText: • Make a daily plan that includes some things they like to do.
text: • Yenza amacebo amihla le aquka izinto ezithile abathanda ukuzenza.

SourceText: • Help @fields.child_nickname_disabled connect to friends and family members through phone, writing cards, or drawing pictures.
text: • Nceda u @fields.child_nickname_disabledaqhagamshelane nabahlobo nosapho ngomnxeba, ngamakhadi abhalwayo, okanye ukuzoba imifanekiso.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Help your child connect to friends and family members through phone, writing cards, or drawing pictures.
text: • Nceda umntwana wakho aqhagamshelane nabahlobo nosapho ngomnxeba, ngamakhadi abhalwayo, okanye ukuzoba imifanekiso.

SourceText: Step 2. Try to understand how they are feeling
text: Inyathelo 2. Zama ukuqonda indlela abaziva ngayo

SourceText: • @fields.child_nickname_disabled may be feeling a lot of stress, anxiety, and frustration.
text: • U @fields.child_nickname_disabled usenokuba uziva enestresi, enexhala, kwaye exakanisekile.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Tell them that you love them
text: • Baxelele ukuba uyabathanda

SourceText: • Praise them for being good and for trying to be good!
text: • Bancome ngokuba ngabalungileyo nokuzama ukuba ngabalungileyo!

SourceText: • Your child may be feeling a lot of stress, anxiety, and frustration.
text: • Umntwana wakho usenokuba uziva enestresi, enexhala, kwaye exakanisekile.

SourceText: • Give @fields.child_nickname_disabled choices: this gives them a sense of control and builds self-esteem.
text: • Nika u @fields.child_nickname_disabled ukhetho: oku kubanika imvakalelo yokulawula kwaye kwakha ukuzithemba.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Use simple language and clear instructions. If words aren't good for them, try gestures and pictures.
text: • Sebenzisa ulwimi olulula kunye nemiyalelo ecacileyo. Ukuba akukho lula kubo ukusebenzisa amazwi, zama izimbo zomzimba nemifanekiso.

SourceText: • Give your child choices: this gives them a sense of control and builds self-esteem.
text: • Nika umntwana wakho ukhetho: oku kubanika imvakalelo yokulawula kwaye kwakha ukuzithemba.

SourceText: Step 3. Talking and communicating with your child
text: Inyathelo 3. Ukuthetha nokunxibelelana nomntwana wakho

SourceText: • Get down to @fields.child_nickname_disabled’s level when you speak.
text: • Yehla uye kumgangatho wo @fields.child_nickname_disabled xa uthetha.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Look at them and smile
text: • Bajonge uze uncume

SourceText: • Give them time to tell you or show you what they think
text: • Banike ixesha lokukuxelela okanye lokukubonisa ukuba bacinga ntoni

SourceText: • Tell @fields.child_nickname_disabled that you understand
text: • Mxelele u @fields.child_nickname_disabled ukuba uyaqonda
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: • Get down to your child’s level when you speak.
text: • Yehla uye kumgangatho womntwana wakho  xa uthetha.

SourceText: • Tell your child that you understand
text: •Xelela umntwana wakho ukuba uyaqonda

SourceText: Hello @fields.user_name! Today we are going to learn what we can do when our children are already misbehaving or have already misbehaved…
text: Molo  @fields.user_name! Namhlanje siza kufunda ngendo esinokuyenza xa abatwana sele bengaziphethanga kakuhle okanye beye abaziphatha kakuhle...
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hello! Today we are going to learn what we can do when our children are already misbehaving or have already misbehaved…
text: Molo! Namhlanje siza kufunda ngendo esinokuyenza xa abatwana sele bengaziphethanga kakuhle okanye beye abaziphatha kakuhle...

SourceText: Use consequences for refusing to follow instructions or forgetting household rules. Consequences help teach our children responsibility for what they do. They also allow discipline that is controlled. This is more effective than hitting or shouting.
text: Sebenzisa iziphumo zokuba eye akalandela imiyalelo okanye ukulibala imiygaqo yasekhaya. Iphumo inceda ekufundiseni abantwana bethu ukuba bazithwalele uxanduva ngezinto abazenzayo. Kwakhona zivumela uqeqesho olunolawulo. Oku kuphumelela ngakumbi kunokubetha okanye ukungxolisa.

SourceText: Children and teens often act disrespectfully or like they only care about themselves. Growing up is a difficult time when they are learning about who they are and how they want to be in the world. Luckily, there are other ways to discipline your teen without using violence…and they work well!
text: Abantwana nabafikisiayo badla ngokuhlonipha okanye babonakale bezinyamekela. Ukukhula lixesha elinzima xa bezifunda ukuba bangoobani nendlela abafuna ukuba yiyo ehlabathini. Ngethamsanqa, zikhona iindlela zokohlwaya umntwana wakho ofikisayo ngaphandle kokusebenzisa ubundlobongela… yaye zisebenza kakuhle!

SourceText: Giving calm consequences help teach our children responsibility for what they do. They also allow discipline that is controlled. This is more effective than hitting or shouting.
text: Ukuza nemiphumo ezolileyo kunceda ekufundiseni abantwana bethu ukuba bazithwalele uxanduva ngezinto abazenzayo. Kwakhona zivumela uqeqesho olunolawulo. Oku kuphumelela ngakumbi kunokubetha okanye ukungxolisa.

SourceText: Here are 5 tips for using consequences:
text: Nanga amacebiso ama-5 okusebenzisa imiphumo:

SourceText: 1. Give a choice before consequence
text: 1. Mkhethise ngaphambi komphumo

SourceText: 2. Stay calm but be firm
text: 2. Hlala uzolile kodwa uqine

SourceText: 3. Be realistic and follow through
text: 3. Yiba sengqiqweni uze ulandelele

SourceText: 4. Reconnect afterwards
text: 4. Phindani nivane emva koko

SourceText: 5. Consequences for breaking rules
text: 5. Imphumo yokophula imigaqo

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "5". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nenye yezi ngcebiso, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "5". Ungachwetheza kananjalo “N" ukuya phambili.

SourceText: Consequences can also be used when your children forget a household rule, like going to bed at a certain hour or doing schoolwork before T.V.
text: Imiphumo isenokusetyenziswa kwanaxa umntwana wakho elibala imigaqo yasekhaya, njengokuya kulala ngeyure ethile okanye ukwenza umsebenzi wesikolo phambi kwe-T.V.

SourceText: 2. Try to stay calm but firm when giving the consequence.
text: 2. Zama ukuhlala uzolile kodwa uqine xa unikeza imiphumo.

SourceText: If you start yelling, it will just make things worse. Take a deep breath before you speak in a clear, calm, and firm voice.
text: Ukuba uqalisa ukungxola, oko kuyakwenza izinto zibe mbi ngakumbi. Phefumla nzulu ngaphambi kokuba uthethe ngelizwi elicacileyo, elizolileyo neliqinileyo.

SourceText: Make sure you can follow through with the consequence. For example, taking away a teenager’s phone for a week is hard to enforce. Taking it away for one hour is more realistic.
text: Qiniseka ukuba uza kukwazi ukulandelela isiphumo eso. Ngokomzekelo,  ukuthatha ifowuni yofikisayo kangangeveki kunzima ukuyinyanzelisa loo to. Ukuyithatha nkangangeyure kokona kusengqiqweni ngakumbi.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about using consequences:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nendlela yokusebenzisa imiphumo:

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows a parent giving their child a choice to follow the instruction or receive a consequence.
text: Nali ibali elibonisa umzali ekhethisa umntwana wakhe ukulandela imiyalelo okanye afumane imiphumo.

SourceText: Parent: “In 5 minutes it will be time to give me back the phone and start your school work.”
text: Umzali: “Kwimizuzu emi-5 iza kuba lixesha lokundinika ifowuni uze uqalise umsebenzi wakho wesikolo.”

SourceText: Teen (distractedly): “Uh-huh…”
text: Ofikisayo (ephazamisekile): “Uh-huh…”

SourceText: Parent: “5 minutes is up. Please give me the phone.”
text: Umzali: “Iphelileimizuzu emi-5. Ndicela undinike ifowuni.”

SourceText: Teen: “No, I am not done. I just need to get to the next level.”
text: Umntwana ofikisayo: “Hayi, andikagqibi. Ndisafuna nje ukufikelela kwinqanaba elilandelayo.”

SourceText: Parent: “You have a choice, either you give me the phone now, or you cannot use it after dinner.”
text: Umzali: “Funeka ukhethe, ukunidinak ifowuni ngoku, okanye akunako  ukuyisebenzisa emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa.”

SourceText: Teen (not happy but agreeing): “Fine.”
text: Umntwana ofikisayo (akavuyi kodwa uyavuma): “Kulungile.”

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for giving me the phone back, Carter. Now please do your school work. After that we can take a walk or play a game together.”
text: Umzali: “Enkosi ngokundinika ifowuni, Carter. Ngoku yenza umsebenzi wakho wesikolo. Emmva koko singahambahamba okanye sidlale umdlalo kunye.”

SourceText: 4. Reconnect afterwards.
text: 4. Phindani nivane emva koko.

SourceText: Once the consequence is over, give @fields.child_nickname a chance to do something good, and praise them for it.

SourceText: Once the consequence is over, give your child a chance to do something good, and praise them for it.
text: Xa umphumo uphelile, nika umntwana wakho  ithuba lokwenza into elungileyo uze umncome ngokuyenza.

SourceText: For example, you can tell @fields.child_nickname that if they do not do their schoolwork before dinner, they cannot watch their favourite T.V. show that evening.

SourceText: Well done! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! When your child is behaving badly, try responding in a calm way with a fair consequence. It will help them learn that their actions have an impact on themselves and others. It also teaches them about responsibility and respect!
text: Usebenzile! Wongeze esinye  isakhono kwiSeti yakho yeziXhobo zokuba  nguMzali! Xa umntwana wakho engaziphathi kakuhle, zama ukusabela ngendlela ezolileyo neziphumo ezibubulungisa. Oku kuya kubancenda bafunde ukuba izenzo zabo zinefuthe kubo nabanye. Kakhona kubafundisa ngoxanduva nentlonelo!

SourceText: Well done! You have added another layer to your House of Support! When your child is behaving badly, try responding in a calm way with a fair consequence. It will help them learn that their actions have an impact on themselves and others. It also teaches them about responsibility and respect!

SourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can support our teens when they experience really difficult situations.
text: Icebiso lanamhlanje ngokuphathelele indlela yokuxhasa abantwana bethu abafikisayo xa bejongene neemeko ezinzima ngokwenene.

SourceText: When our children share difficult experiences with us, we may initially get angry because we are afraid for them. But that is when we need to stay calm, listen, and be open.
text: Xa abantwana bethu besabelana ngamava nathi, mhlawumbi singaqala sibe nomsindo kuba siboyiikisela. Koda kulapho sidinga ukuzola, siphulaphule size  sikhululeke.

SourceText: Do you want some tips that can help you respond in a more supportive way?
text: Ingaba ufuna amacebiso athile anokukunceda usabele ngendlela entle kakhulu?

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Technical Support." Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Khumbula ukuba nokutshintsha uhlobo lomyalalezo owufumanayo kumntwana omdadlana okanye omncinane. Vele ukhetha “Inkxaso Yobuchwepheshe.” Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Technical Support." Chat to you later!
text: Khumbula ukuba nokutshintsha uhlobo lomyalalezo owufumanayo kumntwana omdadlana okanye omncinane. Vele ukhetha “Inkxaso Yobuchwepheshe.” Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva!

SourceText: When our children share something that is especially troubling, we need to remember to stay calm, listen, and be open.
text: Xa abantwana bethu bebalisa into egakhathaza ngokukhethekileyo, sifanele sikhumbule ukuhlala sizolile, siphulaphule size sikhululeke.

SourceText: Here's a video on how you can support your teen when they are experiencing difficult situations.
text: Nantsi ividiyo engendlela yokuxhasa ofikisayo xa ejongene neemeko ezinzima.

SourceText: Here's an audio message on how you can support your teen when they are experiencing difficult situations.
text: Nanku umyalezo onamazwi wendlela yokuxhasa ofikisayo xa ejongene neemko ezinzima.

SourceText: Here are some things you can do when your teen shares something difficult with you:
text: Nazi zinto onokuzenza xa ofikisayo ekubalisela into enzima kuwe:

SourceText: • Take a deep breath before you respond.
text: • Phefumla nzulu ngaphambi kokuba uphendule.

SourceText: • Listen to what your child is saying. Notice how they are feeling.
text: • Phulaphula oko umntwana wakho akutshoyo. Phawula indlela abaziva ngayo.

SourceText: • Notice how you feel. Ask yourself, "What does my child need right now?"
text: Phawula indlela ovakalelwa ngayo. Zibuze ukuba “umntwana wam udinga ntoni ngoku?”

SourceText: • Reassure your child that you are there for them.
text: • Mqinisekise umntwana wakho ukuba ukulungele ukumnceda.

SourceText: • You can deal with the consequences later but right now your child needs you.
text: • Ungayisingatha mva imiphumo kodwa ngoku umntwana wakho udinga wena.

SourceText: • Discuss possible solutions or next steps to take action.
text: • Xubushani ngezisombululo ezinokufumaneka okanye  amanye amanyathelo eninokuwathabatha.

SourceText: • Remind your child again that you love them and thank them for sharing with you.
text: • Khumbuza umntwana wakho ukuba uyamthanda kwaye uyambulela ngokuba eye wakuchazela.

SourceText: We understand that this can be really difficult. Please type "Help" if you want any extra support or guidance.
text: Siyaqonda ukuba kunokuba nzima nyani oku.  Nceda uchwetheze “Uncedo" ukuba ufuna nayiphi na inkxaso okanye isikhokelo esingaphaya.

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can support your child during a crisis.
text: Nali ibali elibonisa indlela onokuxhasa ngayo umntwana wakho ebudeni bamaxesha anzima.

SourceText: Parent: “What’s wrong, my dear? Come and sit by me and tell me what happened.”
text: Umzali: “Yintoni erongo, sthandwa? Yiza uze uhlale nam uze undixelele oko kwenzwekileyo.”

SourceText: Child: “It’s that person…they touched me…”
text: Umntwana: “Ngulaa mntu...uye wandiphatha...”

SourceText: Parent: “Take your time... I am listening.”
text: Umzali: “Ziphe ixesha... "Qhubeka, ndiphulaphule.”

SourceText: Child: “… they held me down…told me I would be in trouble if I told anybody…”
text: Umntwana: “...baye bandibamba...bandixelele ukuba ndiza kuba sengxakini ukuba ndixelele nabanina...”

SourceText: Parent: “I believe you. You are not in trouble. It is not your fault. This is a big thing and we will find a way to get the help you need. I wonder where we can go for help…?”
text: Umzali: “Ndiyakukholelwa.  Awukho sengxakini. Asilotyala lakho eli. Inkulu le nto yaye siza kufumana indlela yokufumana uncedo oludingayo. Ndiyazibuza ukuba singayaphi ukuze sifumane uncedo...?”

SourceText: Child: “The clinic? But could you come with me?”
text: Umntwana: “Ekliniki bethu? Kodwa ingaba ungahamba nam?”

SourceText: Parent: “Yes, they will know what to do. Of course, I will come with you. Remember, this is not your fault. I love you and we will get through this.”
text: Umzali: “Ewe, baza kwazi ukuba benzeni. Nangoku, ndiza kuza kuwe. Khumbula ayilotyala lakho eli. Ndiyakuthanda kwaye siza kudlula kule nto.”

SourceText: Child: “Thanks so much.”
text: Umntwana: “Enkosi kakhulu.”

SourceText: Remember you can always type "Help" if you ever want more parenting tips or support.
text: Khubula unako ukusoloko uchwetheza “Uncedo” ukuba ufuna ingcebiso ezingaphaya zokuba ngumzali okanye inkxaso.

Wenza kakuhle!

SourceText: When we are able to have peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Kindness and taking care of yourself help.
text: Xa sikwazi ukuba nolwalamano oluseluxolweni nolunothando, abantwana bethu baziva bekhuselekile ngakumbi yaye bethandwa. Ububele nokuzinyamekela kuyanceda.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you support positive family relationships at home.
text: Nantsi ividiyo yokukunceda uxhase ulwalamano lwentsapho oluhle ekhaya.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you support positive family relationships at home.
text: Nanku umyalezo onamazwi wkunceda uxhase ulwalamno lwentsapho oluhle ekhaya.

SourceText: Here are 6 simple steps that you can do to support family harmony at home:
text: Nanga amanyathelo ama-6 onokuwenza ukuxhasa imvisiswano ekhaya:

SourceText: 1. Be a model of behaviour for your kids
text: 1. Yiba ngumzekelo wokuziphatha kubantwana bakho

SourceText: 2. Keep it positive
text: 2. Lindela okuhle

SourceText: 3. Listen carefully to others
text: 3. Baphulaphule ngenyameko abanye

SourceText: 4. Share the load
text: 4. Thwalisanani umthwalo

SourceText: 5. Take care of yourself
text: 5. Zinyamekele

SourceText: 6. Do nice things together as a family.
text: 6. Yenzani izinto ezimnandi kunye njengentsapho.

SourceText: Type "1" to 6" to learn more about these tips. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "6" ukuze ufunde ngakumbi ngala manyathelo. Chwetheza “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: Step 4. Share the load
text: Inyathelo 4. Thwalisanani umthwalo

SourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared. Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members
text: Ukunyamekela abantwa namanye amalungu osapho kunzima, kodwa kulula ngakumbi xa nithwelisene umthwalo. Zamana ukwabelana ngemisebenzi yekhaya, ukunyamekela umntwana, neminye imisebenzi ngokulinganayo phakathi kwamalungu osapho

SourceText: Step 5. Take care of yourself
text: Inyathelo 5. Zinyamekele

SourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household. It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break
text: yenza ucwangciso kangangexesha “eliphakathi” kunye nexes a”elingaphandle” nabanye abantu abadala endlini. Kulungile ukucela uncedo xa uziva udiniwwe okanye unestresi ukuze uthathe ikhefu

SourceText: Step 6. Do nice things together as a family
text: Inyathelo 6. Yenzani izinto ezimnandi kunye njengentsapho.

SourceText: Let each family member take turns choosing a whole family activity. Find ways to spend time alone with other adults in your home, too!
text: Ilungu ngalinye losapho limele  libolekisane eukhethenni umsebenzi wosapho. Khangela iindlela zokuchitha ixesha uwedwa nabanye abantu abadalaekhaya, nawe!

SourceText: Step 1. Be a model of behaviour for your kids
text: Inyathelo 1. Yiba ngumzekelo wokuziphatha kubantwana bakho

SourceText: How we talk and behave in front of our children is a big influence on how they behave too! Try to talk kindly to everyone in the family, adults and children.
text: Indlela esithetha kwaye siziphathe ngayo iphembelela kakhulu kwindlela abaziphatha ngayo nabo! Zama ukuthetha kakuhle naye wonke umntu kusapho, abantu abadala kunye nabantwana.

SourceText: Step 2. Use positive language. It works!
text: Inyathelo 2. Sebenzisa ulwimi  oluhle. Iyasebenza!

SourceText: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don’t want them to do: Instead of “Stop shouting,” try “Please speak more quietly”
text: Xelela abanye oko ufuna bakwenze endaweni yoko ungafuniyo bakwenze: Endaweni “Yokuyeka ukungxola,” zama “Ukuthetha ngokuzolileyo”

SourceText: Decide to take a break from arguing when you see arguments building up, and go into another room or outside if you can.
text: Yenza isigqibo sokuthatha ikhefu ekuxambulisaneni xa ubona ukuba ingxabano iyakhula, uze uye kwelinye igumbi okanye ngaphandle ukuba unako.

SourceText: You can always type "Help" if you need an activity to help you with stress.
text: Ungasoloko uchwetheza “Uncedo” nanini na ufuna umsetyenzana wokukunceda ngoxinzelelo.

SourceText: Praise others to make them feel appreciated and good about themselves. Simple words like, “Thank you for clearing the dinner,” or “Thank you for watching the baby” can make a big difference
text: Bancome abanye ukuze ubenze bazive bexatyiswa kwaye beziva mnandi. amagama alula afanan nathi, “Enkosi ngokuqoqosha emva kwesidlo, okanye “Enkosi ngokujonga umntwana” kungenza umahluko omkhulu

SourceText: Bad communication between adults in the household can have a negative impact on our children. The more we practice modeling peaceful, loving relationships for our children, the more secure and loved they will feel.
text: Ukungathethisani kakuhle phakathi kwabantu abadala endlini kunganefuthe elibi kubantwana bethu. Okukhona siqhelisa ukuba nolwalamano oluseluxolweni, olunothando nabantwanna bethu, kokukhona beyakuziva bekhuselekile kwaye bethandwa.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to support family harmony at home:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nendlela yokuxhasa imvisiswano yosapho ekhaya:

SourceText: Step 3. Be a great listener
text: Inyathelo 3. Yiba ngumphulaphuli olunge kakhulu

SourceText: Listen to others when they are talking with you. Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying. It can help to summarise what you have heard before responding: “What I hear you saying is…”
text: Phulaphula abanye xa bethetha nawe. Vuleka uze ubabonise ukuba uyabeva into abayithethayo. Kunganceda ukushwankathela into oyivileyo ngaphambi kokuba uphendule: “Into endikuva uyithetha kukuba…”.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try taking a deep breath or walking away for a bit when you start getting angry at someone. Every time you find a way to resolve conflicts in a peaceful way, you increase your child's brain development. Be proud of yourself when you do it!
text: Usebenzile ngokongeza esinye isakhono kwikiti yakho yeziXhobo zokuba  nguMzali! Kwiintsukuezimbalwa ezizayo, zama ukuphefumla nzulu okanye uhambe kancinane xa uqalisa ukucatshukiswa ngumntu. Lonke ixesha ufumana indlela yokusombulula impikiswano ngendlela eseluxolweni, wandisa amathuba okukhula kwengqondo yomntwanawakho. Zidle ngawe xa ukwazi ukukwenza!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try taking a deep breath or walking away for a bit when you start getting angry at someone. SourceText: Here are some tips that might help when your baby cries:
text: Nazi iingceibo ezinokukunceda xa umntwana wakho ekhala:

SourceText: 1. Why babies cry
text: 1. Isizathu sokuba abantwana bakhale

SourceText: 2. Respond as soon as you can
text: 2. Sabela ngokukhawuleza kangangoko unako

SourceText: 3. Check to see why your baby is crying
text: 3. Khangela ubone ukuba kutheni usana lwakho lukhala.

SourceText: 4. Comfort your baby
text: 4. Thuthuzela usana lwakho

SourceText: 5. Take a break if you need it
text: 5. Thatha ikhefu ukuba uyalidinga

SourceText: 6. Be gentle and patient with yourself
text: 6. Yiba nonophelo kwaye ube nomonde kuwe

SourceText: 7. If you think your baby is injured or sick, call or visit a clinic
text: 7. Ukuba ucinga ukuba usana lwakho lonzakele okanye uyagula, fowunela okanye utyelele ekliniki

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "7". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukuze ufunde ngakumbi ngezi, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "7". Kwakhona unokuchwetheza u “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: If your baby cries for a long time and does not stop, they might be injured or sick. You should seek medical help immediately.
text: Ukuba umntwana wakho uyakala kangangexesha elide kwaye akayeki, kusenokuba wenzakele okanye uyagula. Ufanele ufune uncedo lwezonyango ngokukhawuleza.

SourceText: Go to your baby when you hear them crying. You will not spoil your baby by picking them up. Babies who are carried and cuddled frequently, during both fussy and contented periods, may actually cry less.
text: Yiya emntwaneni wakho xa umva ekhala. Akuyi kuba umyamtefisa umntwana wakho xa umfunqula. Abantwana abafunqulwayo nabambanjazelwayo rhoqo, ebudeni bamaxesha aluzizi kunye nanokhuphiswano, bangathi bangakhali kangako.

SourceText: 1. Why do babies cry?
text: 1. Kutheni abantwana bekhala?

SourceText: Crying is a normal part of your baby's development. Sometimes babies even have crying patterns. Crying usually increases at 2-3 weeks old and is generally highest when your baby is around 6 to 8 weeks. Often babies will start crying less around 3 to 4 months. Of course, remember that every baby is different!
text: Ukukhala kuyinxalenye eqhelekileyo yokukhula komntwana wakho. Ngamanye amaxesha abantwana baneephatheni zokukhala. Ukukhala kudla ngokukhula kwiiveki ezi-2-3 ubudala kwaye ngokuqhelekileyo kube kwelona zinga liphezulu malunga neeveki ezi-6-8. ngokufuthi abantwana baza kuqalisa ukukhala kancinane malunga neenyanga ezi-3-4. Kambe ke, khumbula ukuba mntwana ngamnye wahlukile!

SourceText: 3.  Check to see why your baby is crying
text: 3.  Khangela ubone ukuba kutheni usana lwakho lukhala.

SourceText: There are lots of reasons why babies cry. It might be hunger, pain, too much going on, rough handling, feeling cold/hot, wanting contact or attention, or feeling irritable. Babies can cry when they sense tension in the room. And sometimes they cry for no reason at all!
text: Kukho izizathu ezininzi zokuba abantwana bakhale. Usenokuba ulambile, uyaqaqanjelwa , kukho okuninzi, ukuphatheka kakubi, ukuziva egodola,/etshisa, efuna ukuqhagamshelana okanyeingqalelo,okanye uziva ecaphukile. Abantwana basenokukhala xa besiva kungemnandanga egumbini abakulo. Kwaye ngamanye amaxesha bakhala ngaphandle kwesizathu!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about what to do when your baby is crying:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokukhala komntwana wakho:

SourceText: Here is a comic on coping with a colicky baby
text: Nali ibali lokumelana nomntwana onexakaxa

SourceText: Parent 1: "We should do something."
text: Umzali 1: “Simele senze okuthle.”

SourceText: Parent 2: "Okay, I'll try feeding them."
text: Umzali 2: “Kulungile, ndiza kuzama ukumtyisa.”

SourceText: Baby: "aaaaaaaa"
text: Umntwana: "aaaaaaaa"

SourceText: Parent 1:  "What is wrong with them?"
text: Umzali 1:  “Yintoni ingxaki yakhe?”

SourceText: Parent 2: "I don't know. It has been an hour and they are still crying. I cannot take it anymore. They are driving me crazy, I just want to shake them!"
text: Umzali 2: "Andazi. Ibisoloko iyiyure kwaye basakhala. Andisakwazi ukunyamezela. Undenza igeza, ndifuna ukukhe ndimhlukuhle!”

SourceText: Parent 2: "I can see that this has been a stressful night for you. How about you get some sleep while I take Frankie into the other room. I will try wrapping them up in a blanket."
text: Umzali 2: “Ndingabona ukuba obu ibibubusuku obunestres kuwe. Kungjani ukhe ufuma ukulala ngoxa ndithatha uFrankie ndimsa egumbini. Ndiza kumbijela ngengubo.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Thank you. I was getting so angry at myself."
text: Umzali 1: "Enkosi. Bendisele ndizicaphukela kwamna.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "How did you manage to get them to sleep?"
text: Umzali 1: “Ukwazi njani ukumenza alale?”

SourceText: Parent 2: "I think they wore themselves out but we should take them to the clinic tomorrow morning."
text: Umzali 2: “Ndicinga ukuba uye wazidinisa koda simele simthathe simse ekliniki ngomso kusasa.”

SourceText: Call someone for help - a family member, a friend. Sometimes just talking with someone is enough, but if you feel overwhelmed, ask someone for help. Calling for help is a sign of strength.
text: Fowunela umntu akuncede -ilungu losapho, umhlobo. Ngamanye amaxesha konele nje ukuthetha nomntu, kodwa ukuba usaziva woyisakele, cela uncedo emntwini. Ukucela uncedo luphawu lokomelela.

text: Nantsi ividiyo enokunceda xa u @fields.child_nickname ekhala.

SourceText: 5. Take a break!
text: 5. Hlaba ikhefu!

SourceText: If you are getting angry because @fields.child_nickname won’t stop crying, it’s OK to leave them on their back in a safe place and walk away for a bit. Check on @fields.child_nickname every 5-10 minutes.
text: Ukuba unomsindo kuba u @fields.child_nickname akayeki ukukhala, KULUNGILE ukumbuyisela endaweni ekhuselekileyo uze uhambe  umzuzwana. Mkhangele @fields.child_nickname qho kwimizuzu emi-5 ukuya kweli-10.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If you are getting angry because your baby won’t stop crying, it’s OK to leave them on their back in a safe place and walk away for a bit. Check on your baby every 5-10 minutes.
text: Ukuba unomsindo kuba umntwana wakho akayeki ukukhala, KULUNGILE ukumbuyisela endaweni ekhuselekileyo elele ngomqolo uze uhambe  umzuzwana. Lukhangele usana lwakho qho kwimizuzu emi-5 ukuya kweli-10

SourceText: We know that this is not easy. You are not a bad father if your baby continues to cry after you have done all you can to calm them. You are doing your best!
text: Siyazi ukuba oku akukho lula. Khumbula awungomzali mbi ukuba usana lwakho  luyaqhuba lukhala  emva kokuba wenze konke okusemandleni akho ukuluzolisa. Wenza konke okusemandleni akho!

SourceText: We know that this is not easy. You are not a bad mother if your baby continues to cry after you have done all you can to calm them. You are doing your best!
text: Siyazi ukuba oku akukho lula. Akungomama ombi ukuba umntwana wakho uqhubeka ekhala emva kkokuba wenze konke onako ukukwenza ukubathuthuzela. Wenza konke okusemandleni akho!

SourceText: Try swaddling, gently rocking, or singing or soft music. You might need to feed @fields.child_nickname or change their diaper. They may be too hot or too cold. Or maybe they just need to be held. Take a Pause and try to relax - @fields.child_nickname can actually sense tension from you, too!
text: Zama ukumjiwuzisa, umjinigsa kancinane, okanye ucule okanye umculo opholileyo. Usenokufuna ukumtyisa u @fields.child_nickname  okanye umtshintshe inapukeni. Basenokuba bayatsha okanye bayagodola. Okanye mhlawumbi badinga ukufunqulwa. Yithinxha iyo uze uzame ukuthomalala - u @fields.child_nicknameangeva ukuba kukho ukungabi mnandi, nakuwe!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try swaddling, gently rocking, or singing or soft music. You might need to feed your baby or change their diaper. They may be too hot or too cold. Or maybe they just need to be held. Take a Pause and try to relax - your baby can actually sense tension from you, too!
text: Zama ukumjiwuzisa, umjinigsa kancinane, okanye ucule okanye umculo opholileyo. Kunokufuneka kananjalo ukuba ulutyise usana lwakho okanye utshintshe inapkeni lwalo. Basenokuba bayatsha okanye bayagodola. Okanye mhlawumbi badinga ukufunqulwa. Yithixha uze uzame ukuthomalala - u angeva ukuba kukho ukungabi mnandi, nakuwe!

SourceText: Today's Tip is about how we can support our children when they are feeling sad, scared, angry, and confused.
text: Ingcebiso yanamhlanje ngokuphathelel indlela esingaxhasa ngayo abantwana bethu xa bekhathazekile, besoyika, umsindo kwaye bedidekile.

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Tech Support". Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Khumbula ukuba nokutshintsha uhlobo lomyalalezo owufumanayo kumntwana omdadlana okanye omncinane. Vele ukhetha “Inkxaso Yobuchwepheshe”. Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Remember that you can also change the type of messages you receive for an older or younger child. Just select "Tech Support". Chat to you later!
text: Khumbula ukuba nokutshintsha uhlobo lomyalalezo owufumanayo kumntwana omdadlana okanye omncinane. Vele ukhetha “Inkxaso Yobuchwepheshe”. Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva!

SourceText: Be open to your children. They get stressed too - sometimes from different things from you. Allow them to express how they feel and accept their feelings. Try to listen to them and think about how it must feel for them.
text: Sukubafihlela nto abantwana bakho. Nabo baba noxinezelelo - ngamanye amaxesha oluvela kwezinye izinto ezahlukileyo kuwe. Bavumele bavelise indlela abaziva ngayo uze wamkele indlela abaziva ngayo. Zama ukubaphulaphula uze ucinge indlela abamele bazive ngayo ngeziqu zabo.

SourceText: Here are some tips for how we can help our children learn how to cope with their emotions:
text: Nanga amacebiso endlela esinokunceda ngayo abantwana bethu indlela yokujamelana neemvakalelo:

SourceText: 1. Be open to your child
text: 1. Sukubafihlela nto abantwana bakho.

SourceText: 2. Share your own feelings
text: 2. Yabelana nabo ngeemvakalelo

SourceText: 3. Help your child learn how to talk about feelings
text: 3. Nceda abantwana bakho bafunde indllea yokuthetha ngeemvakalelo

SourceText: 4. Talking about difficult emotions
text: 4. Ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo ezinzima

SourceText: 5. Notice the positive emotions
text: 5. Phawula iimvakalelo ezikhuthazayo

SourceText: 6. Show your child that you care
text: 6. Bonisa umntwana wakho ukuba uyakhathala

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "6". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukuze ufunde ngakumbi ngezi, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "6". Kwakhona unokuchwetheza u “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: Your child will look to you for support and reassurance. Listen to your children when they share how they are feeling. Accept how they feel and give them comfort.
text: Umntwana wakho uya kujonga kuwe ukuze afumane inkxaso ngendlela yokuxhasa nokuqinisekisa. Phulaphula umntwana wako xa ebalisa indlela aziva ngayo. Yamkela indlela abazziva ngayo uze ubathuthuzele.

SourceText: When you share your own feelings with your children, you help them recognise their own feelings. It can also help your children learn self-discipline and to understand their own feelings.
text: Xa usabelana ngeemvakalelo  zakho nabantwana bakho, ufanele ubancede baqonde ezabo iimvaalelo. Kwakhona kungaba luncedo kubantwana bakho bafunde ukuziqeqesha baze baqonde iimvakalelo zabo.

SourceText: There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. Even babies can feel and express these emotions. As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
text: Kukho iimvakalelo ezi-6 ezisisiseko: Ukuvuya, ukuKhala, ukuCaphuka, ukuDikwa, ukuMangaliswa, nokoYika. Kwanabantwana banokuziva baze babonise iimvakalelo zabo. Njengokuba abantwana bakhula, bafunda ukuchonga iimvakalelo ezizeniye ezininzi, njengokuchulumanca, ukuxakaniseka, ukuba nelunda, ukuba lilolo, ukuba seluxolweni, ukuziva unetyala, okanye ukudideka,.

SourceText: It is normal to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. Many of us were told not to cry when we were sad or laugh when we were happy. This may be especially the case for boys and men.
text: Kuqhelekile ukuba nobunzima ukuthetha ngokuvakalisa iimvakalelo nezimvo. Abaninzi bethu baye baxelelwa ukuba bangakhali xa sibuhlungu okanye bahleke xa bonwabile. Oku kunokuba njalo ngokukhethekileyo kwimeko yamakhwenkwe namadoda.

SourceText: But we all have the same feelings, and  we can learn how to become aware of our own emotions, to experience them in our body, and to communicate about them.
text: Kodaw sonke sineemvakalelo ezifanayo, kwaye singafunda indlela yokuba sazi iimvakalelo zethu, ukuba namava azo kwimizimba yethu, size sinxibelelane nabo.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about talking about emotions:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuththa ngeemvakalelo:

text: Nanku umyalezo onamazwi nokukunceda ufundise umntwana wakho indlela yokujongana neemvakalelo zakhe.

SourceText: Here's a video that can help you teach @fields.child_nickname how to cope with their emotions.

note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Here's a video that can help you teach your child how to cope with their emotions.
text: Nantsi ividiyo enokukunceda ufundise umntwana wakho  ajongane neemvakalelo zakhe.

SourceText: Talking about feelings can help children manage anger, disappointment, and frustration. It can also help @fields.child_nickname be more aware of positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness. It can also allow children to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
text: Ukuthetha ngeemvakalo kunokunceda abantsana balawule umsindo, ukudana, nokuxakaniseka. Kukwanokunceda u @fields.child_nickname azi ngakumbi iimvakalelo ezikhuthazayo njengokuziva eseluxolweni, onwabile, okanye ezolile. Ikwanokuthi ivumele abantwana baqonde ixesha elimnanci okanye bazive bethandwa!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Talking about feelings can help children manage anger, disappointment, and frustration. It can also help your child be more aware of positive emotions such as a sense of peace, happiness, or calmness. It can also allow children to appreciate a beautiful moment or feeling of love!
text: Ukuthetha ngeemvakalo kunokunceda abantsana balawule umsindo, ukudana, nokuxakaniseka. Kukwanokunceda umntwanawakho  azi ngakumbi iimvakalelo ezikhuthazayo njengokuziva eseluxolweni, onwabile, okanye ezolile. Ikwanokuthi ivumele abantwana baqonde ixesha elimnanci okanye bazive bethandwa!

SourceText: Use physical and verbal support to make @fields.child_nickname feel accepted and loved. A hug or saying, "I understand," can mean a lot. Remind @fields.child_nickname that you are there for them and that they can always talk to you.
text: Sebenzisa inkxaso yomzimba neyomlomo ukwenzela ukuba u @fields.child_nickname azive amkelekile kwaye ethandwa. Ukanga okanye ukuthi, “ndiyaqonda,” kungathetha okukhulu. Khumbuza  u @fields.child_nickname ukuba ukhona ukuze umxhase kwaye banokuthi basoloko bethatha nawe.

SourceText: Parent: “How are you doing, Andy?”
text: Umzali: “Unjani, Andy?”

SourceText: Teen (looking sad): “I wish I could hang out with my friends.”
text: Ofikisayo (ubonakal ekhathazekile): “Ndinqwenela ukuba ndihlale nabahlobo bam.”

SourceText: Parent (thinking): "Hmmm…that can wait…"
text: Umzali (uyacinga): "Hmmm…oko kungalinda..."

SourceText: Parent (looks back to teen):“I understand it is hard to be separate from your friends. Especially since I am sure they are missing you, too. Let’s think of some ways that you could reach out to them.”
text: Umzali (ujonga emva kofikisayo): “Ndiyaqonda ukuba kunzima ukwahluka kubahlobo bakho. Ingakumbi njengokuba ndiqinisekile ukuba nabo bayakukhumbula. Masicinge ngeendlela  ezithile onokufikelela ngazo kubo.”

SourceText: Teen: "Maybe I can make a TikTok video to share with them. But I am not sure how…can you help me?”
text: Umntwana ofikisayo: “Mhlawumbi ndingenza Ivdiyo y-TikTok ukwabelana nabo. Kodwa andiqinisekanga njani...ingaba ungandinceda”

SourceText: Parent: “I would be happy to help and would like to know more about TikTok, too!”
text: Umzali: “ndingakuvuyela ukunceda kwaye ndingathanda ukwazi ngakumbi nge-TikTok, nawe!”

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can give your teen love and support when they share difficult emotions with you…
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi ebonsia ukuba ungamnika njani umntwana wakho ofikisayo  uthando nenkxaso xa esabelana nawe ngeemvakalelo ezinzima...

SourceText: Child: “Why can’t I go play with my friends today?”
text: Umntwana: “Kutheni ndingenako ukudlala nabahlobo banamhlanje?”

SourceText: Parent: “I can see that you are upset, Sam. It can be difficult when we feel separated from our friends.”
text: Umzali: “Ndingabona ukuba ucaphukile, Sam. Kusenokuba nzima xa siziva sisahlukaniswa nabahlobo bethu.”

SourceText: Parent: “We are not allowed to visit other people right now because of COVID-19.
text: Umzali: “Asivumelekanga ukutyelela abanye abantu ilungelo ngoku ngenxa ye-COVID-19.

SourceText: This will keep them and us safe while making sure our health services are able to support those who are sick."
text: Oku kuya kunceda bona kunye nathi sikhuselekile ngoko siqinisekisa uba inkonzo yezempilo yethu iya kwazi ukuxhasa abo bagulayo.”

SourceText: Parent: “As soon as we are able, you can play with your friends. In the meantime, we can draw some pictures of your favourite times playing with them.”
text: Umzali: “Sakuba nje sikwazi, unako ukudlala nabahlobo bakho. Okangoku, sinokuzoba imifanekiso yakho oyithandayo yamaxesha othanda ukudlala ngawo.”

SourceText: Child: “Okay!”
text: Umntwana: "Kulungile!"

SourceText: Here are 6 steps on how we can reduce negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like tantrums using what we call Ignore:
text: nanga amanyathelo ama-6 ngendlela esinokunciphisa ngayo indlela yokuziphatha yokufuna ingqalelo ufuna izinto ngetshova usebenzisa into esiyibiza ngokuthi kukungayinanzi:

SourceText: 1. Try to redirect your child’s attention
text: 1. Fumana ingqalelo yomntwana wakho

SourceText: 2. Make sure it is a behaviour you can ignore
text: 2. Qiniseka ukuba yindlela yokuzphatha onokunyinanzi

SourceText: 3. Ignore the behaviour not your child
text: 3. Sukunanza indlela yokuziphatha hayi umntwana wakho

SourceText: 4. Praise your child immediately for the next positive behaviour
text: 4. Mncome umntwana wakho ngoko nangoko ukwenzela indlela elandelayo yokuziphatha

SourceText: 5. Be consistent when ignoring
text: 5. Sukumana utshintsha xa ungayinanzi

SourceText: 6. Make sure you are giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times.
text: 6. Qinisekaisa ukuba unika umnika umntwana ingqalelo eninzi ekhuthazayo ngamanye amaxesha.

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to "6". You can also type "N" to move on.
text: Ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nenye yezi ngcebiso, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "6". Ungachwetheza kananjalo “N" ukuya phambili.

SourceText: Here is a comic on combining consequences and ignore.
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi ngokudibanisa imiphumo nokungananzi.

SourceText: Parent 1: "Bailey, please clear the dishes after dinner"
text: Umzali 1: “Bailey, nceda uqoqoshe izitya emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa”

SourceText: Parent 2: "Sam, time to get ready for bed. Come with me."
text: Umzali 2: “Sam, lixesha lokuba ulungele ukuya kulala. Yiza hamba nam.”

SourceText: Parent: "The household rule is that you have to help clean up after dinner before you can play with your toys."
text: Umzali: “Umthetho walapha ekhaya kukuba kufuneka uncede ukucoca emva  kwesidlo sangokuhlwa ngaphambi kokuba udlale ngezinto zakho zokudlala.”

SourceText: Child: "I don't want to clear the dishes. I want to play with my new toy car. "
text: Umntwana: “Andifuni ukuqoqosha izitya. Mna ndifuna ukudlala ngethi yam yemoto entsha.”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Bailey, either you clear the table now, or you will not be able to play with your toys later tonight"
text: Umzali 1: “Bailey, uza kuqqosah itafile ngoku, okanye akuyi kudlala ngeethoyi zakho ngokuhlwanje”

SourceText: Child: "But it is not fair! Sam doesn't have to clean up after dinner!"
text: Umntwana: “Kodwa ndiyaqhathwa mna! USam akanyanzelekanga aqoqoshe emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa!”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Because you did not listen, you cannot play with your toys. Please get ready for bed.
text: Umzali 1: “Ngenxa yokuba ungaphulaphuli, akunaukudlala ngeethoyi zakho. Nceda ulungele ukuya kulala.

SourceText: Child: "But that is not fair!"
text: Umntwana: “Kodwa ndiyaqhathwa mna!

SourceText: Child: "But that is not fair. Waaaah!"
text: Umntwana: “Kodwa ndiyaqhathwa mna. Waaaah!"

SourceText: Parent 1: "It is so nice to see that you got ready for bed all by yourself!"
text: Umzali 1: “Kumnandi ukubona ukuba uye walungela ukulala ngokwakho!”

SourceText: Child: "Now can I play with my toy car?"
text: Umntwana: “Ngoku ndingadlala ngethoyi yam?”

SourceText: Parent 1: "You can play with your car tomorrow. It is bedtime. Come, my sweetie, I will tell your favourite bedtime story."
text: Umzali 1: “Unako ukudlala ngemoto yakho ngomso. Lixesha lokulala. Yiza, sithandwa sam, ndiza kukubalisela ibalo ngaphambi kokuba ulale:”

SourceText: Parent 1: "Once upon a time..."
text: Umzali 1: “Kwathi kaloku ngabali...”

SourceText: 1. Try to redirect your child's attention
text: 1. Zama ukutshintsha ingqalelo yomntwana wakho

SourceText: When they start demanding for something or whining, first try to redirect them to a positive behaviour or activity. Praise them for that positive behaviour!
text: Xa beqalisa ukufuna ngetshova into okanye bekhalaza, qala uzame ukutshintsha ingqalelo yabo ibe yindlela yokuziphatha ekhuthazayo okanye umsetyenzana. Bancome  ngendlela abazipheehta kakuhe ngayo!

SourceText: These are behaviours like whining, demanding, showing off, tantrums, and lots of other negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours that might make us think of the child as a bad child. But there are no bad children, only difficult behaviours!
text: kukho indlela yokuziphatha efana nokukhalaza, ukufuna ngetshova, ukuqhayisa, ukugqushalaza, kunye nezinye iindlela zokuziphatha ezimbi zokufuna ingqalelo nokufuna ngetshova ezinosenza sicinge ukuba umntwana ngumntu ombi. Kodwa akukho bantwana babi...kuphela kukuziphatha okunzima!

SourceText: When you ignore your child's behaviour (but not your child!), your child learns that the demanding behaviour will not work.
text: Xa ungayihoyi indlela aziphatha ngayo umntwana wakho (kodwa hayi umntwana wakho), umntwana wakho ufunda ukuba ukufuna ngetshova akuyi kumsebenzela.

SourceText: If we respond to these behaviours, our children learn that this behaviour will get them attention. They sometimes also learn that if they increase the demand, they will get their way.
text: Ukuba siyasabela kule ndlela aziphatha ngayo, umntwana ufunda ukuba le ndlela yiyo eza kumenza anikwe ingqalelo. Maxa wambi badla ngokufuda ukuba bangandisa indlela abafuna ngetshova ngayo izinto, baza kuzifumana izinto abazifunayo.

SourceText: This takes time AND patience. Normally your child will try to test you and behave worse. This is a good time to Take a Pause and Keep Calm.
text: oku kuthatha ixesha KUNYE nomonde. Ngokuqhelekileyo umntwna wakho uya kuzama ukukuvavanya aze abaxe izinto.  Eli lixesha lokuba Uthi Xhauze Uzole.

SourceText: 6. Make sure you are giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times
text: 6. Qinisekisa ukuba unika umnika umntwana ingqalelo eninzi ekhuthazayo ngamanye amaxesha

SourceText: Children need attention. If children get plenty of attention for just being themselves, as well as for the “good” things that they do, it helps them to feel good about themselves, and they do more of what they are asked.
text: Abantwana badinga ingqalelo. Ukuba abantwana bafumana ingqalelo ngokuba nje babe ngabo, kwakunye nezinto “ezintle” abazenzayo, oku kuyabanceda bazive kamnandi, kwaye benza okungakumbi kunokuba becelwa.

SourceText: Your child's behaviour might continue to get worse.  It is important that you continue to ignore the behaviour.
text: Indlela aziphatha ngayo umntwana wakho isenokuqhubeka isiba mbi ngakumbi.  Kubalulekile ukuba uqhubeka ungayihoyi indlela aziphatha ngayo.

SourceText: Often, your child's response will grow more agitated when you start ignoring a specific behaviour as your child tries to test your resolve.
text: Rhoqo, intsabelo yomntwana wakho iza kukhula ngakumbi  acaphuke xa uqalisa ukungamhoyi kwindlela ethile aziphatha ngayo ezama ukukulinga ukuba uza kuqina kangakanani.

SourceText: If you find yourself ignoring your child's behaviour a lot, it is either because you are not being consistent (sometimes ignoring and sometimes giving in) OR you are not spending enough positive time with your child. One-on-One Time is super important!
text: Ukuba uzifumanisa ungamhoyi kakhulu umntwana wakho, kusenokuba kungenxa yokuba uyatshintshatshintsha (ngamanye amaxesha ungamhoyi kwaye ngamanye amaxesha unikezele) OKANYE akuchithi xesha laneleyo elikhuthazayo kunye nomntwana wakho.  Ixesha Lenu Nobabini libalulekile!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to use ignore to reduce tantrums or other difficult behaviours:
text: Nceda ukhetha elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngakumbi ngokuphathelel indlela yokusebenzisa ukungahoyi ukunciphisa ukugqushalaza okanye ezinye iindlela zokuziphatha ezinzima:

SourceText: Ignore negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like whining or tantrums. Your @fields.child_nickname’s behaviour might at first get worse, but with time they will learn that it does not work. Be consistent and patient. And make sure that you are also giving @fields.child_nickname plenty of positive attention at other times. You can do it!
text: Sukukhoya ukufuna ingaqallo okungekuhlanga kunye nendlela yokuziphatha yokufuna ngetshova njengokukhalaza okanye ukugqushalaza. Ukuziphatha kuka @fields.child_nickname wakho kusenokuba kubi ngakumbi, kodwa njengokuba ixesha lihamba uza kuqonda ukuba oko akusebenzi. Musa ukutshintshatshintsha kwaye ube nomondle. Qinisekisa ukuba unika u @fields.child_nickname ngqalelo eninzi ekhuthazayo ngamanye amaxesha Ungakwenza oku!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ignore negative attention seeking and demanding behaviours like whining or tantrums. Your child’s behaviour might at first get worse, but with time they will learn that it does not work. Be consistent and patient. And make sure that you are also giving your child plenty of positive attention at other times. You can do it!
text: Sukukhoya ukufuna ingaqallo okungekuhlanga kunye nendlela yokuziphatha yokufuna ngetshova njengokukhalaza okanye ukugqushalaza. Ukuziphatha  komntwana wakho kusenokuba kubi ngakumbi, kodwa njengokuba ixesha lihamba uza kuqonda ukuba oko akusebenzi. Musa ukutshintshatshintsha kwaye ube nomondle. Qinisekisa ukuba unika unika umntwana wakho ingqalelo eninzi ekhuthazayo ngamanye amaxesha. Ungakwenza oku!

SourceText: 3. Ignore the behaviour not your child.
text: 3. Sukungahoyi indlela yokuziphatha hayi umntwana wakho.

SourceText: Ignoring behaviour means removing physical and verbal attention. You should still be aware of what @fields.child_nickname is doing.
text: Ukungahoyi indlela yokuziphatha kuthetha ukushenxisa ingqalelo yasemzimbeni nangomlomo. Usafanele wazi oko u @fields.child_nicknameakwenzayo.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ignoring behaviour means removing physical and verbal attention. You should still be aware of what your child is doing.
text: Ukungahoyi indlela yokuziphatha kuthetha ukushenxisa ingqalelo yasemzimbeni nangomlomo. Usafanele wazi oko umntwanawakho akwenzayo.

SourceText: For example, if @fields.child_nickname whines for sweets at the store, you might initially say “no” but then give in to @fields.child_nickname when they start to have a tantrum. This happens to all of us!
text: Ngkomzekelo, ukuba u @fields.child_nickname ukhalazela iilekese evenkileni, ekuqaleni usenokuthi “hayi” kodwa unikezele ku @fields.child_nicknamexa eqalisa ukugqushalaza. Kuyenzeka kuthi sonke!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: For example, if your child whines for sweets at the store, you might initially say “no” but then give in to your child when they start to have a tantrum. This happens to all of us!
text: Ngokomzekelo, ukuba umntwana wakho  ukhalazela iilekese evenkileni, ekuqaleni usenokuthi “hayi” kodwa unikezele kumntwana wakho xa eqalisa ukugqushalaza. Kuyenzeka kuthi sonke!

SourceText: Having a tantrum can be just as traumatic and difficult for your child as it is for you. Make sure you give @fields.child_nickname plenty of positive attention and love as soon as they have calmed down.
text: Ukugqushalaza kunokuba yingxaki enkulu kwaye kusenokuba nzima kumntwana wakho njengokuba kunjalo kuwe. Qiniseka ukua unikela ingqalelo eninzi entle ku @fields.child_nickname kunye nothando njengokuba esiya ehlisa umoya.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Having a tantrum can be just as traumatic and difficult for your child as it is for you. Make sure you give your child plenty of positive attention and love as soon as they have calmed down.
text: Ukugqushalaza kunokuba yingxaki enkulu kwaye kusenokuba nzima kumntwana wakho njengokuba kunjalo kuwe. Qiniseka ukua unikela ingqalelo eninzi entle kumntwana wakho kunye nothando njengokuba esiya ehlisa umoya.

SourceText: At this time, it is more important that you involve @fields.child_nickname in a positive activity instead of talking about what just happened. You can do that later like at night or the next day. Right now @fields.child_nickname needs love.

SourceText: Well done @fields.user_name! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. SourceText: Today's Parenting Tip is all about Praise. How did the above message make you feel? We all appreciate it when the good things we do are recognised by others, especially when it is someone who is close to us.
text: Iingcebiso Zobuzali Kwezi Ntsuku kuphathelele Ukuncoma. Lo myalezo ungasentla ukwenza uzive njani? Sonke siyakuxabia oku xa izinto ezintle esizenzayo zinconywa ngabanye, ingakumbi xa ingumntu osondeleyo  kuthi.

SourceText: Praise your children when they are behaving well! They may not show it but you’ll see them doing that good behaviour again…

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! I just wanted to thank you for making this commitment to improve the life of your children. It shows you really care!
text: Molo @fields.user_name! Bendifuna njeukukubulela ngokuzibophelela ekuphuculeni ubomi bomntwaa wakho. Kubonisa ukuba ukhathala ngokwenene!

SourceText: Hi! I just wanted to thank you for making this commitment to improve the life of your children. It shows you really care!
text: Molo! Bendifuna njeukukubulela ngokuzibophelela ekuphuculeni ubomi bomntwaa wakho. Kubonisa ukuba ukhathala ngokwenene!

SourceText: Keep it positive! Make sure your children get lots of praise when they are behaving well. This will make them want to behave that way more often.
text: Lindela okuhle! Qiniseka ukuba abantwana bakho bafumana ukunconywa xa beziphethe kakuhle. Oku kuya kubenza bafuna ukwenza ngolo hlobo rhoqo.

SourceText: We all appreciate it when the good things we do are recognised by others, especially when it is someone who is close to us.
text: Sonke siyakuxabia oku xa izinto ezintle esizenzayo zinconywa ngabanye, ingakumbi xa ingumntu osondeleyo  kuthi.

SourceText: Praise works for our children, too. When you bring more attention to positive behaviour, they are likely to do it more often. They also will feel good about themselves!
text: Ncoma imisebenzi yabantwana bethu, nawe. Xa unikela ingqalel o engakumbi kwindlela yokuziphatha, kunokwenzeka ukuba benze okungakumbi rhoqo. Kwakhona baya kuziva kakuhle ngeziqu zabo!

SourceText: Here are 3 simple steps to get it right:
text: Nanga amanyathelo ama-3 okulungisa oku:

SourceText: 1. Be positive
text: 1. :Yiba nethemba

SourceText: 2. Be specific
text: 2. Ngqala ngqo

SourceText: 3. Be enthusiastic
text: 3. Yiba nehlombe

SourceText: To learn more about one of these steps, type "1" to "3". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nenye yezi ngcebiso, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "3". Kwakhona unokuchwetheza u “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: Step 3. Be enthusiastic
text: Inyathelo 3. Yiba nehlombe

SourceText: Really mean it when you say it! The more real you are the better it will feel.
text: Nyaniseka xa uyitsho! Xa unyaniseka kokukhona uza kuziva kamnandi.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about praise:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuncoma:

SourceText: Here is a comic on praising your child.
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi yokunconywa komntwana wakho.

SourceText: Here is a comic on praising your teen.
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi yokunconywa  komntwana okwishumi elivisayo.

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for being quiet while I talked to my boss. I appreciate it! Here, you can use my phone to WhatsApp your friends”
text: Umzali: “Enkosi ngokuzola ngoxa bendithetha anomphathi wam. Ndiyixabise kakhulu! Apha, ungasebenzisa ifowuni yam ukuthumela i-WhatsApp  kubahlobo bakho”

SourceText: Teen: “Thanks! I really want to see how they are doing.”
text: Umntwana ofikisayo: "Enkosi! Ngokwenene ndifuna ukuba indlela abaqhuba ngayo.”

SourceText: Silence
text: Ukuthula

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for playing quietly while I was doing work. In 5 minutes I will be able to join you.”
text: Umzali: “Enkosi ngokudlala ngokuthe cwaka ngoxa bendisebenza. Kwmiizuzu emi-5 ndiza kubuya ndibe kunye nawe.”

SourceText: Parent: “I really appreciate you playing quietly together while I worked. Now I can play with you for a bit. What would you like to do?”
text: Umzali: “Ndiyixabisa ngokwenene ukuba udlale ngokuzolileyo ngoxa bendisebenza. Mna ndingadlala nawe ixeshana. Yintoni ongathanda ukuyenza ?”

SourceText: Praise @fields.child_nickname for something they have done well. They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.

SourceText: Praise your child or teenager for something they have done well. They may not show it, but you’ll see them doing that good thing again. It will also reassure them that you notice and care.
text: Ncoma umntwana wakho okanye ofikisayo ngento ayenze kakuhle.  Basenokungayibonisi kodwa uya kubabona bephinda beyenza loo nto ilungileyo. Kanti iya kubaqinisekisa ukuba uyaqaphela yaye uyakhathala.

text: Inyathelo 2. Ngqala ngqo

SourceText: Praise the behaviour. Use words to describe the behaviour that you are praising. Say, 'Well done for finishing all your chores, @fields.child_nickname,' instead of 'Good job.'

SourceText: Challenges are stressful. But problem-solving can really help. There are 6 basic steps for problem solving:
text: Imingeni yenza uxinezeleko. Kodwa ukusombulula ingxaki kunokunceda ngokwenene. Kukho amanyathelo ama-6 okusombulula ingxaki:

SourceText: 1. Identify the problem
text: 1. Fumanisa ingxaki

SourceText: 2. Think of possible solutions
text: 2. Cinga ngezisombululo ezinokwenzeka

SourceText: 3. Figure out what the results of each solution would be
text: 3. Khangela oko iziphumo zikuko ngesicombululo esinokuba siso

SourceText: 4. Choose one solution
text: 4. Khetha isicombululo esinye

SourceText: 5. Try it out!
text: 5. Yizame!

SourceText: 6. Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution
text: 6. Ngaba sisebenzile? Kulunge kakhulu! Ukuba asikhange sisebenze, khawuzame esinye isisombululo

SourceText: We can also teach our children the same steps.
text: Sikwanako ukufundisa abantwana bethu ngamanyathelo afanayo.

SourceText: When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame our children. But what they really need is someone to help them work through their problems.
text: Xa kusenzeka into embi, sidla ngokuba nomsindo size sibeke ityala kubantwana bethu. Kodwa into abayidinga ngokwenene ngumntu wokubanceda basebenza ingxaki zabo.

SourceText: Take a Pause! Become aware of anger and stress. Take a deep breath or count to 10 before you react. Then respond in a calmer way.
text: Nqumama! Yiba nolwazi ngokucaphuka noxinezelelo. Phefumla ngokunzulu okanye ubale ukuya kwi-10 ngaphambi kokuba wenze. Emva koko sabela ngendlela ezolileyo.

SourceText: Help @fields.child_nickname learn how to solve problems. As children get older, they become more independent and sometimes push the boundaries that we create to keep them safe.
text: Nceda u @fields.child_nickname afunde indlela yokusombulula iingxaki. Njengabantwana abadadlana, baye bazimela ngakumbi kwaye namanye amaxesha batyhala imida esiyidalayo ukubagcina bekhuelekile.
