SourceText: Hello! All children misbehave sometimes. It is normal when they are tired, scared, hungry, or learning independence. Today's tips are all about what to do when our children misbehave…
text: Molo! Bonke abantwana baziphatha kakubi ngamanye amaxesha. Kuqhelekile ukuba xa bediniwe, besoyika, belambile, okanye befunda ukuzimela. Iingcebiso zanamhlanje zonke ziphathelele abantwna bethu indlela baziphethe kakubi ngayo...

SourceText: Try to redirect. Stop it before it starts! When your children get restless, you can distract them with something interesting or fun: "Come, let's play a game together!"
text: Zama ukutshintsha ingqalelo. Yiyekise  ngaphambi kokuba iqale! Xa umntwana wakhe engazoli, ungamphazamisa ngento enika umdla okanye emnandi: “Yiza, masidlale umdlalo kunye!”

SourceText: If your baby is starting to crawl or walk, you can also redirect them by physically picking them up and focusing their attention on something else interesting. Use a lively and cheerful voice!
text: Ukuba umntwana wakho uqalisa ukukhasa okanye ukuhamba, ukwananko nokubajikisa ngokuthi ubafunqule uze ujolise ingqalelo yabo kwenye into enika umdla. Sebenzisa ilizwi  elinodlamko nelinochulumanco!

SourceText: Here is a comic that shows how you can use redirect!
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi ebonisa indlela yokusebenzisa ukujikisa!

SourceText: Child: “Give it to me!”
text: Umntwana: “Yisapha kum!”

SourceText: Teen: “I had it first!”
text: Umntwana ofikisayo: “Ibikum kuqala!”

SourceText: Parent: “Cameron and Billy, come and help me prepare dinner. We are making your favourite dish!”
text: Umzali: “Cameron noBilly, yizani nizokundinceda ndilungiselele isidlo sangokuhlwa. Senza ukutya kwakho   okuthandayo”

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for helping me get these veggies clean for our dinner tonight!”
text: Umzali: “Enkosi ngokinceda ndicoce le mifuno ukwenzela isidlo sethu sangokuhlwa!”

SourceText: Keep it positive. It is normal to want to say something about @fields.child_nickname's negative behaviour, like “Don’t whine,” or “Stop running in the house.” Instead, just say something that you want @fields.child_nickname to do, like "Speak with a calm voice," or "Remember to walk inside the house."

SourceText: We are now spending a lot more time online. Being connected helps us stay positive…but it also presents risks and dangers.
text: Kungokunje sichitha ixesha elininzi kakhulu kwi-intanethi Ukuqhagamshelana kunceda thina sihlale sinethemba...kodwa kwakhona kunceda ukuveza imingcipheko neengozi.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you keep yourself safe online.

SourceText: Here are 5 tips that can help you keep yourself safe online:
text: Nanga amacebiso ama-5 anokunceda wena ukuba uhlale ukhuselekilekwi-intanethi:

SourceText: 1. Learn about the risks and dangers
text: 1. Funda ngemingcipheko kunye neengozi

SourceText: 2. Quick tech fixes
text: 2. Ukulungisa okukhawulezayo kobuchwephesha

SourceText: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits
text: 3. Yila imikhwa enempilo nekhuselekileyo yeintanethi

SourceText: 4. Maintain privacy
text: 4. Gcina ikhusi

SourceText: 5. Report and seek help
text: 5. Xela uze ufune uncedo

SourceText: To learn more about one of these, type "1" to "5". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukuze ufunde ngakumbi ngezi, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "5". Kwakhona unokuchwetheza u “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: 1. Learn about risks and dangers
text: 1. Funda ngemingcipheko kunye neengozi

SourceText: Keep personal information private, especially from strangers. – some people are not who they say they are!
text: Gcina inkcazelo yakho siqu iyimfihlo, ingakumbi kubantu ongabaziyo. - abanye abantu abayiyo le nto bayiyo!

SourceText: 2. Quick tech fixes:
text: 2. Ukulungisa okukhawulezayo kobuchwephesha:

SourceText: 3. Create healthy and safe online habits:
text: 3. Yila imikhwa enempilo nekhuselekileyo yeintanethi:

SourceText: You can also create healthy and safe online habits like creating device-free spaces and times in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping).
text: Ukwanako ukuyila imikhwa esempilweni nekhuselekileyo kwi-intanethi njengokuyila ispeyisi namaxesha ekungasetyenziswa sixhobo ngalo kwindlu yakho (xa kutyiwa, kudliwa, kusenziwa umsebenzi wesikolo, kunye nokulala).

SourceText: Remember that what goes online stays online (messages, photos, and videos).
text: Khumbula ukuba okwenzeka kwi-intanethi kuhlala kwi-intanethi (imiyalezo, iifoto, kunye neevidiyo)

SourceText: Here's a video to take you through the shared book reading activity!

SourceText: Here's an audio message that takes you through the shared book reading activity!
text: Nanku umyalezo wamazwi okufaka  kumsebenzi wokwabelana ngencwadi!

SourceText: Here are some tips for sharing books with your child:
text: Nanga amanye amacebiso okwabelana ngencwadi nomntwanawakho:

SourceText: 1. Follow your child's interest
text: 1. Landela izinto anomdla kuzo umntwana wakho

SourceText: 2. Use a lifely voice
text: 2. Sebenzisa ilizwi elidlamkileyo

SourceText: 3. Pointing and naming
text: 3. Ukukhomba nokubiza ngegama

SourceText: 4. Be positive and supportive
text: 4. Yiba nethemba uze uxhase

SourceText: 5. Making actions and links
text: 5. Ukwenza imisebenzi neelinki

SourceText: 6. Talking about feelings
text: 6.  Ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo

SourceText: 7. Babies and books go well together
text: 7. Iintsana neencwadi zihamba kunye

SourceText: 2. Use a lively voice
text: 2. Sebenzisa ilizwi eliphilayo

SourceText: Speak with a lively or animated voice. This will help to keep the child’s attention on the book.
text: thetha ngelizwi eliphilayo okanye eliqavileyo. Oku kuyakunceda ukugcina ingqalelo yomntwana kwincwadi.

SourceText: 7. Babies and Books!
text: 7. Iintsana neeNcwadi!

SourceText: Even very young babies enjoy book-sharing and looking at the pictures together with a parent or caregiver. In fact, regular book-sharing helps their development and learning. And it is okay for them to put the book in their mouth - they are exploring!
text: Kwaneentsana ezincinane kakhulu ziyakunandipha ukwabelana ngencwadi nokujonga imifanekiso kunye nomzali okanye umgcini. Enyanisweni, ukwabelana ngeencwadi kunceda ekukhuleni kwabo nokufunda. Kwaye kulungile ukuba babeke incwadi emilonyeni yabo - bazama ukufunda izinto ezintsha!

SourceText: Here are some examples!
text: Nantsi eminye imizekelo!

SourceText: “Look, she is smiling. Why do you think she is smiling? What made you smile today?”
text: “Jonga, uncumile. Kutheni ucinga ukuba uncumile? Yintoni ekwenze wancuma namhlanje?”

SourceText: “The monkey is sad because he is all on his own. Can you remember when you were last sad?”
text: “Inkawu ikhathazekile kuba iyodwa jwi. Ingaba usakhumbula ukuba bekunini apho ububuhlungu?”

SourceText: “That tiger looks angry. Why do you think he is angry? Do you remember when I got angry this morning?”
text: “Laa ngwe ibonakala icaphukile. Ucinga ukuba kutheni icaphukile? Uyakhumbula ngokuya bendicaphukile ngala ntsasa”

You can use what is happening in the book to talk about @fields.child_nickname’s own feelings, and why other people might feel a certain way.

SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money with our children is important. Our children can also help us to spend and save in ways that will benefit the family.
text: Izigidi zeentsapho ziyasokola ukuziphilisa. Xa imali ingasekho, oku kungasenza sibe nexahal, sibe nonxinzelelo, size sibe buhlungu. SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money is important. We can also learn about how we can save in ways that will benefit the family.
text: Izigidi zeentsapho ziyasokola ukuziphilisa. Xa imali ingasekho, oku kungasenza sibe nexahal, sibe nonxinzelelo, size sibe buhlungu. Indlela esiqonda nesithetha ngayo ngemali nabantwana bethu ibalulekile. Kwakhona sinokufunda ngokuphathelele indlela esinokulondoloza ngayo ngeendlela eziza kuzuzisa intsapho.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you make a budget and save money together as a family.
text: Nantsi ividiyo yokukunceda wenze ibhajethi uze ulondoloze imali kunye njengentsapho.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you make a budget and save money together as a family.
text: Nanku umyalezo wamazwi wokukunceda wenze ibhajethi uze ulondoloze imali kunye njengentsapho.

SourceText: Making a budget.
text: Ukwenza ibhajethi

SourceText: A budget is how we decide what we will spend our money on, even in stressful times. Making a budget can help you have enough at the end of the month so that you need to borrow less.
text: Ibhajethi yindlela esigqiba ngayo ukuba imali yethu siza kuyichitha kweyiphi into, kwanangamaxesha obunzima. Ukwanza ibajethi kunokukunceda ube nezinto ezaneleyo ekupheleni kwenyanga ukwenzela ukuba uboleke kancinane.

SourceText: Do you want 4 quick steps to help you make a budget and save money?
text: Ingaba ufuna manyathelo ama-4 akhawuleziyo okukunceda wenze ibhajethi uze ulondoloze imali?

SourceText: Step 1: What do we spend on now?
text: Inyathelo 1: Imali siyichitha entwenini ngoku?

SourceText: • Get a piece of paper (or old newspaper or a cardboard box) and a pen.
text: • Fumana intwana yephepha (okanye iphephandaba elidala okanye ibhokisi yekhadbhodi) nepeni.

SourceText: • Draw pictures of all the things that you and your family spend money on each month.
text: •  Zoba imifanekiso yazo zonke izinto wena nentsapho yakho enichitha imali kuzo nyanga nganye.

SourceText: • Write next to each picture how much each thing costs.
text: •  Bhala ecaleni komfanekiso ngamnye ukuthi nto nganye iyimalini nyanga nganye.

SourceText: • Add up how much money you have to spend each month.
text: •  Dibanisa ukuba yimalini oye wayichitha nyanga nganye.

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 2?
text: Ingaba ufuna ukufumana iNyathelo 2?

SourceText: Step 2: Talk about needs and wants
text: Inyathelo 2: Thethani kunye ngezidingo neemfuno

SourceText: • Needs: Which things are important or must haves for your family to survive? (like food, soap to wash hands, needs for ill or disabled family members).
text: • Izidingo: Ziziphi izinto ezibalulekileyo okanye emele ibe nazo intsapho ukuze iphumelele? (njengokutya, isepha yokuhlamba izandla, iintswelo zabagulayo,okanye amalungu akhubazekileyo).

SourceText: • Wants: Which things are nice to have but not essential?
text: • Iimfuno: Zeziphi izinto ekungamnandi ukuba kodwa ezingabalulekanga?

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 3?
text: Ingaba ufuna ukufumana iNyathelo 3?

SourceText: Step 3: Build your own budget
text: Inyathelo 3: Yakha eyakho ibhajethi

SourceText: • Find a bag of stones or anything with lots of bits. This is your money for the month.
text: • Khangela ibhegi enamatye okanye nantoni enamaqhekeza amaninzi. Le yimali yakho yenyanga.

SourceText: • As a family, decide what you will spend on what, and put the stones on your picture.
text: • Gqibani ukuba niza kuthenga ntoni ngemali, uze ubeke amatye/ izinto kuloo mfanekiso.

SourceText: • If you can save even a tiny amount for the future, or for an emergency  – it can make a big difference over time.
text: • Ukuba unokonga neyona mali incinci ukwenzela ikamva okanye imeko yongxamiseko - ingenza umahluko omkhulu ngokuhamba kwexesha.

SourceText: Do you want to receive Step 4?
text: Ingaba ufuna ukufumana iNyathelo 4?

SourceText: Step 4: Find out where you can get extra help
text: Inyathelo 4: Khangela apho unokufumana khona uncedo olungakumbi

SourceText: Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need. Ask about whether places in your community are giving support.
text: Urhulumente okanye iqela labahlali lisenokuba liphisa ngemali iivawutsha, okanye iipasile zokutya kwiintsapho ezisweleyo. Buzisa  ngeendawo  ekuhlaleni ezinikezela inkxaso.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try following these steps to create a family budget. You can even involve your partner in the discussion. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Usebenzile ngokongeza esinye isakhono kwikiti yakho yeziXhobo zokuba  nguMzali! Kwiintsuku ezimbalwa ezilandelayo, zama ukulandela la manyathelo ukuyila ibhajethi yosapho. Unako nokubandakanya iqabane kulengxubusho. Izigidi zeentsapho zifumanisaa indlelazokufunda zokulawula imal njengokuba intsah=pho inciphisa ukuxambulisana ize yonke imanyane. Yimpumelelo yokwenene leyo!

SourceText: Millions of families are struggling to make ends meet especially due to the COVID-19 pandemic. When money is tight, this can make us feel anxious, stressed, and sad. How we understand and talk about money with our children is important. Our children can also help us to spend and save in ways that will benefit the family.
text: Izigidi zeentsapho ziyasokola ukuziphillisa ingakumbi ngenxa yobhubhani we-COVID-19. Xa imali ingasekho, oku kungasenza sibe nexahal, sibe nonxinzelelo, size sibe buhlungu. Indlela esiqonda nesithetha ngayo ngemali nabantwana bethu ibalulekile. Abantwana bethu banokusoloko besinceda ukuba sichithe size silondoloze ngeendlela eziza kuzuzisa intsapho.

SourceText: Making a budget with your children and teens.
text: Ukwenza ibhajethi nabatwana bakho nabafikisayo.

SourceText: A budget is how we decide what we will spend our money on, even in stressful times. Making a budget together helps children understand that we all need to make hard decisions in difficult times. It can also help you have enough at the end of the month so that you need to borrow less.
text: Ibhajethi yindlela esigqiba ngayo ukuba imali yethu siza kuyichitha kweyiphi into, kwanangamaxesha obunzima. Ukwenza ibhajethi kunye nabantwana kunceda baqonde ukuba sonke sidinga ukwenza izigqibo ezinzima kumaxesha obunzima. Ikwanokukunceda ube nezinto ezaneleyo ekupheleni kwenyanga ukwenzela ukuba uboleke kancinane.

SourceText: Do you want 4 quick steps to help you make a budget and save money with your children?
text: Ingaba ufuna manyathelo ama-4 akhawuleziyo okukunceda wenze ibhajethi uze ulondoloze imal nabantwana bakhoi?

SourceText: • Discuss with your children what things you could try to spend less on as a family.
text: • Xubusha nabantwana bakho ngezinto ongazama ukuchitha imali encinane kuzo njengentsapho.

SourceText: Well done for adding another skill to your Parenting Toolkit! Over the next few days, try following these steps by involving your child in creating a family budget. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Usebenzile ngokongeza esinye isakhono kwikiti yakho yeziXhobo zokuba  nguMzali! Kwiintsuku ezimbalwa ezilandelayo, zama ukulandela la manyathelo ukuyila ibhajethi yosapho! Izigidi zeentsapho zifumanisaa indlelazokufunda zokulawula imal njengokuba intsah=pho inciphisa ukuxambulisana ize yonke imanyane. Yimpumelelo yokwenene leyo!

SourceText: Well done for adding another layer to your House of Support! Over the next few days, try following these steps by involving your child in creating a family budget. Millions of families find that learning ways to manage money as a family reduces family arguments and brings everyone together. That's real success!
text: Usebenzile ngokongeza  omnye umaleko  kwiNdlu yakho yeNkxaso! Kwiintsuku ezimbalwa ezilandelayo, zama ukulandela la manyathelo ukuyila ibhajethi yosapho! Izigidi zeentsapho zifumanisaa indlelazokufunda zokulawula imal njengokuba intsah=pho inciphisa ukuxambulisana ize yonke imanyane. Yimpumelelo yokwenene leyo!

SourceText: Create routines! Your children will feel more secure and safe when they know what is expected of them and how each day will go. Make a plan with them with time for play, meals, chores, school, and sleep.
text: Yakha imizila yokwenza izinto! Abantwana bakho baza kuziva bekhuselek ngakumbi kwaye bengekho sengozini xa besazi ukuba kulindelek ntoni kubo kwaye luza kuhamba njani suku galunye. Ceba kunye nabo ixesha lokudlala, izidlo, imisetyenzana,  isikolo, nokulala.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you create daily routines with your children.
text: Nantsi ividiyo eza kukunceda uyile umzila wamihla le nabantwana bakho.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you create daily routines with your children.
text: Nanku umyalezo wamazwi wokukunceda uyile umzila wamihla le nabantwana bakho.

SourceText: Daily routines, such as time for schoolwork, play, meals, and sleep, can help our children feel safe and secure. They also give our children a sense of security.
text: Imizila yamihla le, efana nexesha lomsebenzi wesikolo, ukudlala, izidlo, nokulala, kunganceda abantwana bethu baze bekhuselekile kwaye benqabisekile. Ikwanika  nabantwana imvo yonqabiseko.

SourceText: Here are 4 simple tips that you can use when establishing routines with your children:
text: Nnga amacebo ama-4 onokuwasebenzisa xa uzinzisa umzila nabantwana bakho:

SourceText: 1. Give one instruction at a time
text: 1. Nikela umyalelo omnye ngexesha

SourceText: 2. Use transition warnings to help move from one activity to the next one
text: 2. Sebenzisa izilumkiso eziguquakayo ukunceda ukusuka komnye umsetyenzana ukuyakolandelayo

SourceText: 3. Create regular eating and sleeping times
text: 3. Yila amaxesha asisigxina okutya nokulala

SourceText: 4. Involve your teen in creating daily routines
text: 4. Quka umnteana ofikisayo ekuyileni imizila yamihlangemihla

SourceText: To learn more about one of these tips, type "1" to 4". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nenye yezi ngcebiso, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "4". Kwakhona unokuchwetheza u “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: 1. Help your younger children learn routines by taking them through the activity step by step. Give one instruction at a time. Praise them each time they follow!
text: 1. Nceda abantwana abaselula bafunde imizila ngokubafaka kulemmisetyenzana inyathel ngalinye. Nikela umyalelo omnye ngexesha Bancome sihlandlonngalisnye belandela!

SourceText: 2. Transition warnings can also be very helpful. They give your child some time to prepare for the next activity: "In 5 minutes it will be time to pack up the toys before bedtime…"
text: 2. Izilumkiso zotshintsho nazo zingaba luncedo kakhulu. Zinika umntwana wakho  ixesha lokulungiselela umsebenzi olandelayo: “Kwimizuzu emi-5 iza kuba lixesha lokuphakisa iithoyi zakho ngaphambi kokuya kulala...”

SourceText: 3. Regular eating and sleeping times are especially important for babies. Not enough sleep can make your child cranky, irritable, and short tempered.
text: 3. Amaxesha asisigxina okutya nokulala abaluleke  ngokukhethekileyo kwiintsana. Ukungalali ngokwaneleyo kunokwenza umntwana abe nkenenkene, abe nochuku aze acaphuke msinya.

SourceText: Here are some tips for how to help your child prepare for bedtime:
text: Nanga amacebiso endlela yokunceda umntwana wakho alungiselele ukuya kulala:

SourceText: • Try to have regular bedtimes each day as much as possible.
text: • Zama ukuba nexesha elisisigxina lokuya kulala ngosuku ngalunye kangangoko kunokwenzeka.

SourceText: • Try to make it quiet and the lights in the room dim.
text: • Zama ukuba kuzole nezibane egumbini zingakhanyisi kakhulu.

SourceText: • Spend some time with your child. You can sing a lullaby or tell a calm story.
text: • Chitha ixesha nabantwana bakho. Ungamculela ingoma yokumlalisa okanye ubalise ibali elizolileyo.

SourceText: • Give your child a hug and kiss goodnight before leaving the room.
text: • Nika umntwana wakho ihagi uze umphuze ngaphambi kokushiya igumbi lakhe.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about creating daily routines:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuncoma:

SourceText: 4, Involve your teen in creating daily routines
text: 4. Quka umntwana wakho ofikisayo  ekuyileni imizila yamihlale

SourceText: Here are some suggestions for routines that you could establish with your children:
text: Nanga amanye amacebiso emizila onokuyimisela kunye nabantwana bakho:

SourceText: Bedtime
text: Ixesha lokulala

SourceText: Schoolwork and Online Classes
text: Umsebenzi wesikolo kunye neeKlasi zeIntanethi

SourceText: Chores
text: Imisetyenzana yasekhaya

SourceText: Mealtime
text: Ixesha lokudla

SourceText: Play/free time
text: Ixesha okudlala/elivulekileyo

SourceText: T.V. or gadget time
text: Ixesha le-T.V. okanye igajethi

SourceText: Storytime
text: Ixesha lebali

SourceText: One-on-One Time
text: Ixesha Lenu Nobabini

SourceText: You can add more, too! Here is a comic on creating a daily routine with your child.
text: Ungongeza esinye isigxbo, kwakhoan! Nantsi ikhomikhi yokuyila umzila wemihla ngemihla nomntwana akho.

SourceText: Parent: “Now let’s look at the multiplication tables…”
text: Umzali: “Ngoku masijonge izibalo sokuphinda phinda...”

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for helping me make lunch, Junior”
text: Umzali: “Enkosi ngokudinceda ndenze isidlo sasemini, Junior”

SourceText: Child: “My favourite!”
text: Umntwana: “Endisithandayo!”

SourceText: Parent “And they all lived happily ever after…Goodnight, my love.”
text: Umzali “Emva koko bahlala kamnandi...Ulale kakuhe, sthandwa sam.”

SourceText: Parent: "Thank you for being so supportive with the kids today.”
text: Umzali: “Enkosi ngokusixhasa nabantwana namhlanje.”

SourceText: 4. Involve @fields.child_nickname in creating daily plans. Set goals and rewards together. Let them plan when they do schoolwork and when they can relax!
text: 4. Mquke u @fields.child_nickname ekuyileni iiplani osuku ngalunye. Bekani imigomo nemivuzo kunye. Mabacebe xa besenza umsebenzi wesikolo kunye naxa beziphumlele!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: 4. Involve your teen in creating daily plans. Set goals and rewards together. Let them plan when they do schoolwork and when they can relax!
text: 4. 4. Quka umntwana wakho ofikisayo  kwiiplani zamihlale. Bekani imigomo nemivuzo kunye. Mabacebe xa besenza umsebenzi wesikolo kunye naxa beziphumlele!

SourceText: Well done @fields.user_name! You have added another skill to your Parenting Toolkit. Over the next few days, try creating at least 1 regular daily routine like having a meal together or sharing a story before bedtime. It will help your child feel secure and loved!

SourceText: Being specific is not rude or insensitive, it really helps others understand you clearly and prevents confusion in the family. Emotions like anger and stress are part of our lives. All we need to do when we feel angry and stressed is know how to handle it by taking a few deep breaths before responding.
text: Ukuthetha phandle ayikokuba krwada okanye ukungazicingeli iimvakalelo zabanye abantukubanceda kakhulu abanye abantu ukuba bakuqonde kakuhle kwaye loo nto ithintela ukudideka entsatsheni. Iimvakalelo ezifana nomsindo kunye noxinezeleko ziyinxalenye yobomi bethu. Eyona nto kufuneka siyenzile xa sinomsindo okanye siziva sixinezelelekile kukulawula iimvakalelo zethu ngokutsala umoya izihlandlo ezimbalwa ngaphambi kokuba sisabele.

SourceText: It’s okay to not want to share at that time. Find some time later on when you feel calmer to explain so that everyone can understand.
text: Kulungile ukuba awufuni kuthetha ngelo xesha. Fumana ixesha lokucacisa xa uziva uzolile ukuze wonke umntu akuqonde.

SourceText: Sharing emotions is about explaining how you are feeling so @fields.child_nickname is aware and learns to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It’s up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later: “I am feeling angry/stressed now, can you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight”.
text: Uwabelana ngeemvakalelo kuphathelele indlela oziva ngayo ukuze u @fields.child_nickname azi aze afunde ukwenza okufanayo. Unokukhetha ukuba uza kumxelela iinkcukacha ezingakanani ngaloo meko. Kuxhomekeke kuwe! Ukwanako nokukhetha ukuhendula imibuzo kamva: “Ndinomsindo ngoku/ndinestresi, ndicela uke undipheixesha? Singathetha ngale nto ngale ngokuhlwa”.

SourceText: Sharing emotions is about explaining how you are feeling so your child or teen  is aware and learns to do the same. You can choose how much detail you want to share about the situation. It’s up to you! You can also choose to answer questions later: “I am feeling angry/stressed now, can you please give me some time? We can talk about this more tonight”.

SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it, and keep giving the good example by noticing and sharing emotions. Over time, @fields.child_nickname will learn to do the same – and they will feel even more loved and cared for.

Ekuhambeni kwexesha, u @fields.child_nickname naye uza kwenza into efanayo kwaye uza kuziva ethandwa ibe ekhathalelwe kakhulu.

SourceText: Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. Give yourselves some time to get used to it, and keep giving the good example by noticing and sharing emotions. Over time, your child or teen  will learn to do the same – and they will feel even more loved and cared for.
text: Ukuqala into entsha akusoloko kulula ekuqaleni. Zinikeni ixesha lokuqhelana, nize niqhubeke ngokuba ngumzekelo omhle ngokunikela ingqalelo kwaye nithethe ngeemvakalelo zenu. Ekuhambeni kwexesha, umntwana wakho ofikisayo naye uza kwenza into efanayo - kwaye uza kuziva ethandwa ibe ekhathalelwe kakhulu.

SourceText: 1. Treat each other as equals
text: 1. Phathanani njengabalinganayo

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a husband or a father should act. But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Usapho nabahlobo bangakuxelela ukuba indoda okanye utata ufanele azenze njani izinto. Koda amadoda namabinqa ayazuza xa ethetha aze enze izigqibo kunye! Ngokomzekelo, kwixa elizayo xa usenza isigqibo, zama ukuquka iqabane lakho uze ubuze ukuba licinga ntoni.

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a wife or a mother should act compared to a husband or father.  But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Usapho nabahlobo bangakuxelela ukuba umfazi okanye umama ufanele azenze njani izinto.  Koda amadoda namabinqa ayazuza xa ethetha aze enze izigqibo kunye! Ngokomzekelo, kwixa elizayo xa usenza isigqibo, zama ukuquka iqabane lakho uze ubuze ukuba licinga ntoni.

SourceText: Family and friends might tell you how a partner or a parent should act. But both men and women benefit when they talk to each other and make decisions together! For example, next time you’re making a decision, try involving your partner and ask what they think.
text: Usapho nabahlobo bangakuxelela ukuba iqabane okanye umzali ufanele azenze njani izinto. Koda amadoda namabinqa ayazuza xa ethetha aze enze izigqibo kunye! Ngokomzekelo, kwixa elizayo xa usenza isigqibo, zama ukuquka iqabane lakho uze ubuze ukuba licinga ntoni.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about treating each other as equals?
text: Ingaba ungathanda ukubona ikhomkhi ngokuphanthana njengabalinganayo?

SourceText: Parent 1: “My dear, you look worried. What’s wrong?”
text: Umzali 1: “Sthanda sam, ubonakala ukhahhtazekile. “Yintoni erongo?

SourceText: Parent 2: “The stove has not been working very well recently. I think the stove might be broken.”
text: Umzali 2: “Istovu besingasebenzi kakuhle mvanje. Ndicinga ukuba istovu sonakele.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I noticed this too when I was cooking last week. I wanted to ask you: do you think we should buy a new one?”
text: Umzali 1: “Ndiyibonile nam loonto  xa bendipheka kwiveki ephelileyo. Bendifuna ukubuza: ucinga ukuba sifanele sithenge esitsha?”

SourceText: Parent 2: “Buying a new one would be really expensive. How about we talk about it after dinner, and we can make a decision together?
text: Umzali 2: “Ukuthenga esitsha kuya kudura kakhulu. Kutheni singathethi ngayo emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa, kwaye singeza isigqibo ngelo xesha kunye?

SourceText: Parent 1: “That sounds great. Thank you for cooking dinner, my dear!”
text: Umzali 1: “Kuvakala kukuhle oko. Enkosi ngokupheka isidlosangokuhlwa, sthandwa!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am grateful we can talk about this and make this decision together. It makes a lot more sense to try to get it repaired first.”
text: Umzali 1: “Ndiyavuyakuba sinokuthetha ngoku size senze isigqibo. Kusengqiqweni ukuba siqalsisilungisise.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “Me too. I feel a lot better now that we have talked about it together.”
text: Umzali 2: “Nam ndikwelo.  Ndiziva hbetele kakhulu ngoku kuba siye sathetha kunye.”

SourceText: When mothers and fathers are both engaged with the parenting of their children, everyone benefits, including the children! Show your partner that you appreciate it when they spend quality time with your children.
text: Xa oomama nootata bethetha ngokuphathelele ukubangabazali kubantwana babo, wonke umntu uyazuza, kuquka nabantwana! Bonisa iqabane lakho ukuba uyalixabisa xa lichitha ixesha elibalulekileyo nabantwana bakho.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about becoming a confident parent and a supportive partner?
text: Ingaba ungathanda ukubona ikhomikhi ngokuba ngumzali ozithembileyo neqabane elinenkxaso?

SourceText: Parent 1: “Good job, Jessie! You are reading very well!”
text: Umzali 1: “Mhle loo msebenzi, Jessie! Ufunda kakuhle!”

SourceText: Parent 2: “The weather today is so nice. It is a shame I have not had time to go outside for a walk.”
text: Umzali 2: “Intle imozulu namhlanje.  Lilishwa into yokuba ndingakwazanga ukuphuma ndiye kuhambangaphabndle.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “If you would like to get some fresh air and exercise, my dear, I can continue helping the children with their homework while you go for your afternoon walk.”
text: Umzali 1: “Ukuba ungathanda ukubethwa ngumoya uze uzilolonge, sthandwa, ndingaqhubeka ndinceda abantwana ngomsebenzi wesikolo ngoxa wena uphumile emva kwemini uye kuhamb.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “That would be wonderful, my love! Thank you for being so supportive.”
text: Umzali 2: “Ingantle kakhulu loo nto, sthandwa sam! Enkosi ngokusixhasa .”

SourceText: Parent 1: “Of course! It is fun to help the children with their reading practice! They are doing so well.”
text: Umzali 1: “Nam ngokunjalo! Kumnandi ukunceda abantwana ngokuqhelisela ukufunda! Baqhuba kakuhle kakhulu.”

SourceText: Sharing family responsibilities with your partner can make life less stressful! Can you think of ways you can share the workload? Doing tasks together can also make them more fun!
text: Ukubambisana kwiimmbopheleleko zentsapho neqabane lakho kungenza ubomi bunga xinezeli kakhulu! Ungacinga ngeendlela zokwabelana ngomsebenzi? Ukwenza umsebenzi kunye kunokuwenza ube mnandi ngakumbi!

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about sharing family responsibilities?
text: Ingab ungathanda ukubona ikhomikhi ngokubambisana kumsebenzi wosapho?

SourceText: Child: “Wow, there are so many clothes in here!”
text: Umntwana: “Yho, zaninzi ezi mpahla!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “You’re right, Kyle, there is quite a lot to do.”
text: Umzali 1: “Unyanisile, Kyle, ininzi into efuna ukwenziwa.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “If we do it together it will take less time!”
text: Umzali 1: “Ukuba siyenza kunye iza kuthatha ixeshana!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “Doing tasks together is also fun”
text: Umzali 1: “Ukwenza umsebenzi kunye kukwayinto emnandi”

SourceText: Parent 2: “Thank you, my love. Sharing the workload makes it less stressful.”
text: Umzali 2: “Enkosi, sthandwa sam. Ukwabelana ngomsebenzi kwenza ungabi nonxinzelelo kakhulu.”

SourceText: All adults have disagreements sometimes. But solving issues through fighting is not effective. Instead, if you start feeling angry, walk away for a bit or take a deep breath before responding in a calmer way.
text: Bonke abantu abadala baye bangavisisani maxa wambi. Kodwa ukulungisa izinto ngokulwa akuphumeleli. Kunoko, endaweni yokuziva ucaphukile hamba kancinane  okanye uphefumle  nzulu ngaphambi kokuba uphendule ngendlela ezolileyo.

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about resolving conflict peacefully?
text: Ingaba ungathanda ukubona ikhomikhi ngokusombulula umlo ngoxolo?

SourceText: Parent 1: “Dinner is ready!”
text: Umzali 1: “Isidlo sangokuhlwa silungile!”

SourceText: Child: “Look, it is raining so much outside!”
text: Umntwana: “Jonga, kuyanetha kakhulu phandle!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am glad you brought in the laundry earlier, my dear. Otherwise, it would have been soaked by now!”
text: Umzali 1: “Ndiyavuya ukuba uye wayothula impahla kwangethuba, sthandwa. Kungenjalo, ngeyimanzi tixi ngoku!”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I thought you said you would bring in the laundry today?”
text: Umzali 1: “Bendicinga ukuba ubuthe uza ngenisa impahla namhlanje?”

SourceText: Parent 1: “No, I was busy cooking dinner! You told me you would take care of it! How could you forget? Now all the laundry is wet!”
text: Umzali 1: “Hayi, bendixakekile ndipheka isidlo sangokuhlwa! Ubuthe uza kuyihoya! Kutheni uyilibele nje? Jonga ngoku zonke ezi mpahla zimanzi!”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I’m really sorry. It was a mistake!”
text: Umzali 2: “Ndiyaxolisa. Ibe yimpazamo!”

SourceText: Parent 1(thinking): I can’t believe he forgot! But everyone can make mistakes. Take a deep breath…
text: Umzali 1(uyacinga): Andikholelwa ukuba ulibele! Kodwa wonke umntu uyazenza iimpazamo. Tsala umoya kakhulu...

SourceText: Parent 1: “I’m sorry if I sounded upset. I just got stressed because I have had a long day.”
text: Umzali 1: “Ndiceluxolo ukuba ndiye ndavakala ndicaphukile. Ndiye ndanestresi kuba bekunzima emini namhlanje.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I am sorry that I forgot the laundry. I know you have had a long day. I will make sure to take care of it after dinner.”
text: Umzali 2: “Uxolo ngokulibala ukungenisa impahla. Ndiyazi bekunzima emini. Ndiza kuqiniseka ukuba ndiyakwenza oko emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa.”

SourceText: Listening and talking to those around us is key to a more peaceful home. Talking to your partner about issues before they become problems can help avoid arguments from building up.
text: Ukuphulaphula nokuthetha nabo sihlala nabo ngundoqo kwikhaya elinoxolo. Ukuthetha neqabane lakho ngeengxaki ngapambi kokuba zibenkulu k unganceda ukuphepha ukuxabana.

SourceText: Parent 1: “Are you okay, my love? You look tired.”
text: Umzali 1: “Akhonto, sthandwa sam? Ubonakala udiniwe.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I didn’t sleep well last night and so I am feeling quite tired.”
text: Umzali 2: “Andikhange ndilale kakuhle phezolo kwaye yiloonto ndidiwe kangaka.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I am sorry to hear that, Amir. Is there anything I can do to help?”
text: Umzali 1: "Ndibuhlungu ukuva oko, Amir. Ingaba ikhona inton endingayenza ukunceda?”

SourceText: Parent 2: “I might try and get an earlier rest this evening.”
text: Umzali 2: “Ndisengazama ndize ndiye kuphumla kwangethuba ngale ngokuhlwa.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “I can take over the children’s bedtime routine after dinner tonight, so that you can get some extra rest.”
text: Umzali 1: “Ndingabenzela abantwana izinto abazidingayo ngaphambi kokuba balale emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa, ukuze ukwazi ukuphumla noko.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “That would be lovely. Thank you so much, my dear.”
text: Umzali 2: Ndingavuya kakhulu. Enkosi kakhulu, sthandwa.”

SourceText: Would you like to see a comic about listening and talking to each other?
text: Ingaba ungathanda ukubona ikhomikhi malunga nokuphulaphula nokuthetha kunye?

SourceText: First, we can find ways to encourage our children to behave well more often. Spending One-on-One Time with them is an important first step!

text: Okwesibini, singafunda iindlea eziphumelelayo zokulawula ukuziphatha ngendlela enothando kodwa eqinileyo.

SourceText: There are 2 main ways that we can do to help our children behave positively more often.

SourceText: Good for you! Talking about challenges and our emotions can be hard. How was your experience?
text: Wenza kakuhle! Ukuthetha ngemingeni kunye neemvakalelo zethu kunokuba nzima. Ebenjani amava akho?

SourceText: Sharing how we feel and talking about the difficulties we’re facing actually makes everyone in the family stronger! By sharing emotions you can better understand and support each other.
text: Ukwabelana ngendlela ovakalelwa ngayo nokuthetha ngobunzima esijongene nabo kwenza wonke ubani entsatsheni omelele! Ngokwabelana ngeemvakalelo ungaqonda bhetele nize nixhasane.

SourceText: Sharing your emotions or difficulties you are facing is about making others more aware of how you are feeling. You get to decide how much you want to share. You can also choose to share more at a later time.
text: Ukwabelana ngendlela ovakalelwa ngayo okanye ubunzima ojongene nabo kumalunga nokwenza abanye bazi ukuba uziva njani. Ungazenzela isigqibo sokuba ufunaukwabelana kangakanani. Ungakhetha kwakho na ukwabelana ngakumbi kwixesha elizayo.

SourceText: Talking about our feelings or challenges we’re facing can help others understand and support you better. Emotions and challenges are a part of life and learning how to handle these can help you avoid conflict with loved ones and make life less stressful.
text: Ukuthetha ngeemvakalelo zethu okanye imingeni esijongene nayo kunganceda abanye baqonde baze basixhase bhetele. Iimvakalelo nemingeni ziinxalenye yobomi kwaye ukufunda ukuzisingatha kungakunceda uphephe ungquzulwano nabo ubathandayo kwaye kwenza ubomi bungaxinezeli.

SourceText: Starting something new can be difficult. Give yourself and others time to get used to it. By setting a good example by sharing your emotions and challenges you’re facing others will feel start to feel more comfortable sharing too.
text: Kunokuba nzima ukuzama into entsha Ziphe ixesha lokuqhelana nayo. Ngokubeka umzekelo omhle ngokwabelana ngeemvakalelo zakho nemingeni ojojongene nayo nabanye baya kuqalisa ukukhululeka ngakumbi ukwabelana  ngezabo.

SourceText: It’s okay if you don’t want to share at that time. You can choose to share how you’re feeling at a later time once you feel calmer.
text: Kulungile ukuba awufuni kuthetha ngelo xesha. Unako ukukhetha ukwabelana ngeemvakaleo zakho kwixesha lakamva xa uzolile.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that. What was hard for you when talking about your feelings and challenges you are facing?

SourceText: • Adults targeting children for sexual purposes on social media, gaming, and messaging platforms.

SourceText: • Teens sharing personal information and sexual photos or videos of themselves.
text: • Ukwabelana kwabafikisayo ngolwazi lobuqu kunye neefoto  neevidiyo zezesondo.

SourceText: • Cyberbullying from other young people and strangers.
text: • Ukugculelwa kwi-intanethi okuvela kwabanye abantu kunye nabantu ongabaziyo.

SourceText: 2. Tech fixes to protect your children online:
text: 2. Iindlela zolungiso zokukhusela abantwana kwi-intanethi:

SourceText: This does not mean we should ban our children from spending time online. It just means that we need to learn how to protect them in a new world.
text: Oku akuthethi ukuba sifanele sibavale abantwana bethu bangachithi ixesha kwi-intanethi. Kuthetha ukuba kufuneka sifunde ukubakhusela kwihlabathi elitsha .

SourceText: 5. Build open communication and trusting relationships
text: 5. Yakha unxibelelwano oluvulekileyo kunye nolwalamno lokuthembana

SourceText: Tell your children that if they experience something online (or anywhere) that makes them feel upset, uncomfortable, or scared, they can talk to you and you will not get mad or punish them.
text: Xelela abantwana bakho ukuba xa bedibana nento kwi-intanenthi (okanye naphina) ebenza bacaphuke, bangakhululeki, okanye boyike, banokuthetha nawe  kwaye awuzi kucaphuka okanye ubohlwaye.

SourceText: Report to INHOPE Hotlines and IWF portals and the Child Helpline in your country to get support if you or your children experience online violence or other things that are not acceptable.
text: Xela kwi-INHOPE Hotlines ne-IWF portals kunye ne- Child Helpline kwilizwe lakho ukuze ufumane inkxaso ukuba wena okanye umntwana wakho ufumana ubundlobongela  okanye ezinye izinto ezingamkelekanga.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn another way to protect your child online:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuzikhusela kwakho kwi-intanethi.

SourceText: Here is a comic on discussing online activities with your child
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi exubusha ngemisetyenzana yeintanethi nomntwana wakho

SourceText: Parent: "Shani, have you done your homework?"
text: Umzali: “Shani, ngaba uwenzile umsebenzi wakho wesikolo?"

SourceText: Child: "Just a minute, I'm finishing this tiktok video"
text: Umntwana: “Kancinci nje , ndigqibezela l vidiyo" ye-titkok”

SourceText: Parent: "You are a really great dancer! Tell me about why you like it."
text: Umzali: “Ungumdanisi ophum’ izandla ngokwenene! Ndixelele isizathu sokuba uwuthande"

SourceText: Child: "All my friends are on it. I have more than 600 likes and 120 followers."
text: Umntwana: "Bonke abahlobo bam bakuwo. . Ndineelikes eziyi-600 neefollowers eziyi-120."

SourceText: Parent: "I’m proud of how well you dance, Joey. But we need to make sure you are safe on this. I know your friends look at TikTok, but with an open account there are also paedophiles who look at videos of teenagers. Paedophiles are older people who want to attack young children and teens."
text: Umzali: "Ndiyazidla ngendlela odanisa kamnandi ngayo, Joey.. Kodwa simele siqinisekise ukuba ukhuselekile. Ndiyazi ukuba abahlobo bakho bajonga kuTikTok, kodwa ngeakhawunti evulekileyo, kukho nabanye abantu abajonga iividiyo zabantu abafikisayo bencwase ukwabelana nabo ngesondo. Abantu abancwase ukwabelana ngesondo ngabantu abadala abahlasela abantwana nabafikisayo.”

SourceText: Parent: "Let’s look together online at how we can keep this fun for you but also safe. Look – you can make your account private and control who follows you. So you can accept people you know but not strangers. Can we make a rule together that you can use TikTok but with a private account? I trust you to know who to accept!"
text: Umzali: "Makhe sijonge kunye kwi-intanethi ukuze sibone ukuba singaqhubeka njani siqiniseka ukuba wonwabile kodwa ukwakhuselekile. Khangela – ungenza iakhawunti yakho ibe nobumfihlo uze ulawule abantu abakulandelayo. Ngoko ungabamkela abantu obaziyo kodwa hayi ongabaziyo. Ngaba singawenza kunye umgaqo onokuwusebenzisa iTikTok, kodwa kwiakhawunti yabucala? Ndiyathemba uyazi ukuba ngubani omawumamkele!”

SourceText: Parent: "I’m proud of you Shalini..."
text: Umzali: “Ndiyazingca ngawe Salini...”

SourceText: Actively supervise children’s time online, including computers, smartphones, and tablets.

SourceText: It‘s hard to feel positive when our kids or teenagers are driving us crazy. We often end up saying “Stop doing that!” But children are much more likely to do what we ask if we give them positive instructions and lots of praise for what they do right.
text: Kunzima ukuziva ukwimo entle xa abantwana bethu okanye abantwana abafikisayo besikhathaza. Ixesha elininzi siye sigqibele sisithi “Yeka ukwenza loo nto” Kodwa kunokwenzeka bayenze into esibacela ukuba  bayenze abantwana ukuba sibanika imiyalelo kakuhle kunye nezincomo ezininzi ngento abayenze ngokuchanekileyo.

SourceText: Here's a positive video to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often!
text: Nantsi ividiyo eyakhayo yokukunceda wenze ukuba bayilandele rhoqo imyalelo yakho abantwana bakho!

SourceText: Here's a positive audio message to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often!
text: Nanku umyalezo owakhayo wokukunceda wenze ukuba bayilandele rhoqo imyalelo yakho abantwana bakho!

SourceText: Here are 4 steps to help you get your children to follow your instructions more often:
text: Nanga amanyathelo ama-4 okukunceda wenze ukuba bayilandele rhoqo imyalelo yakho abantwana bakho!

SourceText: 1. Get their attention
text: 1. Fumana ingqalelo yabo

SourceText: 2. Be positive, specific, and realistic
text: 2. Bona okuhle, caca, kwaye ubone izinto njengoko  zinjalo

SourceText: 3. One instruction at a time
text: 3. Umyalelo omnye ngexesha

SourceText: 4. Praise them for doing it!
text: 4. Bancome ngokuwenza!

SourceText: To learn more about one of these steps, type "1" to "4". You can also type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nenye yezi ngcebiso, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "4". Ungachwetheza kananjalo  “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: Step 3. Give Instructions One at a Time
text: Inyathelo 3. Nika imiYalelo ubemNye ngeXesha

SourceText: Children are much more likely to do what you ask if you break things up into smaller steps.
text: Banokuyenza into obacela ukuba bayenze abantwana ukuba wohlula izinto zibe ngamanyathelo amancinci.

SourceText: Step 4. Praise Your Children When They Follow Instructions
text: Inyathelo 4. Bancome abaNtwana Bakho Xa beyiLandela imiYalelo

SourceText: They will feel good about it and be more likely to follow instructions in the future!
text: Baza kuziva bewonwabele kwaye banokuyilandela ngokungaphaya imiyalelo kwixa elizayo!

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to get your children to follow instructions more often:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ngaba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuba ubenza njani ukuba bayilandela rhoqo imiyalelo abantwana bakho:

SourceText: Can your child actually do what you are asking them? It is very hard for a child to keep quiet inside for a whole day but maybe they can keep quiet for 15 minutes.
text: Umntwana wakho angayenza ngenene into omcela ukuba ayenze? Kunzima ukuba umntwana athule imini yonke engaphakathi kodwa kunokwenze ukuba athule imizuzu eli-15.

SourceText: Here is a comic on using positive words and praise with your teen.
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi yokusebenzisa amagama kunye nezincomo ezihle emntwaneni wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: Teen: “Can I watch some T.V. after dinner?”
text: Umntwana ofikisayo: “Ndingabukela iT.V kancinci emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa?”

SourceText: Parent: “When you clear the table, you can watch an hour of T.V.”
text: Umzali: “Ungayibukela iyure iT.V., xa sigqiba kucoca  itafile “

SourceText: Parent: “I really appreciate it when you help clean up after dinner. Thank you, Dylan”
text: Umzali: “Ndiluxabise nyhani uncedo lwakho xa unceda ukucoca itafile emva kwesidlo sangokuhlwa.  Enkosi, Dylan”

SourceText: Parent and teen watching T.V. together.
text: Umzali nomntwana ofikisayo bebukele kunye iT.V.

SourceText: Household rules can help keep our children safe from potential dangers both inside the house and in the community. They also help children to know what kind of behaviour is expected from them.
text: Imithetho yasendlini inceda abantwana bethu bakhuseleke koko kunokuba yingozi  ngaphakathi endlini kunye nakuluntu.  Inceda kananjalo abantwana bazi ukuba hloho luni na lokuziphatha  olulindeleke kubo.

SourceText: Hello! Today's Parenting Tip is about how we can involve our children in creating consistent household rules.
text: Molo! ICebo lokuba nguMzali  lanamhlanje limalunga nokuba  singababandakanya njani abantwana bethu ekubekeni imithetho engatshintshiyo yasendlini.

SourceText: Household rules can help keep our children safe from potential dangers both inside the house and in the community. They also help children to know what kind of behaviour is expected from them.
text: Imithetho yasendlini inceda abantwana bethu bakhuseleke koko kunokuba yingozi  ngaphakathi endlini kunye nakuluntu.  Inceda kananjalo abantwana bazi ukuba hloho luni na lokuziphatha  olulindeleke kubo.

SourceText: Here's an audio message on how you can involve your children in establishing household rules.
text: Nanku umyalezo omanyelwayo ongokuba ungababandakanya njani abantwana bakho ekubekeni imithetho yasendlini.

SourceText: Here's is a video on how you can involve your children in establishing household rules.
text: Nantsi ividiyo engokuba ungababandakanya njani abantwana bakho ekubekeni imithetho yasendlini.

SourceText: Here are some simple tips on how you can make household rules with your children and teens:
text: Nazi iingcebiso ezimbalwa  zokwenza imithetho yasendlini kunye nabantwana bakho kunye nabantwana abafikisayo:

SourceText: • Involve your child in establishing household rules.
text: • Bandakanya umntwana wakho ekubekeni imithetho yasendlini.

SourceText: • Make your household rules clear and specific.
text: • Yenze icace kwaye ingqale ngqo imithetho yakho yasendlini.

SourceText: • Make sure your child understands the reasons why you are establishing a household rule.
text: • Qiniseka ukuba umntwana wakho uyaziqonda izizathu zokuba kutheni ubeke umthetho wasendlini.

SourceText: • Make your household rules fair and realistic (just like instructions).
text: • Yenza imithetho yakho yasendlini ibe yefanelekileyo nenokulandelwa (njengemiyalelo).

SourceText: • Praise and simple incentives can help support your child in following a household rule.
text: • Ukuncoma namaqithiqithi nje alula zinokunceda ekuxhaseni ukuba umntwana wakho alandele umthetho.

SourceText: • Add only 1 household rule at a time.
text: • Faka umthetho wasendlini om-1 ngexesha.

SourceText: Children and teens are spending a lot more time online. Here is a comic on how you can create safe and healthy online habits like scheduling time online and offline.
text: Abantwana kunye nabantwana abafikisayo bachitha ixesha elininzi kwi-intanethi. Nantsi ikhomikhi emalunga nokuba ungayidala njani na imikhwa ekhuselekileyo nenempilo yeintanethi njengokuhlela ixesha  lokuba kwi-intanethi kunye nokungabikho kuyo i-intanethi.

SourceText: Parent: “Jack, you have been spending a lot of time on your tablet. Why do you think I am concerned about that?”
text: Umzali: “Jack, uchitha ixesha elininzi kwithablethi yakho. Kutheni ucinga ukuba ndikhathazekile ngoko?”

SourceText: Child: “Um…because I am not doing my schoolwork?”
text: Umntwana: “Um…ngenxa yokuba andiwenzi umsebenzi wam wesikolo ?”

SourceText: Parent: “Yes, that is one reason. It is important that you make the time for your schoolwork. I also like seeing you being more active. Maybe we can make a household rule about gadget use. What do you think would be a fair limit each day?”
text: Umzali: “Ewe, sesinye sezizathu eso. Kubalulekile ukuba uzinike ixesha lokwenza umsebenzi wakho wesikolo. Ndingathanda kananjalo ukukubona ushukuma nangakumbi. Mhlawumbi singamisela umthetho malunga nokusetyenziswa kwezixhobo ze-eletronikhi. Ucinga ukuba kufanele ibe ngowuphi umda ofanelekileyo  suku ngalunye?”

SourceText: Child: “Um…two hours a day?”
text: Umntwana: “Um…iiyure ezimbini ngemini?”

SourceText: Parent: “Hmmm…I think that might be too much time. You have so much else to do every day.”
text: Umzali: “Hmmm…ndicinga ukuba iza kuba lixesha elininzi kakhulu elo. Unokuninzi ekufuneka ukwenze suku ngalunye.”

SourceText: Child: “How about one hour for fun and one hour for learning?
text: Umntwana: “Ucinga ntoni ngeyure enye  yolonwabo kunye neyure enye yokufunda?

SourceText: Parent: “That sounds reasonable. I would also like you to do your schoolwork before using any gadgets. So from now on, the household rule is that you do your schoolwork before using gadgets and that you can have 1 hour for free time and 1 hour for educational activities. Okay?”
text: Umzali: “Kuvakala kufanelekile ke oko. Ndingathanda kananjalo ukuba wenze umsebenzi wakho wesikolo phambi kokusebenzisa naziphi na izixhobo ze-eletronikhi.  Ngoko ke ukusukela ngoku, umthetho wasendlini ngowokuba  wenza umsebenzi wakho wesikolo phambi kokusebenzisa izixhobo ze-eletronikhi kwaye unganeyure e-1  yexesha ongenzi nto ngalo kunye neyure -1 yemisetyenzana yokufunda.  Kulungile?"

SourceText: Child: “Okay.”
text: Umntwana: "Kulungile."

SourceText: Today's tip is about how we can help to protect our children.
text: Icebo lanamhlanje limalunga  nokuba singanceda njani ukukhusela abantwana bethu.

SourceText: The idea of talking to children about abuse can be scary. We don't know what to say. But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and that they can tell you if something ever happens.
text: Luyoyikisa uluvo lokuthetha nabantwana ngophatho gadalala. Asazi ukuba sithini. Kodwa kukho izinto ezithile ezilula ezinokubanceda baqonde xa KULUNGILE ukuphathwa, kunye nokuba banokukuxelela ukuba kuke kwenzeka nantoni na.

SourceText: When you are walking or doing something together it can be easier to chat.
text: Kunokuba lula ukuncokola  xa nihamba okanye nisenza into kunye.

SourceText: Do you want to learn more about how to protect your child from abuse?
text: Ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuba ungamkhusela njani umntwana wakho kuphatho gadalala?

SourceText: Here are 3 things that you should make sure your child knows to protect them from abuse:
text: Nazi izinto ezi-3 ekufuneka uqiniseke ngazo ukuba uyazazi umntwana wakho ukubakhusela kuphatho gadalala:

SourceText: 1. Learn about private parts
text: 1. Funda ngamalungu angasese

SourceText: 2. Your body belongs to you
text: 2. Umzimba wakho ngowakho

SourceText: 3. Bad secrets should be told
text: 3. Kufuneka zixelwe iimfihlo ezimbi

SourceText: Type "1" to "3" to learn more about these tips. Type "N" to stop this tip.
text: Ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nezi ngcebiso, chwetheza “1" ukuya ku "3". Chwetheza “N” ukumisa eli cebo.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to protect your child from abuse:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuba ungamkhusela njani umntwana wakho kuphatho gadalala?

SourceText: 3. Bad secrets should be told.
text: 3. Kufuneka zixelwe iimfihlo ezimbi

SourceText: Your children should tell you if there is a secret that makes them feel worried. You will not be angry. Only nice secrets - like a surprise birthday party - should be kept secret.
text: Kufuneka bakuxelele abantwana bakho ukuba kukho imfihlo ebenza bazive bekhathazekile. Ngeke ube nomsindo. Ziimfihlo ezintle kuphela - ezifana nepati yemini yokuzalwa engummngaliso - ekufuneka igcinwe iyimfihlo.

SourceText: The parts of their body that go under people's underwear or a swimsuit are private parts. It is not OK for other people to touch or to ask to look at them, or ask them to look at or touch theirs.
text: Amalungu emizimba yabo angaphantsi kwempahla yabantu yangaphantsi okanye kwimpahla yokuqubha ngamalungu angasese. AKULUNGANGA ukuba abanye abantu baphathe okanye bacele ukuba ujonge, okanye bacele ukuba ujonge okanye uphathe awabo.

SourceText: If someone tries to touch your children's private parts they must say NO and tell a grown up that they trust.
text: Ukuba ngaba umntu uzama ukuphatha amalungu angasese abantwana bakho kufuneka bathi HAYI baze baxelele umntu omdala abamthembayo.

SourceText: Stress from caregiving can make us angry. Here is how we can maintain control and keep calm.
text: Uxinzelelo oluvela ekugcineni lungasenza sibe nomsindo. Nantsi indlela esingagcina ngayo ulawulo kwaye sizigcine sizolile.

SourceText: Here's a video to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
text: Nantsi ividiyo yokukunceda ugcine ulawulo kwaye uzigcine uzolile xa usiba nomsindo.

SourceText: Here's an audio message to help you maintain control and keep calm when you get angry.
text: Nanku umyalezo omanyelwayo wokukunceda ugcine ulawulo kwaye uzigcine uzolile xa usiba nomsindo.

SourceText: Think about what makes you angry? When does it happen? How do you normally react?
text: Cinga ngento ekwenza ube nomsindo. Kwenzeka xa kutheni oku? Udla ngokusabela njani?

SourceText: Prevent anger from starting in the first place. Get some sleep or rest when you are tired. Try to eat something when you are hungry. Ask someone for support when you are feeling alone.
text: Thintela ukuba nomsindo kwasekuqaleni. Lala okanye uphumle xa udiniwe. Zama ukutya xa ulambile. Cela umntu akuxhase xa uziva ngathi uwedwa.

SourceText: Here are some things that can prevent bad things from happening when you are angry:
text: Nazi izinto ezinokuthintela ukwenzeka kwezinto ezimbi xa usiba nomsindo:

SourceText: 1. Cut back on drinking alcohol or don’t drink, especially when the kids are awake.
text: 1. Hlisa ukusela utywala okanye ungaseli nje kwaphela, ingakumbi xa behleli abantwana.

SourceText: 2. Do you have weapons or things that can be used to hurt others? Lock them up, hide them or take them out of the home.
text: 2. Unazo izixhobo okanye izinto ezinokusetyenziswa ukwenzakalisa abanye? Zitshixele, zifihle okanye uzisuse ekhaya.

SourceText: 3. It’s ok to have your children stay somewhere safe or take them to a place where they can get help.
text: 3. Kulungile ukwenza abantwana bakho bahlale kwenye indawo ekhuselekileyo okanye ubase apho banokufumana uncedo khona.

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Next time you feel yourself getting angry try to manage this by taking deep breaths in. This can allow you to relax and reduce stress, which can help with managing your emotions. Every time you do this, you increase your child's brain development!
text: Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukwehlelwa ngulo mngeni. Kwixesha elilandelayo uziva ngathi uba nomsindo zama ukukulawula oku ngokuphefumlela nzulu ngaphakathi. Oku kukwenza ukhululeke kwaye kwehlisa uxinzelelo,  oko okukunceda ulawule iimvakalelo zakho.  Xesha ngalinye usenza oku, unyusa ukukhula kobuchopho bomntwana wakho!

SourceText: When you take care of yourself, you take care of your children. We all need to connect. Try to talk to friends, family, and other support networks every day. If it has been a while since you reached out to someone, do it now!
text: Xa uzinyamekela, unyamekela abantwana bakho. Sonke kufuneka sidibane. Zama ukuthetha nabahlobo, usapho, kunye nolunye  uthungelwano lwenkxaso yonke imihla. Ukuba sekulithuba ugqibele ukufowunela umntu, kwenze ngoku oko!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. It is completely normal to be going through a difficult time now. Remember that you are not alone. Here is an activity that might also help...
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba alumnandanga usuku lwakho. Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukuba nexesha elinzima ngoku. Khumbula ukuba awuwedwa. Nanku umsetyenzana onokukunceda kananjalo ...

SourceText: Make a list of healthy activities that you like to do. Here are some suggestions:
text: Yenza uluhlu lwemisetyenzana esempilweni othanda ukuyenza. Nazi iingcebiso ezithile:

SourceText: • Listening to your favourite music
text: * Ukumamela umculo wakho owuthandayo

SourceText: • Going for a walk (if allowed)
text: * Ukuhambahamba (ukuba kuvumelekile)

SourceText: • Doing some exercise
text: * Ukuzilolonga

SourceText: • Drinking a cup of tea by yourself
text: * Ukusela ikomityi yeti uwedwa

SourceText: • Calling up a friend
text: * Ukufowunela umhlobo

SourceText: • Singing, dancing, praying, or reading
text: * Ukucula, ukudanisa, ukuthandaza okanye ukufunda

SourceText: • Sitting in the sun with your eyes closed
text: * Ukuhlala elangeni uvale amehlo

SourceText: • Watching your favourite T.V. show
text: * Ukubukela inkqubo oyithandayo ekwi-TV.

SourceText: Pick one and do it today!
text: Khetha ibenye uze uyenze namhlanje!

SourceText: We would love to learn more about how we can improve these messages. Would you be willing to chat with us about your experience? You will receive a free data voucher if you are contacted for an interview!
text: Singathanda ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuba singayiphucula njani le miyalezo. Ungavuma ukuncokola nathi malunga namava akho? Uza kufumana ivawutsha yedatha yasimahla ukuba ngaba kuqhagamshelwene nawe ngodliwanondlebe!

SourceText: Thank you so much! Here is a link to sign up!
text: Enkosi kakhulu! Nali iqhagamshela lokusayina!

SourceText: Hello! Did you know that 3 is a magical number? Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Molo! Ingaba ubusazi ukuba isi-3 linani elingummangaliso? Phefumlela ngaphakathi uze  ubale kathathu uze uphefumlele ngaphandle ubale kathathu. Uziva njani ngoku? Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo?

SourceText: Here's an audio message to guide you through this activity!
text: Nanku umyalezo omanyelwayo wokukukhokela kulo msetyenzana!

SourceText: What are your three favourite foods? Can you name three things you can see right now?
text: Zeziphi izidlo zakho  ezithathu ozithanda kakhulu. Ungaxela izinto ezintathu ozibonayo ngoku?

SourceText: Can you hear three sounds you can hear right now?
text: Ungachaza izandi ezithathu ongaziva ngoku?

SourceText: What are the three things you are grateful for right now?
text: Zeziphi izinto ezintathu onombulelo ngazo ngoku?

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three and breathe out to the count of three. How do you feel now? Do you feel any different?
text: Phefumlela ngaphakathi uze  ubale kathathu uze uphefumlele ngaphandle ubale kathathu. Uziva njani ngoku? Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo?

SourceText: Three is a magical number!
text: Isithathu linani elingummangaliso!

SourceText: Here's a video to guide through this activity!
text: Nantsi ividiyo yokukukhokela kulo msetyenzana!

SourceText: Here is a song made just for parents like you.
text: Nali iculo elenzelwe abazali abafana nawe.

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your children is free and fun. It makes children feel loved and secure, and shows them that they are important. It also increases their confidence and self-esteem!
text: IXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana wakho lisimahla kwaye lilulonwabo! Lenza abantwana bazive bethandwa, liubabonisa ukuba babalulekile. Likwanyusa nokuzithemba nokuzixabisa kwabo!

SourceText: Here are 6 tips to make One-on-One Time with your child a success:
text: Nazi iingcebiso ezisi-6 zokwenza iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nosana lwakho libe yimpumelelo:

SourceText: 1. Spend at least five minutes with each child
text: 1. Chitha ubuncinane bemizuzu emihlanu nomntwana ngamnye

SourceText: 2. Give your child your full attention
text: 2. Mnike ingqalelo epheleleyo umntwana wakho

SourceText: 3. Let your child choose the activity
text: 3. Yenza umntwana wakho akhethe umsetyenzana

SourceText: 4. Follow your child's lead
text: 4. Landela inkokelo yomntwana wakho

SourceText: 5. Use words to describe what your child is doing
text: 5. Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza into ayenzayo umntwana wakho

SourceText: 6. Have fun!
text: 6. Yonwaba!

SourceText: Even 5 minutes a day of quality time makes a big difference. If you have more than one child, try to find time for each individual child. It can be at the same time each day so your children look forward to it.
text: Nemizuzu emi-5 na ngemini yexesha elichithwa kunye yenza umahluko oimkhulu. Ukuba ngaba unabantwana abangaphezulu komnye, zama ukufumana ixesha lomntwana ngamnye.  Inokuba lixesha elinye suku ngalunye ukuze bahlale belilangazelela abantwana bakho

SourceText: Children need to do things in their own time. Try to give them time to explore and be patient. Play alongside and copy what they are doing but try to let them keep the initiative.
text: Abantwana bafuna ukwenza izinto ngelabo ixesha. Zama ukubanika ixesha lokuphonononga kwaye ube nomonde. Dlala ecaleni kwakhe kwaye ulinganise into ayenzayo kodwa zama ukumenza ibe nguye okhokelayo.

SourceText: Choosing builds their self confidence. If they want to do something that isn’t okay, then this is a chance to talk with them about this.
text: Ukukhetha kwakha ukuzithemba kwabo. Ukuba bafuna ukwenza into engalunganga, lithuba ke eli lokuthetha nabo malunga noku.

SourceText: Please select another number if you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your child:
text: Nceda ukhethe elinye inani ukuba ngaba ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuba ungalichitha njani iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana wakho:

SourceText: Here is a comic about spending one-on-one time with your child! Try to follow your child's lead when spending time with them. It will help build self-confidence.
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi malunga nokuchitha ixesha lobuso ngobuso nomntwana wakho! Zama ukulandela inkokelo yomntwana wakho xa uchitha ixesha nabo. Kuza kunceda ukwakha ukuzithemba.

SourceText: Parent: "I see you are playing quietly with the lego with concentration, Alex."
text: Umzali: "Ndiyabona ukuba udlala uthule  ngelego uzikise ingqondo , Alex."

SourceText: Parent: "Wow! You are building such a tall and strong wall with those legos."
text: Umzali: "Wow! Wakha udonga olude nolomeleleyo ngezo lego.”

SourceText: Child: "It is for cows."
text: Umntwana: Lolweenkomo"

SourceText: Parent: "It will keep the cow safe!"
text: Umzali: “Luza kuyigcina ikhuselekile inkomo!”

SourceText: Child: "Now you can help me build a house for our family to sleep in!"
text: Umntwana: “Ngoku ungandinceda  ndakhe indlu yosapho lwethu oluza kulala kuyo!”

SourceText: Parent: "This house is going to keep our family warm and dry. You are such a good builder, Alex!"
text: Umzali: “Le ndlu iza kulugcina lufudumele kwaye lomile usapho lwethu. Ungumakhi ogqwesileyo , Alex!”

SourceText: Would you like some suggestions for activities to do with your child?
text: Ungathanda ukufumana iingcebiso ezithile zemisetyenzana onokuyenza nomtwana wakho?

SourceText: Here's a video about spending one-on-one time with your child!
text: Nantsi ividiyo emalunga nokuchitha ixesha lobuso ngobuso nomntwana wakho!

SourceText: Here's an audio message about spending one-on-one time with your child!
text: Nanku umyalezo omanyelwayo malunga nokuchitha ixesha lobuso ngobuso nomntwana wakho!

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" whenever you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your child. Chat to you later @fields.user_name!
text: Kulungile! Ungasoloko uchwetheza “Uncedo” nanini ufuna ukufunda ngokungaphaya malunga nokuba ungalichitha njani iXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana wakho: Ndiza kuncokola nawe mva @fields.user_name!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: That's okay! You can always type "Help" whenever you want to learn more about how to spend One-on-One Time with your child. Chat to you later!

SourceText: Make sure you will not be interrupted. Finish all your chores, switch off the TV and put your phone on silent. It will show @fields.child_nickname, they are important.
text: Qiniseka ukuba ngeke uphazanyiswe. Gqiba yonke imisebenzi yakho yasendlini, cima iTV uze ubeke ifowuni yakho kwimo ethuleyo. Kuza kubonisa @fields.child_nickname, ukuba babalulekile.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Make sure you will not be interrupted. Finish all your chores, switch off the TV and put your phone on silent. It will show your child, they are important.
text: Qiniseka ukuba ngeke uphazanyiswe. Gqiba yonke imisebenzi yakho yasendlini, cima iTV uze ubeke ifowuni yakho kwimo ethuleyo. Kuza kubonisa umntwana wakho, ukuba ubalulekile.

SourceText: Ask @fields.child_nickname what they would like to do. You can say, "I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you, what would you like to do?"
text: Buza @fields.child_nickname ukuba yintoni angathanda ukuyenza. Ungathi, “ndinemizuzu emi-5 endinokuyichitha kwiXesha loBuso ngoBuso nawe, ungathanda ukwenza ntoni?”
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Ask your child what they would like to do. You can say, "I have 5 minutes to spend One-on-One Time with you, what would you like to do?"

SourceText: If @fields.child_nickname cannot think of anything, you can give them a choice of a couple things that you know they like.
text: Ukuba @fields.child_nickname akukho nantoni na acinga ngayo, ungamnika ukhetho lweqela lezinto owaziyo ukuba uyazithanda.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If your child cannot think of anything, you can give them a choice of a couple things that you know they like.
text: Ukuba umntwana wakho akukho nantoni na acinga ngayo, ungamnika ukhetho lweqela lezinto owaziyo ukuba uyazithanda.

SourceText: Listening to @fields.child_nickname is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what @fields.child_nickname is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!
text: Ukumamela @fields.child_nickname kubaluleke kakhulu kunokuthetha naye ngeli xesha. Ukuba uyathetha kufuneka uchaze into  @fields.child_nicknameayenzayo. Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza izenzo, imibala, iimilo, amanani, ubukhulu, imvakalo yokuphatha, amaqondo obushushu, iimvakalo zokungcamla, izandi, kunye nantoni na eyenye eyenzekayo!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Listening to your child is more important than talking to them at this time. If you do talk you should describe what your child is doing. Use words to describe actions, colours, shapes, numbers, sizes, textures, temperatures, tastes, sounds, and anything else that is happening!
text: Ukumamela umntwana wakho  kubaluleke kakhulu kunokuthetha naye ngeli xesha. Ukuba uyathetha kufuneka uchaze into  ayenzayo. Sebenzisa amagama ukuchaza izenzo, imibala, iimilo, amanani, ubukhulu, imvakalo yokuphatha, amaqondo obushushu, iimvakalo zokungcamla, izandi, kunye nantoni na eyenye eyenzekayo!

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your child can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after playing with @fields.child_nickname.
text: IXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana wakho linokuba lulonwabo, nakuwe ngokunjalo! Unokude ufumanise nokuba  uziva ungekho phantsi koxinzelelo olungako  emva kokudlala no @fields.child_nickname.

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your child can be fun for you, too! You might even find that you feel less stressed after playing with your child.

SourceText: Here is a comic on spending one-on-time with your teen.
text: Nantsi ikhomikhi ngokuchitha ixesha lobuso ngobuso nomntwana wakho.ofikisayo.

SourceText: One-on-One Time with your teen helps build a positive and trusting relationship. When you really notice them and listen to what they are saying and what they like, you make them feel valued and appreciated.
text: IXesha loBuso ngoBuso nomntwana wakho ofikisayo linceda ukwakha ubudlelwane obuhle nobokuthembana. Xa baqaphela ngenene kwaye uyimamela nento abayithethayo kunye nento abayithandayo, ubenza bazive bexabisekile kwaye bebulelwa.

SourceText: Here are 6 tips on how to make One-on-One Time a positive experience for you and your teen:
text: Nazi iingcebiso ezi-6 zokuba ulenza njani iXesha loBuso ngeBuso libe ngamava amahle kuwe nasemntwaneni wakho ofikisayo:

SourceText: 2. Let your teen choose the activity
text: 2. Yenza ukuba umntwana wakho ofikisayo akhethe umsetyenzana

SourceText: 3. Follow your teen's lead
text: 3. Landela inkokelo yomntwana wakho ofikisayo

SourceText: 4. Give your teen your full attention
text: 4. Mnike ingqalelo epheleleyo umntwana wakho ofikisayo

SourceText: 5. Show your teen you are really listening
text: 5. Mbonise ukuba umamele ngenene umntwana wakho ofikisayo

SourceText: Fathers can have difficult relationships with their teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
text: Ootata banokuba nobudlelwane obunzima nabantwana babo abafikisayo, kunokuba nzima ukufumana ulonwabo ekuchitheni ixesha nabo. Endaweni yoko,  bachitha ixesha elininzi  bebaqeqesha okanye bekhalazela indlela abaziphethe ngayo.

SourceText: Mothers can have difficult relationships with their teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
text: Oomama banokuba nobudlelwane obunzima nabantwana babo abafikisayo, kunokuba nzima ukufumana ulonwabo ekuchitheni ixesha nabo. Endaweni yoko,  bachitha ixesha elininzi  bebaqeqesha okanye bekhalazela indlela abaziphethe ngayo.

SourceText: When we have difficult relationships with our teenagers, it can be hard to find pleasure from spending time with them. Instead, we spend a lot of time disciplining them or complaining about how they are behaving.
text: Xa sinobudlelwane obunzima nabantwana bethu abafikisayo, kunokuba nzima ukufumana ulonwabo ekuchitheni ixesha nabo.  Endaweni yoko,  bachitha ixesha elininzi  bebaqeqesha okanye bekhalazela indlela abaziphethe ngayo.

SourceText: Tell @fields.child_nickname that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. @fields.child_nickname might think this is weird at first but will come to enjoy having this dedicated time with you!
text: Xelela @fields.child_nickname ukuba ungathanda ukuchitha ixesha naye kunye nokuba angakhetha into emayenziwe okanye emakuthethwe ngayo. @fields.child_nickname unokucinga ukuba akuqhelekanga oku ekuqaleni kodwa uza  kulonwabela eli xesha linikelwe yena nawe!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Tell your teen that you would like to spend some time with them and that they can choose what to do or talk about. Your teen might think this is weird at first but will come to enjoy having this dedicated time with you!
text: Xelela umntwana wakho ofikisayo ukuba ungathanda ukuchitha ixesha kunye naye kwaye angakhetha into afuna yenziwe okanye afuna ukuncokola ngayo. Umntwana wakho ofikisayo ekuqaleni usenokucinga ukuba akuqhelekanga oku kodwa uza kulonwabela eli xesha linikelwe yena nawe!

SourceText: Try to follow @fields.child_nickname's lead during One-on-One Time. Accept their suggestions. Remember this is @fields.child_nickname's activity. Your job is to show an interest and say something nice.
text: Zama ukulandela inkokelo ka @fields.child_nickname ngexa leXesha loBuso ngoBuso. Zamkele iingcebiso zabo. Khumbula ukuba lo ngumsetyenzana ka @fields.child_nickname Umsebenzi wakho nje kukubonisa umdla kwaye utsho into evakala kamnandi.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to follow your teen's lead during One-on-One Time. Accept their suggestions. Remember this is your teen's activity. Your job is to show an interest and say something nice.
text: Zama ukulandela inkokelo yomntwana wakho ofikisayo  ngexa leXesha loBuso ngoBuso. Zamkele iingcebiso zabo. Khumbula ukuba lo ngumsetyenzana womntwana wakho ofikisayo. Umsebenzi wakho nje kukubonisa umdla kwaye utsho into evakala kamnandi.

SourceText: Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with @fields.child_nickname each day. Choose a time when you and @fields.child_nickname will not be interrupted and when @fields.child_nickname does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.
text: Bekela ecaleni ixesha ngqo oza kulichitha uBuso ngoBuso no @fields.child_nicknamesuku ngalunye. Khetha ixesha elo wena kunye no @fields.child_nickname ningayi kuphazanyiswa ngalo kwaye xa  @fields.child_nicknameengenayo enye into afuna ukuyenza, njengokubukela iTV okanye ukudlala ngeefowuni.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Set aside a specific time to spend One-on-One Time with your teen each day. Choose a time when you and your teen will not be interrupted and when your teen does not have something else that they want to do, like watching TV or playing with phones.
text: Bekela ecaleni ixesha ngqo oza kulichitha uBuso ngoBuso nomntwana wakho ofikisayo suku ngalunye. Khetha ixesha elo wena kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo  ningayi kuphazanyiswa ngalo kwaye xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo engenayo enye into afuna ukuyenza , njengokubukela iTV okanye ukudlala ngeefowuni.

SourceText: Try to do something different than watching TV or playing with a tablet/phone. However, you may need to at first join @fields.child_nickname and watch their favourite TV programme with them. They may feel comfortable doing other activities with time.
text: Zama into eyahlukileyo kunokubukela iTV okanye ukudlala ngethablethi /ifowuni. Nakuba kunjalo, kunokufuneka umjoyine kuqala  @fields.child_nickname  kwaye ubukele naye inkqubo yakhe ayithandayo yeTV. Banokuziva bekhululekile ukwenza eminye imisetyenzana  ngokuhamba kwexesha.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Try to do something different than watching TV or playing with a tablet/phone. However, you may need to at first join your teen and watch their favourite TV programme with them. They may feel comfortable doing other activities with time.
text: Zama into eyahlukileyo kunokubukela iTV okanye ukudlala ngethablethi /ifowuni. Nakuba kunjalo, kunokufuneka umjoyine kuqala umntwana wakho ofikisayo  kwaye ubukele naye inkqubo yakhe ayithandayo yeTV. Banokuziva bekhululekile ukwenza eminye imisetyenzana  ngokuhamba kwexesha.

SourceText: You can even try rephrasing back what @fields.child_nickname says when they speak to you. For example, when @fields.child_nickname says, “This math problem is really hard,” you can say, “Yeah, I see that you are finding it difficult.” It shows you are really listening to them and will make them feel supported.
text: Ungade uzame nokubeka ngamanye amagama  into  @fields.child_nickname ayitshoyo xa ethetha nawe. Umzekelo, xa @fields.child_nickname esithi, “Sinzima nyhani esi sibalo sematematika,”ungathi, “Ewe, ndiyabona ukuba usifumanisa sinzima.” Kubonisa ukuba ummamele ngenene kwaye uya kubenza bazive bexhaswa.
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: You can even try rephrasing back what your teen says when they speak to you. For example, when your teen says, “This math problem is really hard,” you can say, “Yeah, I see that you are finding it difficult.” It shows you are really listening to them and will make them feel supported.
text: Ungade uzame nokubeka ngamanye amagama  into umntwana wakho ofikisayo  ayitshoyo xa ethetha nawe. Umzekelo, xa umntwana wakho ofikisayo esithi, “Sinzima nyhani esi sibalo sematematika,”ungathi, “Ewe, ndiyabona ukuba usifumanisa sinzima.” Kubonisa ukuba ummamele ngenene kwaye uya kubenza bazive bexhaswa.

SourceText: 4. Give your teen all of your attention.
text: 4. Mnike yonke ingqalelo yakho umntwana wakho ofikisayo

SourceText: Switch off the television and put away phones. Make sure you can give all of your attention to @fields.child_nickname.
