SourceText: Switch off the television and put away phones. Make sure you can give all of your attention to your teen.
text: Cima umabonakude uze ubeke kude iifowuni. Qiniseka ukuba unnako ukunika yonke ingqalelo yakho kumntwana wakho ofikisayo.

SourceText: Look at @fields.child_nickname. Nodding or “I see” shows @fields.child_nickname you are really paying attention. Accept what they are saying without judging them.

SourceText: Parent (looks back to teen): “I understand it is hard to be separate from your friends. Especially since I am sure they are missing you, too. Let’s think of some ways that you could reach out to them.”
text: Umzali (ujonga umntwana ofikisayo): “Ndiyaqonda ukuba kunzima ukohlukana nabahlobo bakho. Ingakumbi njengokuba ndiqinisekile ukuba nabo bayakukhumbula. Masicinge ngeendlela  ezithile onokufikelela ngazo kubo.”

SourceText: Quick tip: It can be difficult to know how to talk to your children about something like COVID-19, especially since we are learning about it too.
text: Icebo likhawulezileyo: Kunokuba nzima ukwazi ukuba ungathetha njani nabantwana bakho malunga nento efana ne-COVID-19, ingakumbi kuba nathi sisafunda ngayo.

SourceText: The important thing is to be open and listen to your children. Be honest and supportive. Show them that you care.
text: Into ebalulekileyo kukuba ungafihli kwaye ubamamele abantwana bakho.  Nyaniseka kwaye ubaxhase. Babonise ukuba uyakhathala.

SourceText: Quick tip: It is really hard to help our children continue learning when schools are closed or part-open. One thing that might be helpful is to try and set up a daily schedule that includes time for schoolwork and time for fun.
text: Icebo likhawulezileyo: Kunzima ngenene ukunceda abantwana bethu baqhube befunda xa izikolo zivaliwe okanye kuvulwe inxenye yazo. Into enye enokuba luncedo kukuzama kunye nokumisela ishedyuli yemihla ngemihla equka ixesha lomsebenzi wesikolo kunye nexesha lolonwabo.

SourceText: Quick tip: Caring for yourself is really important. Take five deep breaths when you feel overwhelmed. Try talking to a friend, or doing something relaxing for yourself? You deserve it!
text: Icebo elikhawulezileyo: Ukuzikhathalela wena kubaluleke ngenene. Phefumla nzulu kahlanu xa uziva usoyisakala. Zama ukuthetha nomhlobo, okanye  ukuzenzela into ephumzayo Ukufanelekele oku!

SourceText: Quick tip: All children, including those living with disabilities, need love, respect and time especially at difficult times.
text: Icebo elikhawulezileyo: Bonke abantwana, kuquka nabo baphila nokukhubazeka, bafuna uthando, intlonipho kunye nexesha ingakumbi kumaxesha anzima.

SourceText: Quick tip: This is a stressful time for all of us. When a problem comes up, talk about it together! What is the problem exactly? What different solutions are there and what are the consequences of one? That way, you can find a solution that can be OK for everyone.
text: Icebo elikhawulezileyo: Eli lixesha elinoxinzelelo kuthi sonke. Xa kuvela ingxaki, thethani ngayo kunye! Yintoni kanye kanye  ingxaki. Zeziphi izisombululo ezohlukeneyo ezikhoyo kwaye izeziphi iziphumo zaso ngasinye? Ngaloo ndlela, ungafumana isisombululo esinokuba SILUNGILE kumntu wonke.

SourceText: Quick tip: It is normal to be stressed about money. Talk to your children about how much money comes in and what you spend money on as a family each month. When everyone sees where the money goes, it is easier to agree on where you can save money together!
text: Icebo elikhawulezileyo: Kuqhelekile ukuba phantsi koxinzelelo ngenxa yemali. Thetha nabantwana bakho malunga nokuba yimalini engenayo kunye nento oyichitha kusapho nyanga nganye. Xa wonke umntu sele ebona ukuba iyaphi imali, kulula ukuvumelana ngokuba ningayilondoloza phi na imali kunye!

SourceText: Here's another tip! A daily stress-reducer can help us with parenting, and make us feel better.  Let’s start with 30 seconds of relaxation for yourself. You deserve this!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. When we have a problem, we always want to get to the quickest end result and can forget about the steps. Really understanding the problem and the different solutions first helps to come up with the best solution together. You can do this!
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba ukufumanisa kucela umngeni oku. Xa sinengxaki, sisoloko sifuna ukukhawuleza sifike kwisisombululo kwaye singalibala ngamanyathelo abandakanyekileyo. Ukuyiqonda ngenene ingxaki kwaye izisombululo ezohlukeneyo zinceda kuqala ekuzeni nesisombululo esigqwesileyo kunye. Ungakwenza oku!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Sometimes it can be difficult to agree with everyone in the family, especially if not everyone is calm yet. You could agree to try one first, then the other. Or If you get stuck, try to get together later  to agree on the solution together. You can do this!
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba ukufumanisa kucela umngeni oku. Ngamanye amaxesha kunokuba nzima ukuvumelana naye wonke umntu kusapho, ingakumbi ukuba akakazoli wonke umntu okwangoku. Ningavumelana ngokuzama esinye kuqala, ize ke ibe sesinye. Kwakhona, ukuba anihambeli phambili, zamani ukudibana ngelinye ixesha nize nivumelane ngesisombululo. Ungakwenza oku!

SourceText: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of even 30 minutes this week to do this activity? It will make a big difference in keeping your child safe and building a trusting relationship between you. You can do it!
text: Kunganzima ukufumana ixesha emini, ngomsebenzi, imisebenzi yendlu, kunye nayo yonke enye into. Ungacinga nangemizuzu nje engama-30 kule veki ukuze wenze lo msetyenzana? Kuza kwenza umahluko omkhulu ekugcineni umntwana wakho ekhuselekile kunye nokwakha ubudlelwane bokuthembana phakathi kwenu. Ungakwenza oku.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Creating new and healthy habits like device-free space and time in your house (eating, playing, schoolwork, and sleeping) is a learning process. Try slowly introducing  device-free times, and build up from there. Change takes time, you can do this!
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba ukufumanisa kucela umngeni oku. Ukuyila imikhwa emitsha nenempilo efana nendawo ekungasetyenziswa zixhobo  ze-eletronikhi kuyo kunye nexesha endlini yakho (ukutya, ukudlala, umsebenzi wesikolo, nokulala) yinkqubo yokufunda. Zama kancinane ukwazisa amaxesha ekungasetyenziswa zixhobo ze-eletronikhi kuwo, uze ke uqale ukwakhela apho. Luthatha ixesha utshintsho, ungakwenza oku!

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. If you think your child is accessing information online which is not age appropriate discuss with them why you have concerns, and why you are not comfortable. Try having your child involved in the conversation and get them to share their views. Having an open conversation is important, and children are more likely to stick to decisions if they feel that they are fair and their opinions have been heard.
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba ukufumanisa kucela umngeni oku. Xa ucinga ukuba umntwana wakho ufikelela kulwazi olukwi-intanethi olungafanelanga ubudala bakhe xoxa naye malunga nokuba kutheni uneenkxalabo, kunye nokuba kutheni ungakhyululekanga.  Zama ukumbandakanya umntwana wakho kwingxoxo kwaye umenze ukuba abelane nawe ngezimvo zakhe. Kubalulekile ukuba nengxoxo ephandle, kwaye abantwana kunokwenzeka ukuba bagcine izigqibo xa benemvakalelo yokuba zifanelekileile kwaye ziviwe izimvo zabo.

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel overwhelmed as a parent. All parents feel this way. Try calling a family member or a friend. Sometimes just talking with someone is enough, but if you still feel overwhelmed, ask someone for help. Calling for help is a sign of strength. You can do this!

SourceText: Thanks! One helpful way is to create a map with your child or teen that identifies the safe and unsafe places in the community. Here are 3 simple steps:

SourceText: That is completely normal, well done for trying the activity! When we listen to our children or teenagers, even if we disagree, we learn to understand their thinking. Try and find time to do the activity again. This time, try to really listen and show you understand them before expressing your thoughts.
text: Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo oko, usebenzile ngokuzama umsetyenzana! Xa sibamamela abantwana bethu okanye abantwana abafikisayo, sifunda ukuqonda indlela abacinga ngayo nokuba asivumelani nabo. Zama ukwenza ixesha uze uphinde wenze lo msetyenzana wakhona. Kweli tyeli, zama ukumamela kwaye ubonise ukuba uyabaqonda ngaphambi kokuvakalisa iingcinga zakho.

SourceText: That is a completely normal experience, it is shocking to learn that people who are close to us and who we trust may be a danger to our children. Find someone you can talk to about this, perhaps a friend or support service, so you can get the support your need. Remember to take a pause when you are stressed.
text: Ngamava aqheleke ngokupheleleyo, kuyothusa ukufumanisa ukuba abasondeleyo kuthi nesibathembayo banokuba yingozi ebantwaneni bethu. Fumana umntu onokuthetha naye ngale nto, mhlawumbi isihlobo okanye inkonzo yenkxaso ukuze ufumane inkxaso oyifunayo. Khumbula ukuphumla xa uphantsi koxinzelelo.

SourceText: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. Our children may know things about our communities and technology that we are not aware of. When we actively involve our children in the mapping activity, they feel heard and valued, and it can be easier to come up with a plan that everyone agrees on.
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba ukufumanisa kucela umngeni oku. Abantwana bethu basenokwazi izinto ngeendawo esihlala kuzo kunye nobuchwepheshe esingabaziyo thina. Xa sibabandakanya abantwana bethu ekuyileni umsetyenzana, baziva bemanyelwe kwaye bexatyiswa ibe kungalula ukuza nesicwangciso ekuvunyewana ngaso ngumntu wonke.

SourceText: It is difficult to know every detail about our communities. Involve another family member or friend in your mapping activity. You can even visit some of the services available and ask what they do. The more we know, the better we can keep our families safe!
text: Kunzima ukwazi zonke iinkcukacha ngeendawo esihlala kuzo. Xa uyila  umsetyenzana wakho, bandakanya elinye ilungu losapho okanye umhlobo. Usenokude utyelele ezinye zeenkonzo ezifumanekayo kwaye ubuze  ukuba benza ntoni. Okukhona sisazi, kokukhona sinokugcina iintsapho zethu zikhuselekile!

SourceText: It is completely normal to experience this. Try creating a safe space to talk with @fields.child_nickname when you are both calm. Listen to their thoughts about why they feel a certain place is safe, and then share your thoughts on why you feel it is not safe. Think about making a rule together that allows them to still have fun but stay safe. Our children will listen better when we speak to them calmly.
text: Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukwehlelwa koku. Zama ukwenza indawo ekhuselekileyo  yokuthetha no @fields.child_nickname  xa nobabini nizolile. SourceText: 1. Close your eyes.
text: 1. Vala amehlo akho.

SourceText: 2. Take a deep breath in and let it go.
text: 2. Phefumla nzulu uze ukhuphe umoya.

SourceText: 3. Notice how you feel.
text: 3. Qaphela indlela oziva ngayo.

SourceText: 4. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out.
text: 4. Mamela umphefumlo wakho njengoko ungena kwaye uphuma.

SourceText: 5. When you are ready open your eyes again.
text: 5. Xa sele ulungile phinda uvule amehlo akho.

SourceText: 6. You are in control!
text: 6. Unolawulo!

SourceText: If you find yourself always having to give consequences to your children for behaving badly, you might need to spend more positive time with them. It will help them feel more loved and secure...and you less stressed!

SourceText: We all make mistakes! The more consistent we are with our consequences, the more likely our children will choose to behave positively in the future.

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel uncomfortable, confused, or even scared. Everyone feels this way at times. The WHO and UNICEF and websites and local COVID-19 hotlines are great places to find advice on how you and your family can stay safe during COVID-19.
text: Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukuziva ungakhululekanga, udidekile, okanye usoyika. Wonke umntu uziva kanje ngamanye amaxesha. I-WHO ne-UNICEF neewebhusaithi  kunye neminxeba yoncedo yengingqi ye-COVID-19 ziindawo ezigqwesileyo ongafumana kuzo icebo malunga nokuba ungahlala njani wena nosapho lwakho nikhuselekile ngexa le-COVID-19.

SourceText: It is completely normal for children to act out or react negatively during these unprecedented times. Give them space to share how they are feeling and let them know you are there for them. You can also try distracting them with fun activities and games.
text: Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukuba abantwana baziphathe kwaye kubekho into abayenzayo embi ngexa lala maxesha angekaze abonwe ngaphambili.  Banike isithuba sokwabelana ngokuba baziva njani kwaye ubazise ukuba ukholo bona.  Ungabaphazamisa kananjalo ngemisetyenzana yolonwabo nemidlalo.

note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! Every child has challenging behaviour sometimes. Would you like some tips on how to address these behaviours?
text: Molo! Umntwana ngamnye namaxesha unokuziphatha okucela umngeni Ungathanda ukufumana iingcebiso malunga nokuba ukulungisa njani oku kuziphatha?

SourceText: That is okay! You can always access parenting tips by typing "Help".
text: Kulungile! Ungasoloko ufikelela kwiingcebiso zokuba ngumzali ngokuchwetheza “Uncedo”.

SourceText: Remember that One-on-One time, praise for being good, and consistent routines will also help reduce difficult behaviours.
text: Khumbula ukuba iXesha loBuso ngoBuso, ncoma ngokwenza okulungileyo, kwaye izinto ezenziwa ngesiqhelo ezingatshintshiyo ziza kunceda ukwehlisa ukuziphatha okunzima.

SourceText: Hi @fields.user_name! How are you feeling?
text: Molo @fields.user_name! Uziva njani namhlanje?
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: Hi! How are you feeling?
text: Molo! Uziva njani namhlanje?

SourceText: Lovely! Take a breath just to appreciate the moment.
text: Kwakuhle ke oko! Phefumla nzulu ukubulela nje lo mzuzu.

SourceText: Marvellous! When you feel good, it is easier to keep it positive throughout the day.
text: Kuyamangalisa! Xa uzive kakuhle, kulula ukugcina iingcinga ezintle imini yonke.

SourceText: Everyone has challenging days, but you do not need experience it alone. Try reaching out to family and friends for support.
text: Wonke umntu uneentsuku ezicela umngeni, kodwa akufanelanga zikwehlelwe uwedwa. Zama ukufikelela kusapho nabahlobo ngenkxaso.

SourceText: It is completely normal to feel okay. You do not need to feel great everyday.
text: Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukuziva ulungile. Awunakude uzive kamnandi yonke imihla.

SourceText: Life is filled with ups and downs. It is important to recognise and accept how are you feeling. Please remember to be kind to yourself.
text: Ubomi bugcwele ngamahla ndinyuka. Kubalulekile ukuqonda kunye nokwamkela indlela oziva ngayo. Nceda ukhumbule ukuba nobubele kuwe.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing! All feelings, whether they are good, bad, or okay are welcome here.
text: Enkosi ngokwabelana! Zonke iimvakalelo, nokuba zintle okanye zimbi, okanye zilungile zamkelekile apha.

SourceText: We are made to feel different emotions, and learning to identify them is a great skill. Good job! You know we are here to support you.
text: Seznelwe ukuba sive iimvakalelo ezohlukeneyo, kwaye ukufunda ukuzazi sisakhono esigqwesileyo. Umsebenzi omhle! Uyazi ukuba silapha ukuxhasa wena.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing how you are feeling today. If you would like, try this relaxation activity that can help recenter and ground your emotions.
text: Enkosi ngokusixelela ngendlela oziva ngayo namhlanje. Ukuba ungathanda, zama lo msetyenzana wokuphumla enokuknceda ususe kwaye ubeke phantsi iimvakalelo zakho.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing how you are feeling. Is there anything someone can do to help you feeling better? If so, try reaching out to them, a support system is so important.
text: Enkosi ngokusixelela ngendlela oziva ngayo namhlanje. Ingaba ikhona into angayenza umntu ukukunceda uzive ngcono? Ukuba kunjalo, ukufikelela kubo, abantu abakuxhasayo kubaluleke kakhulu.

SourceText: We have all experienced difficult days, but remember its important to experience all emotions. Try to do something that can help you feel better, like going for a walk or talking to someone you care about.
text: Zisehlele sonke iintsuku ezinzima, kodwa khumbula ukuba kubalulekile ukwehlelwa zizo zonke iimvakalelo. Zama ukwenza into enokukunceda uzive ngcono, njengokuhamba hamba okanye ukuthetha nomntu  omkhathaleleyo.

SourceText: That is excellent news. When you feel good, your family around you also feels good!
text: Zindaba ezigqwesileyo ezo. Xa uziva kakuhle, usapho olukujikelezileyo luziva kakuhle ngokunjalo!

SourceText: We all experience days where we just feel fine, and that is completely okay!
text: Sonke ziyasehlela iintsuku esiziva silungile ngazo, kwaye kulunge ngokupheleleyo oko!

SourceText: You should not feel pressured to feel happy and great all the time. All feelings are valid and healthy!
text: Akufanele uzive ufakwe phantsi koxinzelelo lokuba uzive wonwabile kwaye ukwimo entle ngalo lonke ixesha. Zonke iimvakalelo zifanelekile kwaye zisempilweni!

SourceText: Feeling okay is perfectly normal. Try asking how your family members are feeling today. This can help everyone to understand each other better.
text: Ukuziva ulungile kuqheleke ngokugqibeleleyo. Zama ukuzibuza ukuba aziva njani namhlanje amalungu osapho lwakho. Oko kunokunceda wonke umntu aqonde omye ngcono.

SourceText: Part of keeping healthy is allowing yourself to feel all your emotions: the good, the bad, and the ones in the middle.
text: Inxenye yokuzigcina usempilweni kukuvuma ukuba uzive zonke iimvakalelo zakho, ezintle, ezimbi, kunye nezo ziphakathi.

SourceText: There are days when we just go with the flow and it is completely perfect.
text: Kukho iintsuku xa uvele uahmbe nje nomsinga kwaye kugqibelele ngokupheleleyo oku.

SourceText: It is completely normal to not feel great all the time. Parents all around the world have felt how you are feeling right now, and it is okay! You are doing great!
text: Kuqheleke ngokupheleleyo ukungaziva mnandi ngalo lonke ixesha. Abazali emhlabeni wonke bayivile indlela abaziva ngayo ngoku, kwaye kulungile oko! Uqhuba kakuhle!

SourceText: Just like everyone else, you are allowed to have days where they are not feeling great. Be gentle and patient with yourself. Tomorrow is a new day!
text: Njengaye nawuphi omnye umntu, uvumelekle ukuba ube neentsuku abaziva bengemnandi ngazo. Yiba nonophelo kwaye ube nomonde kuwe. Lusuku olutsha ngomso!

SourceText: Having a bad day is not a reflection of your abilities or of you as a parent. Just showing up shows you care.
text: Ukuba nosuku olubi akubonakalisi izakhono zakho okanye wena njengomzali. Ukuvela nje kubonakalisa ukuba uyakhathala.

SourceText: We all have difficult days that make us feel upset. Remember to be kind to yourself and others during these days. How you are feeling is not a representation of your abilities!
text: Sonke sineentsuku ezimbi ezisenza sizive sikhathazekile Khumbula ukuba nobubele kuwe kunye nakwabanye ngezi ntsuku. Indlela oziva ngayo ayikokubonakalisa izakhono zakho!

SourceText: We all have bad days, and we know it can sometimes be difficult to deal with your emotions. Learning how to cope with them in a posiitve way, sets you aside from others. If you have a few minutes to spare, use them to take care of yourself and focus on your breathing. Take this time to reflect on your feelings and try and redirect these emotions into something positive.
text: Sonke sinazo iintsuku ezimbi, kwaye siyazi ukuba kunokuba nzima ngamanye amaxesha ukumelana neemvakalelo zakho. Ukufunda ukuba umelana njani nazo ngendlela entle, kukubeka ecaleni kwabanye. Ukuba ngaba ubekela ecaleni imizuzu embalwa, yisebenzise ukuzikhathalela kwaye ujolise ekuphefumleni kwakho. Thatha ixesha ukucinga nzulu ngeemvakalelo zakho kwaye uzame ukuzitshintsha ezi mvakalelo zibe yinto entle.

SourceText: Learning to identify and accept your emotions will allow you to build a stronger relationship with yourself, your family and your community. Well done!
text: Ukufunda ukuchonga kunye nokwamkela iimvakaleo zakho kuza kwenza ukuba wakhe ubudlelwane obomeleleyo nawe, usapho lwakho kunye noluntu lwakho.  Usebenzile!

SourceText: Here is a short relaxation activity for you:
text: Nanku umsebenzi omfutshane wokukuphumlisa:

SourceText: Do you ever feel something so strongly that you want to run away from it? Here's a short activity that might help!
text: Wake weva into ngamandla kangangokuba ufune ukubaleka umke kuyo? Nanku umsetyenzana omfutshane onokukunceda!

SourceText: This activity uses the magic power of three breaths to stay connected and relaxed.
text: Lo msetyenzana usebenzisa amandla obugqi wokuphefumla kathathu ukuze uhlale unxulumene kwaye uphumle.

SourceText: Here's an activity to relax your body:
text: Nanku umsetyenzana  wokuphumlisa umzimba wakho:

SourceText: Here is a quick relaxation activity...
text: Nanku umsetyenzana okhawulezayo wokukuphumlisa ...

SourceText: How many sounds can you hear? Listen to the sounds inside and outside the room. Count them on your fingers.
text: Zingaphi izandi onokuziva? Mamela izandi ezingaphakathi nangaphandle kwegumbi. Zibale usebenzisa iminwe yakho.

SourceText: Try again for another ten seconds. Did you hear any new sounds? Did you hear any sounds inside your own body? Notice how you feel now.
text: Zama eminye imizuzwana elishumi. Ngaba uve naziphi izandi ezitsha? Zikhona izandi ozivileyo ngaphakathi komzimba wakho? Qaphela indlela oziva ngayo  ngoku.

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three.
text: Phefumlela ngaphakathi uze ubale kathathu.

SourceText: Instead of moving away from the feeling, let’s move towards it for a moment.
text: Endaweni yokubhekela kwimvakalelo, makhe sisondele kuyo okomzuzwana.

SourceText: It’s ok. Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath.
text: Kulungile. Vala amehlo akho ukuba uziva ukhululekile. Phefumla nzulu.

SourceText: Become curious. Where are you feeling it in your body? Is it hot or cold? Hard or soft? Tight or loose?
text: Funa ukwazi. Uyiva ndawoni emzimbeni wakho? Ngaba kushushu okanye kuyabanda? Kuqinile okanye kuthambile? Kubambekile okanye kuyekeyeke?

SourceText: Ask yourself some questions. What is it telling me? What does it need? How can I be kind to myself in this moment?
text: Zibuze imibuzo ethile. Indixelela ntoni? Ifuna ntoni? Ndinganobubele njani kum ngalo mzuzu?

SourceText: If your mind starts to wander, it’s normal. Just bring it back to the feeling. Keep breathing and feeling.
text: Ukuba ngaba ingqondo yakho iyaqala ukubhadula, kuqhelekile. Yibuyisele kwimvakalelo. Qhuba uphefumla kwaye usiva.

SourceText: Reassure yourself. It’s ok to feel. Feeling is healing!
text: Ziqinisekise. Kulungile ukuva. Imvakalelo iyaphilisa!

SourceText: Notice your connection with the ground beneath you.
text: Qaphela indlela onxibelelene ngayo kunye nomhlaba ongaphantsi kwakho.

SourceText: What parts of your body touch the ground? What parts of your body don’t?
text: Ngawaphi amalungu omzimba wakho achukumisa umhlaba? Ngawaphi angawuchukumisiyo?

SourceText: Notice where it feels warm and where it feels cool.
text: Qaphela  apho kufudumele khona nalapho kuphole khona.

SourceText: Feel the ground underneath you supporting you. Let your body sink into the support of the ground.
text: Yiva umhlaba ongaphantsi kwakho nokuxhasayo. Vumela umzimba wakho wehle ukuze uxhaswe ngumhlaba.

SourceText: Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.
text: Phefumlela ngaphakathi ubale kathathu. 1, 2, 3.

SourceText: Breath out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.
text: Phefumlela ngaphandle uze ubale uphele kwisithathu. 1, 2, 3.

SourceText: Sit comfortably and close your eyes if you can.
text: Hlala kwindawo entofontofo uze uvale amehlo akho ukuba unako.

SourceText: Imagine a golden ring scanning your body from your feet to your head.
text: Yiba nombono weringi yegolide iskena umzimba wakho wonke ukusuka ezinyaweni zakho ukuya entloko.

SourceText: Pay attention as it moves up and down your body. Are there any areas that feel tense? Numb? Painful?
text: Nikela ingqalelo njengoko isehla inyuka kumzimba wakho. Ngaba zikhona indawo ezingathi ziqinile? Zindindisholo? Zibuhlungu?

SourceText: Focus on those areas for a moment. Breathe in to the area and when you breathe out, try to let go of any tension or pain.
text: Jolisa  kwezo ndawo okomzuzwana. Phefumlela ngaphakathi kuloo ndawo uze xa uphefumlela ngaphandle, uzame ukukhupha nayiphi intlungu okanye ukuqina.

SourceText: Do this for a few breaths.
text: Kwenze oku ngokuphefumla kambalwa.

SourceText: Open your eyes. How does your body feel now?
text: Vula amehlo akho. Uziva njani ngoku umzimba wakho?

SourceText: Try this next time you find yourself lying in bed unable to sleep!
text: Kuzame kwakhona oku kwixesha elilandelayo uzifumanisa ulele ebhedini ubuthongo bungehli!

SourceText: Listen to the sounds.
text: Mamela izandi.

SourceText: Connection with the ground.
text: Unxulumano nomhlaba.

SourceText: Notice how you feel now.
text: Qaphela indlela oziva ngayo  ngoku.

SourceText: How do you feel now? Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down.
text: Uziva njani ngoku? Ngaba uziva ngendlela eyahlukileyo? Ukuphefumla nzulu kunceda wonke umzimba kunye nengqondo yethu ukuba zizole.

SourceText: Dealing with difficult feelings.
text: Ukumelana neemvakalelo ezinzima.

SourceText: Body relaxation.
text: Ukuphumza umzimba.

SourceText: It’s ok to feel. Feeling is healing!
text: Kulungile ukuva. Imvakalelo iyaphilisa!

SourceText: Let’s use the magic power of three to stay present and relax. At the end of a tough day, thinking of three things to be grateful for can help us find the courage to try again tomorrow.
text: Masisebenzise amandla amangalisayo enani elisisithathu ukuze sihlale silapha size siphumle. Emva kosuku olunzima, ukucinga ezi zinto zintathu esinombulelo ngazo kungasinceda sibe nesibindi sokuzama kwakhona ngomso.

SourceText: Here's a short relaxation activity to end the day:
text: Nanku umsebenzi omfutshane wokuphetha usuku:

SourceText: Let's take a moment to stop what you are doing and connect with your breath.
text: Thatha umzuzu uze uyeke into oyenzayo ukuze unxibelelane nokuphefumla kwakho.

SourceText: What is one thing you can be grateful for right now?
text: Yeyiphi into enye onombulelo ngayo ngoku?

SourceText: What is one thing that brings you happiness?
text: Yeyiphi into enye ekwenza wonwabe?

SourceText: What is one thing that you love?
text: Yeyiphi into enye oyithandayo?

SourceText: They don't have to be big. Sometimes the small things in life count the most!
text: Akunyanzelekanga ibe zizinto ezinkulu. Ngamanye amaxesha izinto ezincinci ebomini zezona zibaluleke kakhulu!

SourceText: At the end of the day, take a minute to think about the day.
text: Ekupheleni kosuku ngalunye, thatha umzuzu ucinge ngolu suku.

SourceText: Think about one positive or fun thing you did.
text: Cinga ngento ekhuthazayo okanye emnandi oye wayenza.

SourceText: Think of one thing you can do differently tomorrow.
text: Cinga ngento enye onokuyenza ngendlela eyahlukileyo ngomso.

SourceText: Think of one thing that you are grateful for.
text: Cinga ngento enye onombulelo ngayo.

SourceText: Do you sometimes feel like you are getting everything wrong?  Here's a short activity that might help!
text: Ingaba ngamanye amaxesha unemvakalelo yokuba ufumana yonke into ngokungachanekanga?  Nanku umsetyenzana omfutshane onokukunceda!

SourceText: The magic power of three.
text: Umlingo wamandla esithathu.

SourceText: Close your eyes and think about the day. Name 1 thing that you are grateful for. Name 1 thing that you did well. Name 1 think that you love. You earned a goodnight of sleep!
text: Vala amehlo akho uze ucinge ngosuku olulandelayo. Chaza into e-1 onombulelo ngayo. Chaza into e-1 oyenze kakuhle. Chaza into e-1 oyithandayo. Ufumane ukulala ubuthongo obumnandi!

SourceText: Take a moment to think over the day. Think of one thing you did today that you are proud of.
text: Thatha umzuzu wokucinga kusuku. Cinga ngento enye oyenzileyo namhlanje oziva unebhongo  ngayo.

SourceText: Wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Songa iingalo zakho emzimbeni wakho uze uzange.

SourceText: Think of one thing you did today that you don’t feel proud of. What can you do differently tomorrow?
text: Cinga ngento enye oyenzileyo namhlanje oziva ungenabhongo  ngayo. Yintoni ongayenza ngokwahlukileyo ngomso?

SourceText: And wrap your arms around your body and give yourself a hug.
text: Uze usonga iingalo zakho emzimbeni wakho uze uzange.

SourceText: Connect with your breath.
text: Nxulumana nomphefumlo wakho.

SourceText: Take a minute to think about the day.
text: Thatha umzuzu ucinge ngosuku lwakho.

SourceText: End of the day.
text: Ekupheleni kosuku

SourceText: Be kind to yourself.
text: Yiba nobubele kuwe.

SourceText: You earned a goodnight of sleep!
text: Ufumene ukulala ubuthongo obumnandi!

SourceText: It’s ok. You are doing your best so be kind to yourself. Get some rest and try again tomorrow!
text: Kulungile. Wenza konke okusemandleni akho ukuba nobubele kuwe. Phumla uze uzame kwakhona ngomso!

SourceText: Do your children ever make you feel like screaming? Give yourself a 10-second pause.
text: Ngaba abantwana bakho bakhe bakwenze ngathi ufuna ukukhwaza? Phumla imizuzwana eli-10.

SourceText: Have you only got 30 seconds? Let's take a quick pause together. It might be helpful.
text: Ufumane kuphela imizuzwana engama-30? Make siphumle kunye ngokukhawuleza. Kunokuba luncedo..

SourceText: Do you sometimes feel your feelings are too much?
text: Ingaba ngamanye amaxesha uke uve ukuba iimvakalelo zakho zigqithisile?

SourceText: Talk to someone.
text: Thetha nomntu.

SourceText: Talk to someone you trust. Talk to a friend. Talk to family. Talk to a plant.
text: Thetha nomntu omthembayo. Thetha nomhlobo. Thetha nosapho. Thetha nesityalo.

SourceText: Get your worries off your chest and then let them go. Even if it’s just for a moment.
text: Khupha oko kukukhathazayo esifubeni sakho ukwenze kuhambe. Nokuba ngumzuzwana na.

SourceText: How do you feel now?
text: Uziva njani ngoku?

SourceText: A joy shared is twice the joy. A problem shared is half the problem.
text: Uvuyo ekwabelana ngalo luvuyo oluphindiweyo. Ingxaki ekwabelwana ngayo sisiqingatha kwingxaki.

SourceText: Here is something fun to help you let go of stress:
text: Nantsi into  elulonwabo yokukunceda uyeke ukuba noxinzelelo:

SourceText: Sit down, close your eyes and listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel. When you are ready open your eyes again.
text: Hlala phantsi, vala amehlo akho uze umamele umphefumlo wakho njengoko uwungenisa ngaphakathi kwaye uwukhuphela ngaphandle. Qaphela indlela oziva ngayo. Xa sele ulungile phinda uvule amehlo akho.

SourceText: Breath in and out slowly 5 times. Then try responding in a calmer way.
text: Phefumlela ngaphakathi kwaye ngokucotha ngaphandle amaxesha ama-5. Emva koko zama ukusabela ngendlela ezolileyo.

SourceText: Choose a song that reflects what you need in this moment. Do you need a gentle song to soothe your tired soul or an upbeat song to help you shake some stress out?
text: Khetha iculo elibonisa into oyifunayo ngoku. Ufuna iculo  elipholileyo ukuze lipholise umphefumlo wakho odiniweyo okanye ingoma edlamkileyo ukuze ikwenze ukhuphe uxinzelelo lwakho?

SourceText: Make a space and move your body to the music. Remember to breathe while you move. Let your breath and the movement go together.
text: Vula isithuba uze ujuxuzele umculo. Ungalibali ukuphefumla xa ushukuma. Ukuphefumla kunye nokushukuma kwakho makuhambelane.

SourceText: Even a few minutes of movement can be enough to release stress and lift your mood!
text: Nemizuzwana embalwa na yokushukuma ingonela  ukukhuphe uxinzelelo uze uzive ngcono!

SourceText: Choose a song that reflects what you need.
text: Khetha iculo elibonisa into oyifunayo ngoku.

SourceText: Five deep breaths.
text: Phefumla nzulu kahlanu.

SourceText: Listen to your breath.
text: Mamela umphefumlo wakho

SourceText: When feelings are too much.
text: Xa iimvakalelo zigqithisile.

SourceText: Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.
text: Izigidi zabazali bathi oku kuyanceda - KAKHULU.

SourceText: Try this whenever you are feeling stressed and you need a break to reconnect.
text: Kuzameni oko nanini na niziva ninoxinzelelo xinezelekile kwaye nifuna ikhefu lokunxulumana kwakhona.

SourceText: That's wonderful! We are happy to hear that you are feeling good.
text: Kuyamangalisa! Kuyasivuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kakuhle.

SourceText: That's wonderful! I am happy to hear that you are feeling good.
text: Kuyamangalisa! Kuyandiivuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kakuhle.

SourceText: We are sorry to hear that you are not feeling great today. Remember to take it one day at the time. Tomorrow is a new day.
text: Sibuhlungu ukuva ukuba awuziva mnandi namhlanje. Khumbula ukuthatha inyathelo elinye ngosuku. Lusuku olutsha ngomso.

SourceText: I am sorry to hear that you are not feeling great today. Remember to take it one day at the time. Tomorrow is a new day.
text: Ndibuhlungu ukuva ukuba awuziva mnandi namhlanje. Khumbula ukuthatha inyathelo elinye ngosuku. Lusuku olutsha ngomso.

SourceText: Hooray! We are delighted to hear that you are doing well.
text: Hureee! Kumnandi ukuva ukuba uqhuba kakuhle.

SourceText: Hooray! I am delighted to hear that you are doing well.
text: Hureee! Kumnandi ukuva ukuba uqhuba kakuhle.

SourceText: Fabulous! We are so happy to hear this.
text: Kwakuhle! Siyavuya ukuva oku.

SourceText: Fabulous! I am so happy to hear this.
text: Kwakuhle! Ndiyavuya ukuva oku.

SourceText: What a great feeling! We hope that good feeling continues throughout the entire day.
text: Enjani yona ukuba mnandi imvakalelo! Siyathemba ukuba imvakalelo emnandi iza kuqhuba usuku lonke.

SourceText: What a great feeling! I hope that good feeling continues throughout the entire day.
text: Enjani yona ukuba mnandi imvakalelo! Ndiyathemba ukuba imvakalelo emnandi iza kuqhuba usuku lonke.

SourceText: We are glad to hear this! We are sure your family is happy to see you this way as well.
text: Siyavuya ukuva oku! Siqinisekile ukuba luyavuya ukukubona unje ngokunjalo usapho lwakho.

SourceText: I am glad to hear this! I am sure your family is happy to see you this way as well.
text: Ndiyavuya ukuva oku!. Ndiqinisekile ukuba luyavuya ukukubona unje ngokunjalo usapho lwakho.

SourceText: What fantastic news! We hope you continue to feel good throughout the day.
text: Ezinjani zona ukuba mnandi iindaba! Siyathemba ukuba uza kuqhuba ukuziva kamnandi kanje imini yonke.

SourceText: What fantastic news! I hope you continue to feel good throughout the day.
text: Ezinjani zona ukuba mnandi iindaba! Ndiyathemba ukuba uza kuqhuba ukuziva kamnandi kanje imini yonke.

SourceText: It makes us very happy to hear that you are feeling good! Take that good energy and share it with others!
text: Kuyandiivuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kakuhle. Thatha loo mandla uze wabelane ngawo nabanye!

SourceText: It makes me very happy to hear that you are feeling good! Take that good energy and share it with others!
text: Kuyandiivuyisa ukuva ukuba uziva kakuhle. Thatha loo mandla uze wabelane ngawo nabanye!
